title: Director of Product, Anaconda Core
description:
**Role:** Director of Product, Anaconda Core


**Reports to:** Sr. Director of Product


**Department:** Product


**Location:** Remote, US


**Job Type:** Full Time, Exempt

  


**Be at the center of AI**

  



With more than 40 million users, Anaconda is the world's most popular data science platform and the foundation of modern AI development. We pioneered the use of Python for data science, championed its vibrant community, and continue to steward open-source projects that make tomorrow's innovations possible. Our enterprise-grade solutions enable corporate, research, and academic institutions around the world to harness the power of open source for competitive advantage, groundbreaking research, and a better world.



Anaconda is seeking people who want to be at the center of Artificial Intelligence. Candidates should be knowledgeable and capable, but always eager to learn more and to teach others.



Here is why people love most about working here: We're not just a company, we're part of a movement. Our dedicated employees and user community are democratizing data science and creating and promoting open-source technologies for a better world, and our commercial offerings make it possible for enterprise users to leverage the most innovative output from open source in a secure, governed way.

  


**Summary**



Anaconda is seeking a talented **Director of Product, Anaconda Core** to join our rapidly-growing company. This is an excellent opportunity for you to leverage your experience and skills and apply it to the world of data science and machine learning. As our Director of Product, Anaconda Core you will be involved in overseeing the development and management of Anaconda's public package repository, the Anaconda distribution, our contributions to the conda project, and our custom package business. This role will have a combination of strategic planning, product management, partner management, and team leadership.

  


**What You'll Do:**


* Lead the team accountable for distribution, package building, package repository, and presentation of the Anaconda Distribution to customers
* Responsible for our Anaconda Embedded product offering and partnerships
* Build and lead a high-performing team of product managers to grow our distribution business
* Define and execute the strategy for Anaconda Python and R packages and repositories
* Engage with our community of open source conda contributors to solidify conda as the premier tool for environment and package management in AI
* Manage strategic partnerships with hardware and platform partners to build and maintain customized conda packages
* Represent our package ecosystem as a business to the company, Set the organizations KPIs and OKRs.

  


**What You Need:**


* Leadership / people management experience
* 8+ Years of product management experience
* Technical background or undergraduate degree
* Understanding of how the open source software ecosystem works
* Team attitude: "I am not done until WE are done"
* Embody our core values:
+ Great People
+ Great Product
+ Great Performance

* Care deeply about fostering an environment where people of all backgrounds and experiences can flourish

  


**What Will Make You Stand Out:**


* Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment
* Experience working in a open-source or data science-oriented company
* Understanding of python packaging and the packaging ecosystem
* Agile experience - Scrum / Kanban

  


**Why You'll Like Working Here:**


* Unique opportunity to translate strong open-source adoption and user enthusiasm into commercial product growth
* Dynamic company that rewards high performers
* On the cutting edge of enterprise application of data science, machine learning and AI
* Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and clear thinking
* Employees-first culture
* Flexible working hours
* Medical\\*, Dental\\*, Vision\\*, HSA\\*, Life\\* and 401K\\*
* Paid parental leave - both parents
* Monthly productivity stipend
* Pre-IPO stock options
* Open vacation policy\\*
* Quarterly Snake days (company-wide bonus day off)
* 100% remote


* FTE employees based on your region


*An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.*


*Anaconda, Inc. ("We", "Us") are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. This Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to Us, will be processed by Us in connection with Our recruitment processes. By clicking "Submit Application", you acknowledge you have read our Privacy Policy and that Anaconda can retain your application data for up to 1-year, unless otherwise stated. For the purpose of the General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR") ") and the version of the GDPR retained in UK law (the "UK GDPR") the Data Controller is Sydney Artt.*

title: Director, Insurance, Safety and Risk Management in Retail Industry
description:
**Position Description**

The Director of Risk reports to our Chief Accounting Officer and will be a business partner who adds value by seeking ways to proactively monitor and manage risk and reduce claims in across the business. This role will help set the strategic vision for risk management, collaborate with stakeholders to execute against the vision, and monitor progress towards goals. This leader will exhibit strong business process knowledge, possess a broad-based operational perspective, and proactively provide solutions for any

and all related risk issues.

**Position Requirements**

This role is responsible for Four (4) key areas of risk management, including:

**CLAIMS MANAGEMENT**

 Leads the team that develops and maintains policies and procedures applicable to GL/WC claim handling.

 Oversees the relationship and leads the direction of the Third-Party Claims Administrator in the handling of outsourced claims ensuring adherence to service level agreements.

 Leads the internal teams on GL/WC/Non-Subscriber matters to help identify adverse trends, mitigate exposures, and educate management.

 Work with accounting department in establishing and monitoring actuarial reserves.

 Management of Property claim submissions and recovery from insurance.

**SAFETY PERFORMANCE AND IMPROVEMENTS**

 Leads Safety in partnership with the field team to help identify claim root causes and loss trends to reduce both frequency and severity as well as minimize OSHA exposure.

 Supports corporate safety mission through the development or enhancement of safety

programs.

 Leads the safety team in conducting audits in store and operations buildings and monitors findings for improvements or further action as required.

**INSURANCE**

 Secures companywide insurance, (e.g., Casualty, Property, Cyber, Fiduciary, etc.) through

cultivating broker and carrier relationships to ensure the best-in-class coverage and rates for the company. Responsible for all underwriting information and submissions required for renewal of insurance programs.

 Leads the annual renewal for all Risk and Liability insurance coverages in partnership with leadership and outside brokers. Review and approve insurance requirements for company contracts and leases.

 Oversee all loss control activities, including audits and surveys.

 Corporate liaison for commercial insurance matters. Provides subject matter expertise and guidance.

**ENTERPRISE RISK MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLANNING & CRISIS MANAGEMENT**

**Director, Insurance, Safety and Risk Management**

 Rolls out and monitors the Enterprise Risk Management processes, ensuring annual refreshes of risk landscape and responses, working with risk owners and their delegates to ensure plans are in place to monitor KPIs associated with these risks and plans.

 Facilitate annual refresh of the Crisis Management plan, including training and rollout of

associated plans and tools across the organization.

 Facilitate annual refresh of Business Continuity Plans across the organization, including

partnering with IT on incorporation of Disaster Recovery considerations.

**Skills, Abilities, Experience & Qualifications**

 Bachelor’s or another relevant Degree required.

 12+ years of experience, with 7-10 years in a risk management leadership role.

 Previous experience in large, self-insured programs, including self-administered litigated claims experience strongly preferred.

 CPCU, ARM, and/or CRM credentials desirable.

 Effective and results driven leader, who is dynamic, proactive, and decisive. Adapts well to and initiates change in the organization.

 Executive presence with demonstrated ability to lead change and drive execution; exceptional interpersonal and communication skills needed to effectively share and engage internal stakeholders and clinical areas with the most relevant data.

 Strong understanding of Workers Compensation, General Liability, Non-Subscriber, Property, and other risk programs.

 Financial acumen for insurance procurement, budgeting, and all aspects of risk management including actuarial analysis, allocation of risk programs, claim trend analysis and management reporting.

 Goal-driven leader who maintains a productive climate and confidently motivates, mobilizes, and coaches employees to meet high performance standards.

 Results-driven achiever with exemplary planning and organizational skills, along with strong attention to detail.

 Flexible and responsive to change or unpredictable events.

**Note:** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications associated with this job.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $90.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* risk management: 10 years (Required)
* CLAIMS MANAGEMENT and INSURANCE: 7 years (Required)
* ENTERPRISE RISK Mngmt INCLUDING BUSINESS CONTINUITY PLANNING: 7 years (Required)
* Workers Comps, General Liability, Non-Subscriber, Property: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Product Operations
description:
Apollo.io is the leading go-to-market solution for revenue teams, trusted by over 500,000 companies and millions of users globally, from rapidly growing startups to some of the world's largest enterprises. Apollo.io provides sales and marketing teams with easy access to verified contact data for over 270 million B2B contacts, along with tools to engage and convert these contacts in one unified platform. By helping revenue professionals find the most accurate contact information and automating the outreach process, Apollo.io turns prospects into customers. Apollo raised a series D in 2023 and is backed by top-tier investors, including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, and more, and counts the former President and COO of Hubspot, JD Sherman, among its board members. Apollo.io is growing rapidly, with 900% revenue growth since 2021, and is looking for world-class talent to keep building with us.


**About the Role**
------------------



As the Director of Product Operations, you will play a critical role in shaping and overseeing the operational aspects of our product development lifecycle and ensuring the R&D teams are enabled the build the best possible products for our customers. Your main focus will be on the cross-divisional ownership of the product journey, including roadmap planning, release processes, and driving the operational rhythm of every R&D function (Product, Engineering, Design, and Research). You will work closely with Go-To-Market (GTM) Operations and Product Management teams to ensure that our product operations are streamlined, effective, and aligned with our business goals.


**What You’ll do**
------------------


**Systems, Processes and Planning**


* Drive the quarterly OKR and project planning operating cadence and processes to ensure all R&D departments, teams and individuals have clear goals and North Star Metric targets across any given planning quarter.
* Document and work with all R&D teams on the adoption of agile best practices and invest in continuous enablement and onboarding for agile best practices.
* Partner with Engineering and Product teams to set and enforce bug definition / triage processes + track bug resolution
* Set and enforce experimentation / product release best practices
* Build and maintain the core tools the R&D teams use to power project management, planning activities, and more


**Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC) and Roadmap Alignment**


* Maintain, iterate upon, and continue to enable all R&D teams (and all R&D adjacent teams like Product Marketing and Business Intelligence) on the Product Development Lifecycle.
* Create a unified roadmap for everything due to ship over the next 6-12 weeks and ensure all important release info is available both within R&D and across the company
* Ensure all large product releases have a thorough release plan with success criteria and checkpoints and are communicated internally to all relevant GTM teams


**Data / Analytics for Core Product Releases / Experiments (in partnership with BI / Finance)**


* Refresh and maintain reporting for North Star Metrics for all R&D teams and priority workstreams.
* Ensure that all R&D experiments maintain reporting and readouts at the end of an experimentation period
* Periodic deep-dives into P0/P1 KPI performance or specific experiments
* Drive reporting and retrospectives across all Engineering squads to give insight into key productivity / efficiency metrics


**Run R&D Dept-Level Rituals and Operating Cadence**


* Plan and drive all R&D leadership, cross-functional, and All-Hands meetings
* Drive all R&D product and design review meetings

**About You**
-------------


* You have a minimum of 10 total years of relevant experience (technology marketing, sales, or consulting) and 5+ years of direct product and / or product operations experience with a track record of advancement and team leadership
* **Highly analytical**: Strong analytical skills, including fluency with Microsoft Excel and BI tools like Looker, Tableau, and/or Amplitude. Knowledge of SQL is strongly preferred but not required.
* **Intellectual Rigor**: Strong first principles thinker and someone who is able to drive efficient and rigorous analysis, research and insight generation, and building hypotheses and an action plan.
* **Able to build great systems, processes and ways of working**: Ability to solve complex business problems, think from first principles, and build scalable processes.
* **Excellent communicator**: Excellent communication skills to distill complex thoughts and strategies into simple, actionable recommendations.
* **Highly collaborative and strong team player with high EQ**: Ability to build trust quickly, high degree of empathy and expertise at managing senior, cross-functional relationships. Experience working closely with functional leaders to solve challenging business problems; credibly present and debate recommendations with senior leadership.
* **Bias towards action and Ownership mentality**: Someone who exhibits a strong results-oriented ownership mentality and owns both successes and failures / learnings in past experiences. Strong bias towards action and experimentation and ability to exhibit good judgment in ambiguous situations with imperfect data. We want someone in this role who is a “learn it all” as opposed to a “know it all”.
* **Strong product intuition and understanding of a variety of SaaS product verticals and markets** (doesn’t have to be specifically SalesTech or MarTech)

  



**What You’ll Love About Apollo**



Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

title: Director, IT Procurement (Remote)
description:
The ***Director, IT Procurement*** will be responsible for saving cost by negotiating favorable deals and reduce expenses related to the Information Technology (IT) function. Assess and mitigate supplier risks, ensuring compliance. Improve efficiency by streamlining processes and responding to market changes. Enhance supplier relations and maintain reliable supplier partnerships. Provide market insights and offer valuable industry knowledge. Control expenses and prevent overspending and budget overruns. Ensure compliance and promote ethical and legal practices. We are open to remote based candidates for this opportunity, Eastern/Central time zone preferred.

 **Reports To:** VP, Procurement

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Develop cost savings and strategic sourcing projects while ensuring business continuity and a high level of supplier performance.
* Manage spend, supplier, and market data from to effectively analyze both savings opportunity and value chain impacts.
* Lead all levels of supplier market RFI / RFP activities, including execution, readouts and business case implications. Meet with potential participants, both incumbents and non-incumbents, answer RFP related questions from vendors, analyze RFP results and support final vendor(s) awards.
* Drive annual productivity improvements in each category of spend by developing and ensuring implementation of ideas to optimize total cost of ownership (TCO) for spend categories.
* Support development of new policies and procedures to drive savings and lead organizational and operational change management within managed categories of spend.
* Support as well as lead sourcing events, including vendor sourcing, vendor and contract negotiations.
* Bring sourcing efficiency to all activity; define specific roadmaps containing prioritization of sourcing categories as well as expanding e-procurement catalogs.
* Lead research and analytics efforts to both validate savings projections and enable more precise supplier negotiations.
* Review major contracts for key areas of spend and act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) resource for planning and leading complex negotiations or re-supply modeling. Create procurement playbook as it relates to cyclical spending.
* Consistently monitor and evaluate savings against targets by category, sub-category, and supplier
* Develop PPV (product price variance) trackers to ensure improved price / savings baseline analysis.
* Develop and communicate functional supply chain or sourcing strategy to a diverse group of business stakeholders. Create alignment with group and articulate broader procurement transformation.
* Support necessary negotiations. Apply both experience and sourcing methodology, ensuring all buying complies with policies and procedures.
* Source suppliers and build a best-in-class supply chain; cultivate and manage relationships with best-in-class suppliers. Fully utilize all strategic levers within sourcing process and find new paths to value.
* Build supplier management and continuous improvement methodologies with key suppliers.
* Establish and implement a supplier management structure and process, audit and vet vendors.
* Work cross functionally to deliver sourcing and procurement cost savings, risk mitigation projects, and supplier enabled innovation.
* Aggressive focus on achieving overall category cost savings.

  



**Required Skills:**

* Experience managing category spend over $150MM annually.
* Building category strategies
* Contract negotiation and contract management
* Comfort and rigorous process in Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) modeling
* Ability to drive change management and gain consensus from stakeholders across several business units’ company wide.
* Experience in driving operational redesign process improvement initiatives.
* Must possess strong overall knowledge and understanding of business/contract issues and broad understanding of competitive products/services, technology, and market and industry issues.
* Knowledge of supplier ecosystems and markets that serve DBI.
* Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time.
* Must be detail oriented and able to deliver projects on time.
* High levels of supply chain and operational acumen, with demonstrated end-to-end understanding.
* Proficient in MS Office applications including Excel / financial analysis and PowerPoint / presentations.
* Strong problem solving and leadership skills.
* Entrepreneurial aptitude with a commitment to driving results.
* Demonstrated ability to develop relationships, communicate effectively and influence.
* Flexible and adaptable in a changing environment

 **Competencies:**

*STRATEGIC LEADERSHIP* – Deliberately communicates overall business strategy and connects it to the work of the functional team. Anticipates future trends and implications accurately. Leverages market knowledge to anticipate, capitalize on and drive change. Articulate credible pictures and visions of possibilities that will create sustainable value. Creates competitive and breakthrough strategies that show a clear connection between vision and action. Is willing to champion an idea or position despite dissent or political risk. Tackles tough issues, sharing sensitive messages or unpopular points of view effectively. Influences inside and outside of functional area for positive impact on business performance. Owns the development of successors and individuals who have potential for further development.

  



*LEADING & MOTIVATING* – Serves as a champion and driver of DSW Values and culture. Attracts and selects the best talent to meet current and future business needs. Motivates and inspires others through rewards, authentic connections, and meaningful recognition. Fosters diversity and an inclusive workplace where individual differences are valued and leveraged. Seeks new ways to evolve and challenge self. Develops team through delegation, challenges outside of the comfort zone and effective coaching and feedback. Shares ideas in a compelling manner that gains commitment. Champions change for positive impact on business results.

  

MANAGING FOR RESULTS – Establishes models and enforces accountability. Gets the most out of available resources and secures rare resources others cannot get. Anticipates and balances the needs of multiple stakeholders. Persists in accomplishing objectives. Pushes the team to elevate goals as results are achieved. Transforms functional area to achieve maximum results. Seizes opportunities and connects business insights to increase profit and revenue.

  



**Qualifications:**

**Experience:**

* Minimum of fifteen (15) years’ experience in indirect procurement, vendor management, and strategic sourcing with deep expertise in areas of the business assigned to support (e.g. Marketing, IT, Distribution & Logistics, etc.)

 **Preferred Qualifications:**

* Proven expertise implementing and managing change across all levels of an organization; prior implementation and adoption of eProcurement systems is a plus.

 **Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree required.
* Post graduate degree(s) a plus

  



#LI-Remote

title: Director of Infrastructure Operations
description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.  

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.
It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That's why we say, “when our customers prosper, we all win.”
DTN is looking for a Director of Infrastructure Operations to join our team. This position will be remote within the United States, and will oversee the IT help desk, IT Servers, and IT Operations teams.
 What You’ll Do:* Lead multiple teams using current tools and following current agile practices
* Provide leadership on the automation, design, implementation, and maintenance of our system infrastructure
* Guide, coach, motivate, and lead team to understand and deliver on business and career objectives
* Translate corporate security policies and guidelines into actionable security goals and tasks
* Lead technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure alignment on priorities and work through technical issues
* Provide proactive and clear communication to cross-functional leaders including developing mitigation plans and recommendations
* Drive a culture of high performance and ensure performance concerns are identified and addressed in a timely manner
* Actively contribute to managing and delivering on the current budget

 Experience:* 8+ years people management experience
* 3+ years of strong practical experience with both Agile and Scrum
* Experience with both Windows and Linux based systems
* Experince with Cloud providers like AWS and Azure
* Experience in handling multiple requirements from customers, product management, support and other key stakeholders and help negotiate the best possible solution to maximize product value with limited technical resources
* Experience in leading and providing mentoring, coaching and guidance
* Ability to work cross-functionally across multiple teams and departments – identifying any hurdles to progress and improving internal and cross-functional communications and processes
* Able to motivate, inspire and drive teams to drive a culture of excellence and pride of ownership
* Experience in working with Product Management to map product roadmaps to engineering schedules
* Experience with summarizing and presenting key information, and proven ability to influence and drive decisions at the executive level
* Strong customer service mindset and great attention to detail
* Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly, and master diverse web technologies and techniques
* Able to communicate effectively to a wide range of audiences and levels
* Strong understanding of the direction of technological innovation and ability to bring that expertise to the company

 Why You’ll Like Working Here:* Dynamic company that rewards high performers
* Be on the cutting edge of new technologies and services
* Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking
* Employees First culture
* Casual dress code
* Flexible working hours
* Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, Life, and matching 401K
* Unlimited PTO
*T**he targeted hiring base pay range for this position is between $* 131,250 *and* *$**175,000**. D**TN is a pay for performance organization, which means there is the opportunity to advance your compensation with performance over time. The actual base pay offered for this position will be dependent upon many factors, including but not limited to: prior work experiences, training/education, transferable skills, business needs, internal equity and applicable laws. The targeting hiring base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for market competitive variable pay and benefits.*
#LI-LM1
#LI-REMOTE
Why DTN?  

OUR VISION: To be the independent, trusted source of insights to our customers who feed, protect, and fuel the world.  

OUR MISSION: Empower our customers with intelligent and actionable insights that exceed their expectations and enable their success on a daily basis.  

OUR VALUES: Customer-Focused, Forward-Thinking, People-Centric, Solution-Oriented  

We have great benefits at DTN – apply today to find out more!  

At DTN, we are an equal opportunity employer. Come join us as we help feed, fuel, and protect the world!

title: Director, IT Programs & Compliance Management
description:
Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.


**What you'll be part of:**



Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

**What you'll be responsible for:**



The Director, IT Programs & Compliance Management will lead the IT intake, on time delivery, issue, program and escalation management of work requests across Circle. This role will ensure IT functions with on time delivery and communicates any hurdles to success. They will additionally program manage work generated to advance automations and efficiencies across IT. Responsibilities will include leading regular cadence of IT program meetings with partner teams and IT leadership. This role will additionally hold responsibility for partnering with the Risk and Compliance team to track, manage and ensure on time resolution of all IT risk related issues and audit findings. This person will work across the IT and Risk teams to ensure that policy and controls are accurately documented and followed within the IT organization. Responsibility for management, updates and closure of IT audit board assigned items will be required. This leader will work cross functionally to achieve results for the IT and partner organizations. Responsibilities for corporate wide IT communications will be included in this role. We're looking for an energetic people-person to be able to interface enthusiastically with all levels of leadership and users across Circle.


**What you'll work on:**


* Lead work intake for IT program requests to ensure accurate and complete requirements
* Lead and facilitate IT program tracking, meeting cadence and resolution of issues to ensure on time delivery
* Manage timely escalations to IT leadership and partner teams regarding hurdles or issues relative to delivery
* Facilitate management and closure of all IT risk related audit findings, issues, controls per delivery dates
* Provide communication and training to employees, both formal and ad hoc, relative to IT deployments and associated impacts
* Continuing to grow IT credibility and transparency with business partners


**You will aspire to our four core values:**


* **Multistakeholder -** you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
* **Mindful -** you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
* **Driven by Excellence -** you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
* **High Integrity -** you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.


**What you'll bring to Circle:**


* Exceptional interpersonal skills across all levels of employees and leadership
* Deep Experience in managing the IT work intake process to ensure complete and accurate requirements are understood and delivery dates are agreed upon across IT and stakeholders
* 10+ years experience with IT program management, issue resolution and escalation to executive leadership both in IT and across partner organizations
* 10 + years working in Technology related business, understanding of Cloud infrastructures and SaaS
* 5+ years working in highly regulated financial industries with first hand knowledge of Risk Management, lines of defense
* Experience communicating IT implementations and associated impacts to a corporate wide audience
* Understanding of IT frameworks for ITIL (Incident, Change, Service, Problem), Asset management
* Past experience with corporate programs for ERP, HR, Legal systems a plus


**Additional Information:**


* This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.


*Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.*


*Starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.*


*Base Pay Range: $190,000 - $242,500*


*Annual Bonus Target: 20%*


*Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.*


We are an **equal opportunity employer** and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the **E-Verify Program** in certain locations, as required by law.


###### 
#LI-Remote

title: Vice President of Information Technology
description:
**Vice President of Information Technology**

**Summary…**
============


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Vice President of Information Technology to oversee our company's IT infrastructure, hardware, networking, cloud-based systems, internal software (including email and Office 365), and other technology-related assets. The Vice President of Information Technology is a strategic position and is responsible for ensuring the security, availability, and continuity of our technology systems to support the organization's operations and strategic objectives. This role requires strong leadership, technical expertise, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

  



This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned technology professional to take on a strategic leadership role and make a significant impact on the company's technology landscape. The Vice President of Information Technology will play a critical role in ensuring the security, reliability, and efficiency of our IT infrastructure and systems while driving innovation and continuous improvement. This role is remote with travel as needed.

**The Gig…**
============

* Lead (by example) and manage a team of IT professionals, providing guidance, coaching, and performance feedback for meaningful career growth.
* Routinely demonstrate our core values to best serve our mission and achieve our vision.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand technology needs and develop IT strategies aligned with business objectives. This is a high-level role that focuses on long-term planning, setting overall strategic direction and goals and defining the roadmap for the IT department.
* Oversee the company's technology infrastructure, including hardware, networking, servers, storage, and Microsoft Azure cloud-based systems, supporting more than 600 end users in multiple locations.
* Manage and maintain internal software systems, including email, Office 365, collaboration tools, and other business applications.
* Lead and manage IT-related projects, ensuring successful project delivery within scope, budget, and timeline.
* Oversee an internal help desk for technical support and troubleshooting.
* Work with the CISO to maintain and implement IT security policies, procedures, and controls to safeguard company data and systems from unauthorized access, breaches, and cyber threats.
* Oversee risk management and compliance efforts related to IT systems and data. Ensure that IT operations adhere to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and security protocols. Implement IT governance frameworks and mitigate IT-related risks.
* Apply expertise to configure and manage Platform as a Service (PAAS) solutions as needed, ensuring optimal performance and resource utilization.
* Collaborate with development teams to streamline deployment processes and enhance application scalability.
* Oversee, maintain, test, and evolve the IT disaster recovery and business continuity plans to ensure the availability of critical systems and data.
* Conduct daily standup meetings with the network infrastructure team to discuss ongoing activities, address challenges, and promote efficient communication.
* Oversee vendor relationships, including contract negotiation, service level agreements, and performance evaluation.
* Stay up to date with industry best practices, standards, and regulations related to IT infrastructure, security, and business continuity. Evaluate emerging technologies and trends to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
* Assist in managing the IT budget, ensuring cost-effective utilization of resources.

**Our Needs…**
==============

* Strong background in technology including hardware, software, networking, and Microsoft products and cloud solutions (Microsoft Azure, Office 365).
* Proven track record of success in directing an IT operation.
* Demonstrated ability to apply IT in solving business problems.
* Demonstrated success in leadership, team building, mentoring, coaching, and supervising IT professionals and fostering a positive work culture.
* Experience in developing and implementing IT security policies and procedures.
* Experience in managing disaster recovery and business continuity plans.

**Our Wants…**
==============

* Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skills.
* A mindset for innovation and continuous improvement, staying abreast of industry trends and technologies to drive digital transformation.
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Engineering or a related field.
* Master's degree is a plus.
* Relevant certifications (e.g. CISSP, CISM, ITIL) are preferred.

**Our Values…**
===============

* Build a winning culture
* Pursue excellence
* Deliver WOW service
* Foster strong relationships
* Have a servant’s heart
* Drive innovation

  

We know that if we live our values, we will **serve our mission** of transforming small business retirement plans through innovation, expertise, and service and **achieve our vision** of enriching lives by shaping the future of retirement.


**Our Benefits…**
=================

* 401(k) Plan with fully vested 5% employer match
* Company pays 100% of employee health insurance
* Four weeks of Paid Time Off
* Ability to work remotely

title: Director, Strategic Vendor Management
description:
**Company Overview**
--------------------



ID.me is a high-growth enterprise software company that simplifies how people prove and share their identity online. The company empowers people to control their data through a portable and trusted login, which means they don't need to create a new password when visiting sites that have the ID.me button. ID.me's digital identity network has over 117 million registered members, and is used by fourteen federal agencies, agencies in 30 states and over 600 corporations for secure identity proofing and verification.



ID.me's technology meets the federal standards for consumer authentication set by the Commerce Department and is approved as a NIST 800-63-3 IAL2 / AAL2 credential service provider by the Kantara Initiative. In addition to helping people control their credentials and data, the company's "No Identity Left Behind" initiative strives to expand digital access and inclusion for all people. The company offers multiple pathways to identity verification – online self-serve, live video chat agents, and in person. ID.me is passionate about building a robust identity network that does not compromise access for traditionally underserved groups.



ID.me has received numerous awards including Deloitte's 2023 Technology Fast 500, Washington Business Journal's Fastest Growing Companies, Entrepreneur Magazine's 100 Brilliant Companies and Wall Street Journal's Startup of the Year finalist. In recent quarters, ID.me announced it raised $132 million in Series D funding, led by Viking Global Investors with participation from CapitalG, Morgan Stanley Counterpoint, FTV Capital, PSP Growth, Auctus Investment Group, Moonshots Capital, and Scout Ventures. ID.me's most recent round brings the total investment in ID.me to over $275 million since its founding in 2010.

### **Role Overview**



The Director, Strategic Vendor Management will lead the vendor management function for ID.me's product organization. This leader has direct responsibility for managing third-party spend required to deliver ID.me's products with a goal of continually improving gross margin, increasing customer value, and minimizing fraud.



Responsibilities


* Manage Ongoing Partnerships
+ Define KPIs for each vendor category to manage performance and cost.
+ Serve as the go-to resource for current vendor performance across all dimensions (e.g., product performance, spend with vendor, SME on capabilities, etc.)
+ Stay ahead of vendor product roadmap and ensure vendors are aligned with ID.me's needs going forward
+ Overall expert ability to manage tech partnerships

* Evaluate New Technology Partnerships
+ Negotiation and contracting expertise to achieve best outcome for ID.me
+ Provide in depth analysis on vendor comparison across all relevant factors (feature value to business, strategic alignment, time to integrate, pricing, company health, etc.)
+ Ability to forecast, build pricing models, and strong FP&A skills to build and assess business cases for new vendor integrations
+ Partner with product & engineering teams to test new vendors, coordinate into roadmap, and bring new partnerships to market

* Contribute to Product strategy
+ Deep knowledge of competitive landscape, product categories, and vendors in identity domain
+ Understanding market emerging trends and help ID.me stay ahead
+ Advance product strategy & roadmap through recommendations for new partners

Who We're Looking For


* Strong, strategic, business, & financial acumen: Applies the right financial, customer and product metrics, and market knowledge to make sound business decisions and create competitive strategies. Ability to dive into the details to understand business implications and drive alignment and execution across business stakeholders.
* Leadership and influencer: Earns trust and maintains confidence across teams at ID.me. Establishes collaborative working relationships. Able to manage directly and through influence.
* Urgency: Bias for action. Accomplishes goals, beats deadlines, and proactively addresses issues before they become widespread.


Requirements


* Demonstrated track record of identifying, negotiating, and managing large third-party vendor partnerships (>$30M annual third-party spend preferred)
* 10+ years of experience in vendor management, with consulting, strategy, product management, or program management roles to complement this experience.
* Exceptional leadership skills and experience navigating and influencing in a matrixed organization without direct authority.
* Demonstrated success working in an agile environment on multiple projects.
* Experience in the fraud, identity, or financial services industries.


This is a remote position.


The annual base salary listed below for this role is based on experience, skills, education, relevant training and geographic location. Company bonus, incentive for sales roles, equity, and benefits are available depending on the role.



ID.me offers comprehensive medical, dental, vision, health savings account, flexible spending accounts (medical, limited purpose, dependent care, commuter benefit accounts), basic and voluntary life and AD&D insurance, 401(k) with company match, parental leave, ability to participate in unlimited paid time off subject to the terms and conditions of the PTO policy, including 8 company wide holidays, short and long-term disability insurance, accident and critical illness insurance, referral bonus policy, employee assistance program, pet insurance, travel assistant program, wellbeing and childcare discounts, benefit advocates, and a learning and development benefit.



The above represents the anticipated total rewards package for this job requisition. Final offers may vary from the amount listed based on qualifications, professional experiences, skills, education, relevant training, geographic location, and other job related factors.

**Pay Range**


$182,000—$215,256 USD
ID.me maintains a work environment free from discrimination, where employees are treated with dignity and respect. All ID.me employees share in the responsibility for fulfilling our commitment to equal employment opportunity. ID.me does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. ID.me adheres to these principles in all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, promotion, benefits, social and recreational programs, and discipline. In addition, ID.me's policy is to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works. Upon request we will provide you with more information about such accommodations.



Please review our Privacy Policy, including our CCPA policy, at id.me/privacy. If you provide ID.me with any personally identifiable information you confirm that you have read and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions set out in our Privacy Policy.



ID.me participates in E-Verify.

title: Director of Creative Operations
description:
Summary
The Director of Creative Operations will be responsible for setting the vision and strategy for the creative operations function for the organization, ensuring the smooth and efficient execution of creative initiatives and projects that align with our overall business objectives. This role will work closely with the Senior Director of Creative and Brand Management and other department heads by establishing and implementing an ecosystem of resources, processes, tools, and metrics that support our current and future state. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing a culture that values operational excellence, data-driven decisions, and continuous improvements to ensure the consistency and quality of the Workiva brand at every touchpoint. This role exemplifies the ability to connect the dots across multiple channels, bringing together the information and resources needed to maintain clear and streamlined communication allowing for work to get done quickly, efficiently, and effectively.  

What You’ll Do
Workflow Optimization, Collaboration, and Communication:* Govern and support the operational needs, requirements, and requests of the creative teams to drive efficient and excellent content creation
* Identify best practices and implement standards to ensure consistency across the creative organization and improve the impact of their efforts
* Create, optimize, and share process documentation across teams with the ability to pivot due to changing workflow demands, ensuring milestones and deadlines are met and desired outcomes are achieved
* Work with Creative, Content, and Digital Leadership and Marketing Operations to ensure processes run efficiently and can scale
* Identify process gaps, make recommendations, and manage significant process improvement initiatives from start to completion
* Scale global impact strategies by implementing guidelines, creating shareable toolkits and templates, and fostering strong relationships within the global team


Project Management, Budgeting, and Cost Control:* Drive effective knowledge sharing and ways of working across multiple stakeholders, teams, and agencies to support event-related initiatives such as our user conference or commercial kickoffs
* Establish and govern an outsourcing strategy for our agency/vendor partners, including evaluations, selection, engagement, scoping, oversight, management, and performance reviews
* Effectively manage daily projects and the workload of the Creative team through adept delegation and prioritization, which involves adjusting assignments, resourcing, and deadlines as necessary
* Coordinate with Marketing team leads to align priorities, assign resources, and meet deadlines
* Coordinate and facilitate team meetings
* Monitor and champion creative consistency across all channels
* Oversee and coordinate creative production and expedite creative output and continuity
* Work closely with and report to the Senior Director of Creative on project flow and provide updates on any obstacles
* Oversee and manage day-to-day operations of asset management, translations, and available resources
* In conjunction with Procurement, establish statements of work (SOWs) and align budgets


Resource Allocation and Agency Management:* Responsible for allocating resources, such as personnel, equipment, and software, to various projects
* Develop and monitor an efficient outsourcing plan, identifying when to engage agency support
* Manage agency relationships and ensure they function as an extension of the team


Performance Tracking and Reporting:* Develop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics with department leadership and guide the organization toward achieving targets
* Develop and implement long-term creative strategies to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of campaigns and our design system
* Gather, analyze, and report data to provide brand performance analysis, success measurements, and optimization opportunities
* Collaborate with Creative, Production, Demand Generation, Marketing Operations, and other teams to develop tools and processes that support data management, reporting, and development of actionable insights.
* Establish a consistent internal communication strategy to ensure regular updates for teams and leadership.


What You’ll Need
Minimum Qualifications:
Experience* 10+ years of marketing experience, with an emphasis on creative operations and project management


Education:* Bachelor's Degree


Preferred Qualifications:* Minimum 5 years of direct people management experience preferred, including supervisor experience of managers
* SaaS company experience preferred
* Experience building processes for brand design, content creation, presentations, photos, and videos.
* Proven success in defining, launching, and governing scalable solutions that support Creative and Production operations.
* Ability to make informed decisions based on data analysis and drive motions to support performance metric efforts.
* A strong understanding of creative processes, design principles, and industry trends, and the ability to speak the technical design language
* Experience using Agile frameworks within Creative and Marketing teams preferred
* Knowledge of graphic design, copywriting, video production, and other creative disciplines
* Ability to influence and guide cross-functional teams to drive tasks and projects to completion.
* Highly proactive with a keen ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders
* Embrace ambiguity, enjoy problem-solving, identify necessary actions, and follow through accordingly.
* Familiarity with project management technologies, and experience with Monday.com a plus.
* Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite and Figma is a plus
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-developing environment
* Strong attention to detail
* Executive-level communication and people skills
* Financial and business acumen
* Exceptional team-building skills, and an inspiring voice for creative bravery


Travel* 30%

  

Working Conditions & Physical Requirements* Reliable internet access for any period working remotely, not in a Workiva office
* #LI-REMOTE


How You’ll Be Rewarded:* Salary range in the US:


$147,000.00 - $250,000.00* A discretionary bonus typically paid annually
* Restricted Stock Units granted at time of hire
* 401(k) match and comprehensive employee benefits package


The salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this job in the US. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and other relevant factors.
Where You’ll Work
Our values drive how we work and who we hire. You will see these values ingrained in how we support our customers, work with team members, build our products and in the work environment we’ve created.
We believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to make an impact everyday. We give our employees the freedom and resources they need—backed by our culture of collaboration and diverse thought—to continue innovating and breaking new ground. We hire talented people with a wide range of skills and experiences who are eager to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems.
At Workiva, you’ll enjoy:* Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.
* Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.
* Involvement: Ability to participate in Business Employee Resource Groups (Black, Hispanic, Asian, Women, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Veterans, Disabilities), Volunteering, Company wide celebrations, and more
* Work-life Balance: We have competitive PTO, VTO and Parental Leave. We encourage employees to spend time enjoying life outside of work.

  

Learn more about life at Workiva: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/
Learn more about benefits: https://www.workiva.com/careers/benefits  

Workiva is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We believe that great minds think differently. We value diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and interests, and we recognize diversity as an important source of intellectual thought, varied perspective, and innovation. Employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other protected characteristic. We strongly encourage and welcome people from historically marginalized groups to apply.
Workiva is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. To request assistance with the application process, please email talentacquisition@workiva.com. *Workiva supports employees in working where they work best - either from an office or remotely from any location within their country of employment.*

title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)/Head of Enterprise IT
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**



The **Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) and Head of Enterprise IT** will lead our dynamic Information Security and IT organization for one of the top e-commerce companies revolutionizing how people shop. Reporting directly to the Chief Product and Technology Officer, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of information security, including Cloud Security, DevSecOps, Security Operations, and Security Strategy. Your role will be pivotal in ensuring the reliability, scalability, and security of our systems to support our rapidly evolving business while adhering to industry best practices. As Head of Information Technology, you’ll also be responsible for all areas of the IT organization including IT Infrastructure, Enterprise Applications and Insights, Business Systems, Employee Technology Services, and IT Analytics.



The ideal candidate will be an excellent leader who possesses a complementary balance of business and technology in a SaaS environment with an emphasis on business value, quality and optimization of service, system integrity and stability.



In addition to the operational responsibility, this is a strategic leadership role that requires strong partnership with almost every function across the company, including Engineering, Algorithms, Security, Product, Finance, Marketing, Client Services, Warehouse Operations and work seamlessly with the executive team. Partnering with other senior leaders across the company, you’ll translate information technology capabilities into strategic business decisions. You’ll build a strong long-term technology strategy that aligns with the company strategic plan and influences the overall company direction. You’ll drive accountability and metrics ownership to translate strategy into results. And you’ll align and inspire your organization by effectively communicating and engaging the team in the strategy.


**YOU'RE EXCITED ABOUT THIS OPPORTUNITY BECAUSE YOU WILL…**


* You will lead and manage the Information Security and Information Technology organization, inclusive of enterprise applications, business systems supporting various verticals in Finance, Marketing, Customer Experience and Human Resources, SaaS based Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Employee Technology Services, IT Infrastructure, Operations and platforms.
* Mentor and coach security practitioners, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth
* Update the Company’s Board of Directors quarterly on the state of the Company’s security posture
* Develop and implement a multi-year security strategy and roadmap to anticipate and address security challenges in alignment with company growth objectives
* Drive the evolution of security capabilities, including Cloud Security, DevSecOps, and Security Operations, to support the company's high-growth trajectory
* Develop a multi-year strategy and roadmap for IT to anticipate and scale to support all business initiatives across the company
* Identify, assess, and manage security risks, ensuring the resilience of IT systems and infrastructure across global operations
* Anticipate and manage future technology debt challenges through partnership and raising awareness of technical dependencies
* Lead the development and implementation of security programs, focusing on usable security solutions that support business innovation while mitigating risks
* Drive the adoption of secure development practices and tools, ensuring the integrity of software products and infrastructure in cloud-native environments.


**WE’RE EXCITED ABOUT YOU BECAUSE YOU…**


* Have a Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Information Systems, Analysis, Business or equivalent relevant experience
* Bring 12+ years of experience in Information Security and IT services and projects in a cloud-native, engineering-heavy technology environment
* Bring 8+ years of people management experience
* Are an experienced leader, able to guide teams and executives through complex, data-driven decisions
* Possess a deep understanding of IT operations and business systems in the context of resilient business and technology processes
* Have a track record for delivery in a complex, rapidly changing environment
* Champion and drive a culture of continuous learning to improve execution and remove roadblocks that are holding the team back.
* Act as a strategic partner who can translate business problems to technology solutions
* Work effectively across the business to influence and create client value
* Empower self-organization and responsibility within your teams


**WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING AT STITCH FIX...**


* We are a group of bright, kind people who are motivated by challenges. We value integrity, innovation and trust. You’ll bring these characteristics to life in everything you do at Stitch Fix.
* We cultivate a community of diverse perspectives— all voices are heard and valued.
* We are an innovative company and leverage our strengths in fashion and tech to disrupt the future of retail.
* We win as a team, commit to our work, and celebrate grit together because we value strong relationships.
* We boldly create the future while keeping equity and sustainability at the center of all that we do.
* We are the owners of our work and are energized by solving problems through a growth mindset lens. We think broadly and creatively through every situation to create meaningful impact.
* We offer comprehensive compensation packages and inclusive health and wellness benefits.


**ABOUT STITCH FIX**



At Stitch Fix, we’re about personal styling for everybody and we believe in both a service and a workplace where you can be your best, most authentic self. We’re the first fashion retailer to combine technology and data science with the human instinct of a Stylist to deliver a deeply personalized shopping experience. This novel juxtaposition attracts a highly diverse group of talented people who are both thinkers and doers. All of this results in a simple, powerful offering to our customers and a successful, growing business serving millions of men, women, and kids. We believe we are only scratching the surface on our opportunity, and we’re looking for incredible people like you to help us carry on that trend.


**Compensation and Benefits**  

  

Our anticipated compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets, and the range below indicates the low end of the lowest-compensated market to the high end of the highest-compensated market. This position is eligible for new hire and ongoing grants of restricted stock units depending on employee and company performance. In addition, the position is eligible for medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external careers site.
Salary Range
$345,000—$345,000 USD

The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data.*



Please review Stitch Fix's US Applicant Privacy Policy and Notice at Collection here: https://stitchfix.com/careers/workforce-applicant-privacy-policy


**Recruiting Fraud Alert:**



To all candidates: your personal information and online safety are top of mind for us. At Stitch Fix, recruiters only direct candidates to apply through our official career pages at https://www.stitchfix.com/careers/jobs or https://web.fountain.com/c/stitch-fix.



Recruiters will never request payments, ask for financial account information or sensitive information like social security numbers. If you are unsure if a message is from Stitch Fix, please email RecruitingOperations@stitchfix.com.



You can read more about Recruiting Scam Awareness on our FAQ page here: https://support.stitchfix.com/hc/en-us/articles/1500007169402-Recruiting-Scam-Awareness

title: IT Director
description:
The Director of Information Technology will develop and oversee company-wide technology policies, procedures, services, and facilities. In this key role you will work collaboratively with the CIO and other leadership to develop effective strategies for integrating and advancing our technology.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Develops overall technology roadmap and plans, formulates, sets and implements polices for current and future information/communication/ telecommunications systems and activities
* Analyzes IT infrastructure and systems performance to assess operating costs, productivity levels, upgrade requirements, and other metrics and needs.
* Manages IT staff including recruitment, performance management and evaluations, and professional development
* Prepares, submits, and manages operating and capital expenditures for technology needed to support the organizations technology projects
* Oversees the purchase, installation, and maintenance of computer hardware, software, networks, telecommunication equipment on premises and the cloud environment
* Collaborates with Director of IS on development, staging and production platforms
* Collaborates with cybersecurity team on risk assessment, response and remediation
* Provides weekly updates and strategies on all projects to CIO and CEO
* Perform reviews and updates, promote and ensure policy awareness, track exceptions, and perform testing / auditing / monitoring on policy compliance.
* Keeps abreast of new knowledge, research, products, and services in technology that will benefit the organization.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or similar discipline.
* A minimum of 10 years progressive IT experience including hands on technical roles of systems, network, storage and database administration
* Minimum 5 years of leading IT Teams and hands-on technical operations.
* Strong experience in Windows and UNIX operating systems.
* Experience with VMware and NetApp a plus.
* Experience with implementation and project management of large-scale technology implementations.
* Prior experience managing vendor relationships and negotiations
* Excellent communication and organization skills
* Ability to write and present formal documentation

  



Why FYI?


FYI – For Your Information, Inc. continues to be one of the fastest growing and most successful woman-owned Federal contractors in the country. For three years in a row, we have been on Inc. Magazine’s 5000 list and was recently named one of Inc’s 2023 Mid-Atlantic Fasted Growing companies. FYI offers a collaborative and inclusive work environment. We offer professional development and career growth opportunities to all employees. As we continue to grow so will you and your career.  



  

**What is in it for you?**


* Opportunity to work remotely, based on contract or position.
* Team building and innovation in a collaborative environment.
* A competitive base salary with a loaded benefits package.
* Tuition/Education Assistance.
* Personal computer device allowance.
* Pet Insurance.

  


*At FYI – For Your Information Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and our core value of “People First”. All people matter at FYI. We believe that our inclusive environment and the diversity of our people drives our innovation and growth and allows us to better serve our clients and communities.*

  

*FYI – For your Information is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identify), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, martial status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employment organization, retaliation, parental status, military service or other non-merit factor.*

title: Director, Program Management
description:
Director, PMO
Why Lytx:
Lytx is seeking an experienced individual who is accountable for ensuring teams get maximum the business value of the use of Agile (dual track scrum, Kanban) through effective application of its principles and methodologies. This role is responsible for ensuring the team lives agile values and principles and understands the processes and practices that allow teams to enjoy the benefits of living in Agile ways, measuring their progress and continuously improving. Through fostering a community of Agile expertise, this role provides value to our internal and external stakeholders and supports teams in creating breakthroughs for clients.
Working with a talented teams of functional and technical experts, they are key proponents of Agile practices and values, using these to help drive forward the program of digital transformation that empowers Lytx’s customer-oriented vision.
This director-level position requires an individual with a proven ability to lead/coach teams across a variety of disciplines, delivering results that meet and exceed stakeholder expectations.
You’ll Get To:* Collaborates with cross functional team leaders from Engineering, Design, Product and Marketing in order to create and deliver against quarterly and annual roadmap objectives
* Developing Agile Community of Practice to include Scrum Masters, Product Owners, and other cross functional team members regarding customizing Agile approaches, tools, skills to the Lytx organization, including updating process and role definitions as needed
* Create roadmap, operationalize scrum teams around it, and own the successful execution against the outcomes.
* Coach and support scrum masters in establishing an environment where the Scrum team can be as effective as possible, addressing team dynamics, and ensuring good collaboration within and across teams
* Plan and implement scrum teams effectively, and be aware of team maturity and opportunities/needs to apply scaled agile structures (SAFe), ensuring that team vision, goals, scope, KPIs, and the product domain are established
* Running Scrum of Scrums practice to measure progress against roadmap and recommending course corrections based on market data and internal data
* Implement agile delivery metrics at team, cohort, portfolio and segment levels, including the communication of these metrics to organization-wide stakeholders.
* Partner and collaborate with executive and senior leaders across both technology and non-technology teams to plan and implement transformation initiatives.
* Act as an agent of change for organizations using Agile, facilitating communities of Agile practitioners to become self-sustaining, thriving and collaborative. Evangelize transformational progress through identification and communication of success stories and outcomes
* Drives continuous improvement using data and information from teams to identify issues and ways to improve
* Advocate and champion for the developer experience driving their priorities into the roadmap
* Perform other duties as assigned


What You’ll Need:* Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Certification as a ScrumMaster (CSM) and Certified Product Owner (CSPO); Agile Coaching Certification or Agile Facilitation Certification.
* Minimum 10 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, Product Manager, Scrum Master or related
* Minimum 5 years experience leading and managing team members of various levels creating an environment of collaboration and high-performing individuals.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to build relationships, influence outcomes, and to deliver effective presentations to a variety of audiences and stakeholders
* Has comprehensive knowledge of the principles, concepts and theories in application of Agile principles, mindsets and methodologies.
* Familiarity with Dual Truck Scrum is a plus
* Ability to understand interdepartmental structure and dynamics; manage up, or sideways as needed; use diplomacy to balance competing project requests.
* Excellent analytical, strategic conceptual thinking, planning, and budget management skills
* Comfortable with ambiguity and facilitating discussions to explore the best possible solutions
* Ability to prioritize based on customer need, risk impact and strategic demands is a key requirement of the role


Benefits:* Medical, dental and vision insurance
* Health Savings Account
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Telehealth
* 401(k) and 401(k) match
* Life and AD&D insurance
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* FTO or PTO
* Employee Well-Being program
* 11 paid holidays plus 1 inclusive holiday per year
* Volunteer Time Off
* Employee Referral program
* Education Reimbursement Program
* Employee Recognition and Appreciation program
* Additional perk and voluntary benefit programs


Salary is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This position is also eligible for an incentive compensation plan. The expected hiring salary for this position is:
$199,250.00 - $251,750.00
Innovation Lives Here  

You go all in no matter what you do, and so do we. At Lytx, we’re powered by cutting-edge technology and Happy People. You want your work to make a positive impact in the world, and that’s what we do. Join our diverse team of hungry, humble and capable people united to make a difference.
Together, we help save lives on our roadways.
Find out how good it feels to be a part of an inclusive, collaborative team. We’re committed to delivering an environment where everyone feels valued, included and supported to do their best work and share their voices.
Lytx, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and maintains a drug-free workplace. We’re committed to attracting, retaining and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. EOE/M/F/Disabled/Vet.

title: Director of Information Technology
description:
**THE AMERICAN BOARD OF SURGERY**

The American Board of Surgery (ABS) is an independent, nonprofit organization founded in 1937 for the purpose of certifying individuals who have met a defined standard of education, training, and knowledge in the field of surgery. Surgeons certified by the ABS have completed at least five years of surgical training following medical school and successfully completed a written and oral examination process administered by the ABS. They must then maintain their board certification through ongoing learning and practice improvement activities. The ABS offers board certification in general surgery, vascular surgery, pediatric surgery, surgical critical care, complex general surgical oncology, and surgery of the hand. It is one of the 24 member boards of the American Board of Medical Specialties.

**POSITION DESCRIPTION** 

The American Board of Surgery seeks a **Director of Information Technology** to oversee the Information Technology (IT) department, and collaborate with other departments, partners and vendors to create high-quality, efficient and timely applications and services. Primary duties include implementing technology solutions to support the company’s strategic goals and product roadmap; identifying new programming and software solutions; maintaining the surgeon portal, program portal, platform infrastructure and certification process; and ensuring overall data and system security. The candidate will need to have an agile background and be able to lead a team, by example to achieve the goals of the IT Department to support ongoing board operations and new initiatives. The Director of Information Technology reports to the Chief Operating Officer.

While employees can work remotely, periodic presence in the physical office in Philadelphia, PA may be required with advance notice, as well as planned travel for meetings and conferences. It is strongly recommended ABS employees are vaccinated against COVID-19, and a background check as well as verification of a candidate’s ability to work in the United States will be conducted before hiring.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES** 

· Manage and maintain our Azure infrastructure and database environment, ensuring high availability, security, and scalability of the cloud environment.

· Lead and work collaboratively with development team to design, develop, test and implement Angular, .NET and Azure-based solutions that meet our business requirements.

· Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps to enable efficient and automated software delivery.

· Stay current with Azure services, features, and best practices, and recommend improvements to our cloud infrastructure and processes.

· Identify technological needs and make recommendations to business decision-makers.

· Develop and maintain reporting mechanisms for standard IT operations and cybersecurity.

· Ensure the company’s adherence to industry standard cybersecurity protocols and benchmarks.

· Manage the IT team including developers, engineers, system analysts, support technicians and vendors.

· Maintain company hardware and software programs.

· Adhere to and promote company quality initiatives and practices in Information Technology

· Design, develop and implement integrations for key business systems and operations.

· Implement company-wide technology updates and lead sessions to educate management and staff on new features and toolsets.

**Required Skills** 

· Proficiency in Angular, .NET and PowerShell scripting expected.

· Experience in designing and implementing highly available, scalable, and secure Azure-based solutions.

· Experience with Azure SQL Managed Instance is strongly preferred.

· Experience with CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps, including building, testing, and deploying applications.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

**Required Education and Experience** 

· Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

· At least 10 years of experience in information technology and/or full stack development, with at least 4 years in a leadership role.

**PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS** 

· Professional attitude and performance
