title: Director of AI & Innovation
description:
**Posted Date:** Feb 23, 2024  

**Employment Type:** Full Time

**Pay Range:**


(Minimum to mid pay range specific to NY, CA, CO, WA)


174,300.00 - 217,900.00 USD Annual
Brinks Texas License #C00550


#LI-Remote


The Brink’s name is a promise to respect the trust we’ve earned in over 150 years in business. Every employee honors that promise by offering the highest levels of service and support to our customers. We take pride in our work, and we share a passion about our future. Learn why so many people have made the choice to join our team – and stay here.

**Job Title**


Director of AI & Innovation**Job Description**


The Brink’s Company (NYSE:BCO) is a leading global provider of cash and valuables management, digital retail solutions, and ATM managed services. Our customers include financial institutions, retailers, government agencies, mints, jewelers and other commercial operations. Our network of operations in 52 countries serves customers in more than 100 countries.


At Brink’s we believe that diverse teams drive success, and as such we foster an inclusive culture that values people with diverse backgrounds, ideas and perspectives. We build a sense of belonging so all employees feel respected, safe and valued, and we provide equal opportunity to participate and grow.


We are seeking a leader experienced in building the practices of business AI enablement, RPA automation, and Innovation. This position will work cross functionally with our existing RPA team and business partners looking to leverage automation in their respective businesses. This position will also be leading the IT organization in how to leverage AI in various areas of our business. This position will report to the VP of Architecture & Technology.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Establish vision, launch strategy, and execute on the AI Strategy for Brinks.
* Lead and develop a new practice of leveraging AI in various areas of our business.
* Liaison with various business partners to define and develop a global automation roadmap to reduce labor hours and human processing errors.
* Work to consolidate fragmented automation efforts across the organization for a more unified approach to deliver the right fit automation solutions.
* Setup a regular cadence to define business opportunities with key stakeholders and develop execution strategies that includes tool selection, vendor selection, and support model.
* Review with business partners their existing manual processes and enable innovative software solutions to help automate existing business processes.
* Participate in vendor software evaluations and recommendations as well as vetting solution integrators.
* Facilitate problem-solving and collaboration across our team to ensure an effective and harmonized service experience.
* Support the VP Global Shared Services on automation projects to drive forward their productivity initiatives as requested.
* Promote best practices and strong internal controls across the organization.

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or equivalent.
* Automation experience with RPA, AI, or 3rd party software solutions.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and drive results in a dynamic environment.
* Strong analytical skills, collecting and analyzing data, evaluating information and systems
* At least 5 years in an analytical role with strong project management experience
* Finance automation experience is a plus.
* Strong consultative and problem-solving skills
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, especially in Excel and PowerPoint
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills with track record of superior customer service
* Excellent verbal and written communications, including active listening skills, verbal presentation skills and skills in presenting findings and recommendations

**Ability to:**

* Develop and communicate performance for respective process area
* Stay organized and communicate progress on projects
* Analyze, problem solve, and drive decision-making
* Build effective internal customer relationships
* Communicate effectively with all levels of management
* Deliver measurable impact through process standardization and optimization
* Design and develop process maps and procedures
* Work under pressure and manage multiple projects at once across various functions
* Support audit and SOX compliance activities (as needed)
* Maintain positive relationships with end users and other internal constituents

**About Brink’s**
-----------------


Brink’s is the global leader in security and logistics services, trusted by banks, financial institutions and businesses in both public and private sectors. We deliver the currency of the world to businesses in our communities. We do it because we’re needed. We do it because we’re trusted and valued. We do it because it makes us proud. Brink’s Proud.

**What’s Nex****t?**
--------------------


Thank you for considering applying for a job at Brink’s U.S. To be considered for this position, you must complete the entire application process, which includes answering all prescreening questions and providing your eSignature.  

  

Upon completion of the application process, you will receive an email confirming that we have received your application. We will review all candidates and notify you of your status should we deem you fit for a job. Thank you again for your interest in a career at Brink’s U.S. For more information about future career opportunities, join our talent network, Like our Facebook page or Follow us on Twitter.

*Brink’s is an equal* *opportunity/affirmative* *action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or history or any other characteristic protected by law. Brink’s is also committed to providing a drug free workplace.*

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.*

title: REMOTE Director of IT Programming
description:
**Job Type:** Full Time

**Hours:** 9:00AM-6:00PM EST (After hours as needed)

**Salary:** $125-140K

**Benefits:** Available after 90 days for full time employees

**About AnswerNet** 

AnswerNet is the brand name for the AnswerNet family of companies including AnswerNet, Inc., New AnswerNet Inc., Cerida Investment Corp., ECC (Energy Choice California), Synergy Solutions, TPV.com, and Ansercomm, to name a few. Together with our affiliates, AnswerNet operates more than 31 contact centers within the continental United States and Canada. We provide a vast range of services to optimize telephone answering services, appointment setting and confirmation, customer support, third-party verification, sales, lead qualification, market research, and a host of other contact management solutions. In all, AnswerNet has more than 10,000 satisfied clients and we process over 125 million interactions per year.

**Job Summary:**

Oversees the Programming and Business Intelligence functions in the Technical Services Department. The director takes the lead on all Programming systems and ensures the department aligns with the company's priorities. We are seeking a highly skilled individual with a profound understanding of telecom operations, particularly in the realm of call center technology. This role is integral to our organization, as it involves the orchestration of various facets of our call center.

**Reports to:**

Vice President of Technical Services

**Responsibilities:**

1) Business Intelligence Strategy:

* Develop and implement a comprehensive business intelligence strategy that aligns with AnswerNet's overall business goals and objectives.
* Collaborate with senior management to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and data-driven insights to drive strategic decision-making across the organization.
* Oversee the design and maintenance of data warehouses and databases to ensure the availability of accurate and timely business data.2)
* Data Analytics and Reporting:
* Lead a team of data analysts to conduct in-depth data analysis, data mining, and statistical modeling to provide actionable insights and recommendations to various stakeholders.
* Develop interactive and user-friendly dashboards and reports to enable real-time monitoring of key performance metrics and business trends.
* Present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences, including executives and department heads.
* Software Development and Programming:
* Manage and mentor a team of programmers responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications and tools that support the company's business operations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define software requirements, develop project timelines, and ensure successful implementation of software solutions.
* Oversee the integration of software applications with existing systems to enhance efficiency and data integrity.
* Grasp and Internalize Long-term Goals and Strategic Vision:

· Familiarize yourself with the organization's long-term goals, mission statement, and strategic vision.

· Internalize the overarching vision to align your actions and decisions accordingly

* Collaborate with the President and CEO:

· Engage in regular discussions with the President and CEO to gain insights into their vision for the organization.

· Seek clarification on any aspects of the vision that require further understanding.

· Actively participate in strategic planning sessions to ensure alignment with the overall mission and objectives.

* Process Improvement:
* Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation within the organization, leveraging programming and technology solutions.
* Work closely with department heads to understand their specific needs and provide innovative solutions to improve workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
* Data Security and Compliance:
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and industry best practices in data security.
* Implement robust data protection measures and establish protocols for data access and sharing within the organization.
* Team Management:
* Recruit, train, and develop a high-performing team of programmers and data analysts.
* Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment that promotes creativity, growth, and continuous learning.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to team members to enhance their professional development.

7. Telecom Solutioning Manager:

· Spearhead the end-to-end solutioning process within our telecommunication environment, from initial ideation to final implementation, ensuring that each state is meticulously executed to deliver optimal outcomes.

· Lead and inspire a team in crafting innovative solutions to address telecom challenges.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* Strong experience in a leadership position for telephone answering service or associated technologies as a service provider.
* Expert experience with including Twilio and other upstream service providers.
* Proven experience (minimum 5 years) in leading business intelligence, data analytics, and software development teams in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Strong knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, SQL) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
* Expert level in SIP communication.
* Expertise in data modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning concepts.
* Demonstrated ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations.
* Solid understanding of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a remote work environment.

Join AnswerNet as the Director of Programming and Business Intelligence and play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making and technological advancements within our organization. Together, let's enhance customer experiences and achieve new heights of success in the customer service solutions industry.

**WAH Requirements:**

· PC/Laptop with at least Windows 10 (Apple/Mac products, Chromebooks, and tablets are not compatible)

· Hard wired high-speed internet connection (ethernet cable)

· USB-connected Headset

· Webcam

· Quiet dedicated place to work free from distractions including pets and children.

**Location:**

Commutable to Willow Grove, PA, or can be 100% remote. Must be US based.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 5 years
* 7 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Python, Java. SQL Tableau, Power BI: 7 years (Required)
* Data analytics: 6 years (Required)
* SIP Communications: 6 years (Required)
* Leadership: 5 years (Required)
