Work Location: Remote

title: Director, Engineering
description:
**About Lanai**
---------------


We believe in a future where AI will dramatically improve all aspects of companies as well as the productivity and job satisfaction of their employees. However, getting to this future will be messy and confusing! Lanai, a contraction of "Lean Into AI”, aims to help. Lanai will offer a software platform that helps companies adopt AI-based models and applications in a productive, cost-effective, and secure manner. Lanai was founded in early 2023 by Steve Herrod (former CTO of VMware) and the talented team at Juxtapose. Lanai has received substantive funding from top-tier VC firms and will release its first product later this year.

**About the Team**
------------------


We're passionate builders, relentless customer champions, and lifelong learners. The AI world is moving at breakneck speed, and our mission is to continuously monitor and take advantage of everything it has to offer. We are using state-of-the-art AI tools to build Lanai itself, and we will tame the complexity needed to help others benefit from all that these tools have to offer.


We're a tight-knit group of curious engineers who love turning complex problems into solutions that make a real difference for our users. We’re leveraging the most modern development tools and practices to ensure a productive and fun environment where everyone is inspired to do their best work. And we don't just build 'good enough' – we obsess over the details that create genuinely delightful experiences. We’re building a thoughtful environment where curiosity thrives and bringing your authentic selves to everything is a given.

**What You’ll Do**
------------------

* Recruit, interview, and develop a small, but mighty engineering team
* Work closely with the executive team to help direct and participate in the software development, ensuring the delivery of high-quality products that meet market needs
* Oversee the infrastructure that supports product scalability and reliability, managing the technical challenges associated with a growing user base
* Lead by example with a hands-on approach to software development, maintaining a deep involvement in coding and system architecture
* Exhibit versatility in tackling various engineering disciplines and a willingness to explore new technological territories
* Be a hands-on leader who will directly manage a group of engineers driving the team towards delivering innovative products
* Implement a thoughtful, supportive output-driven culture

**What You Bring**
------------------

* 8+ years of experience in software engineering with a focus on infrastructure oversight
* 4+ years of experience managing engineering teams, preferably at least 2 years at a seed, Series A, or Series B company
* Demonstrated ability in building, deploying, and maintaining scalable, high-availability systems
* Proficiency in a range of programming languages and frameworks, and a thorough understanding of both front-end and back-end development practices


	+ Our current stack is AWS, EKS, ReactJS, NestJS, GraphQL, Postgres, Hashicorp Vault, Python, Golang, AWS Sagemaker
* Experience with machine learning is an asset, adding value to the role through potential implementation in product features
* A self starter owner’s mentality with an unquenchable desire to learn
* Sharp at problem solving, critical thinking, and systems thinking
* Proactive communicator, both verbal and written, around technical decisions and project deadlines
* Ability to inspire a team of engineers
* Biased towards action and speed of delivery

**Working Environment**
-----------------------


Lanai is based in the SF Bay Area and we have an intentionally flexible hybrid approach to work. We have a regular in-office cadence for team connection and brainstorming sessions, with the flexibility for remote work the rest of the time. We use the best collaboration tools, schedule regular offsites, and plan for team bonding experiences.

**What We Offer**
-----------------

* $205,000-$270,000 annual base salary (based on experience) with significant equity options
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* OneMedical and TalkSpace memberships
* 401(k) plan
* Unlimited PTO
* Annual learning & development and tech conference stipend
* Work from Anywhere December
* Your choice of tech!

**Diverse and Inclusive Employer**
----------------------------------


We’re committed to providing equal treatment and opportunity to all applicants at every stage of the hiring cycle and throughout their life at Lanai. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected status.

*Note:* Research says men tend to apply even if they only meet ~60% of the job qualifications, whereas women and other marginalized groups are hesitant to do so. If you don’t match 100% of the job qualifications but think you’d be a great fit, we encourage you to apply!

title: VP of Engineering
description:
**About Us**
Snappy Kraken has been ranked as the *Best Overall Content Marketing Program* four years running, and voted *Best Place to Work in FinTech* every year since 2018. Our SaaS platform helps transform financial advisory businesses through purpose-driven content, easy automation, and world-class support. In 2022, we acquired Advisor Websites to add unique, professional, and compliant websites to our growing list of offerings.  

Our high-performance culture is intentionally designed to bring out the best in each team member to continually achieve our growth and revenue potential. Every new person we add to our team helps raise the bar of what we can accomplish together. Our people are put in roles where they can achieve their zone of genius and have clear performance expectations continually measured through OKRs.
The **VP of Engineering** is a full-time, remote position at Snappy Kraken. *Accessibility requirements are dependent on the role but could be expected during standard business hours Monday through Friday.* This position is open to any candidates currently residing and eligible to legally work in the United States or Canada. **The Purpose of This Role**
Snappy Kraken is at an incredibly exciting point in our journey where we have multiple products integrated into a dynamic and engaging dashboard to showcase marketing value to our clients. We are looking for you, a skilled and experienced engineering leader to drive excellence within our team and take us to the next level.  

In your day to day you will be collaborating with leaders across our business to build new products, and enhance our existing ones. You will be leading initiatives, understanding our top strategic objectives and transforming them into high quality and impactful technology. You’ll be leading multiple engineering teams, continuously improving how we work while mentoring and guiding our engineering leads and their sprint teams.  

Reporting to the President of Snappy Kraken, you will be working closely with our Chief Product Officer and other product leaders to deeply understand our customer needs and values. We trust that based on your skill and experience you’ll be enthusiastic about this opportunity to form deep partnerships and push towards new opportunities **Primary Role & Responsibilities*** Developing and presenting research and strategy to management and executive leadership to guide how we reach our strategic objectives
* Meeting with existing and potential Enterprise Clients to understand their use cases and provide guidance on reaching their goals
* Managing the engineering budget to ensure optimal capital efficiency to drive outcomes
* Recruit and hire excellent engineers to bring value to our organization
* Developing training and strategy to guide engineers in best practices through the product lifecycle
* Monitoring system infrastructure to maintain efficiency
* Ensuring you deeply understand our strategic objectives to develop your technical roadmap and strategy
* Investigating and implementing new forms of technology to benefit the business

 **Primary Qualifications*** A skilled leader who has managed engineering teams previously
* A proven record of leading high-performing development teams both at an individual and team level
* Excellent technical knowledge and experience driving efficiency and quality through your teams
* Experience hiring excellent engineers both through their abilities and cultural fit
* Experience managing budgets to use capital effectively
* Experience building and maintaining external and internal stakeholder relationships
* Deep knowledge of industry trends and best practices

* Comfortable and professional communication skills for meetings with executive leadership, direct reports, as well as enterprise and partner relationships
* Relevant technical experience and expertise
* Ability to manage teams to meet deadlines
* Experience with recruiting and hiring
* Knowledge of how to prepare, present and implement a budget
* Understanding of best practices for conducting and applying research
* Familiarity with the tools and software used by engineers under their oversight
 **Perks & Benefits*** Work Remotely
* Flexible Time Off
* Development Fund to help you grow
* Medical Insurance Options
* Parental/Maternity Leave

  

As of February 2024, the expected compensation range for this position is $150,000-180,000 USD/ $150,000-200,000 CAD based on country of residence. Pay will be based on several factors, such as experience, certifications, location, market conditions, and other business and organizational needs. Snappy Kraken anticipates that the reasonably expected salary for this position could change in the future and retains the right to change or revisit the salary range according to business needs.
— *As a remote company, it is critical to remember that our contributions and teams are interconnected and accessibility is the expectation.*

*At Snappy Kraken, diversity powers meaningful connections, impactful work, and great outcomes. Our culture of diversity and inclusion means we nurture an environment where each team member can do their best work.* *The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.*
The pay range for this role is:
150,000 - 200,000 CAD per year (Remote - Canada)
150,000 - 180,000 USD per year (Remote - United States)

title: Director of Information Technology
description:
**About Swirlds Labs:**



We are a fast-growing company built around a revolutionary technology — the hashgraph consensus algorithm. Hedera Hashgraph is well-suited to become the world's first mass-adopted distributed public ledger because it is blazing fast, highly secure, and ensures fairness. We are on a mission to create a trusted and empowered digital future for everyone; a cyberspace where you work, play, buy, sell, create, and engage socially; where you have safety and privacy in your digital communities; where you feel confident when interacting with others; where you own and control your information. Join us and say, "Hello future."


**About the role:**



The Director of Information Technology will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the company's IT infrastructure, systems, and strategies. This position requires a visionary leader with a strong technical background, exceptional managerial skills, and a proven track record of implementing successful IT initiatives. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of emerging technologies, industry best practices and a passion for driving innovation within the organization.


**You may find yourself doing all of the following:**


* Developing and implementing IT strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure the smooth operation of the company's technological infrastructure
* Leading and managing a team of IT professionals, including hiring, training, and performance evaluations
* Collaborating with department heads to identify and prioritize IT needs and requirements across the organization
* Overseeing the design, development, and implementation of IT systems, software applications, and network infrastructure
* Managing the company's IT budget, resources, and vendor relationships to ensure cost-effective solutions and services
* Monitoring and evaluating the performance of IT systems and infrastructure, implementing improvements and upgrades as needed
* Ensuring compliance with relevant regulations, standards, and security protocols to protect the integrity and confidentiality of company data
* Staying current with technological advancements and industry trends, advising senior management on potential opportunities and risks
* Fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the IT department


**Qualification Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; Master's degree preferred
* 8+ years of experience in IT leadership roles, with a proven track record of managing complex IT projects and teams
* Strong technical background in areas such as device management, identity management, network administration, cybersecurity, cloud computing, and database management
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams
* Demonstrated ability to develop and execute strategic IT plans that align with organizational objectives
* Experience managing IT budgets, resources, and vendor relationships


**Other skills that are great to bring with you but that we can help you develop:**


* Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CCNA, PMP)
* Ability to work on cross-functional teams and projects
* Knowledge of IT workflow and intake
* Identity, Device, and Endpoint management
* Familiarity with ITAM
* ITSM experience
* Web3/Crypto Experience

title: Project Director
description:
**Role:** Project Director (junior to mid-junior level) working at the intersection of Cultural Insights, Innovation, Speculative Futures, Brand Strategy, and Creative Strategy.
  

**Location:** This is a remote position though you must be based in North America.  

Overview


Space Doctors, a Human8 company, is hiring for a position in our North America office. We are a global cultural and creative consultancy and B Corp. We are known for shaping brands and organizations such as Microsoft, Meta, Google, Audi, P&G, J&J, Kraft Heinz, and Phillips (among many others) by helping them connect and respond to cultural change.  

  

We’re looking for a new Project Director to join our team and support us in delivering extraordinary insights and consulting for brands and organizations while helping clients make more environmentally and socially positive decisions.
Key Responsibilities


This role would work at the intersection of cultural insights, innovation, speculative futures, brand strategy, and creative strategy. In this role, you will:* plan and conduct research that addresses our clients’ challenges,
* identify and articulate the insights that our clients will find valuable and inspirational,
* produce reports and presentations delivered to clients with a high standard in terms of their structure, content, conclusions, and provocations,
* assist in managing external analysts, and
* assist in coordinating and communicating with clients.
Preferred Skills & Qualifications


* You will have 2-5 years of experience in a cultural research and insights, brand strategy, or creative strategy environment.
* Degree in semiotics, social science, cultural analysis, brand strategy, marketing, arts, design, or related field.
* Experience in semiotic analysis via social sciences or commercial arts alongside the interest to deepen this skill.
* Excellent written and verbal skills, with strength in being erudite, clear, nuanced, and engaging.
* Some experience with client management is important, as is a proven ability to work across multiple teams and projects.
* Intellectually curious, open, and aware of culture and communications, as well as being able to understand deeper connections, meanings, and dynamics within it. Able to shape and articulate an interesting point of view related to this understanding.
* Passionate about understanding culture to inform imaginative and progressive ways forward.
* An agile thinker and problem solver that is able to flex and improvise as well as frame — and reframe — your thinking.
* Comfortable navigating and working within ambiguity and complexity on projects.
* Proactive, with clarity of purpose.
* Excited to collaborate with an integrated, global team.
* Enthusiastic about working across a variety of categories and client challenges.

**Additional Useful Skills & Qualifications**


* Experience in:
	+ consumer/customer/user insights
	+ trends research and analysis
	+ data analytics platforms for research
	+ go-to-market strategy
* Interest in:
	+ sensory insight approaches
	+ speculative futures
* Additional language skills beyond English, particularly Spanish. As a global consultancy, this helps us stretch our work more effectively, especially in key markets: LATAM, EMEA, and APAC.
What We’re Like


Global, Yet Tight-knit


We have a global team with offices in the UK, Singapore, and North America. Many of us work remote, but we stay close with weekly company calls, and a yearly global gathering in Brighton, UK. We’re a warm group that is built on mutual support, exchange, and respect, with a good dose of humor in the mix.  

Career Growth


We believe that one of the key ways we grow our business is by growing ourselves. We support a non-linear progression through the business which appreciates individual spikes rather than forcing seniority through client or business skills. We value that everyone has a unique “honeycomb” of skills that builds our collective expertise and influence.  

Contribution over Fit


We invite having singular, perceptive, and insightful people that don’t fit any typical moulds, and are able to really contribute to our work by enriching it.  

No Passengers


At Space Doctors, we are deeply passionate about thinking critically about culture, how it’s shifting, understanding what that means for brands and organizations, and working with our clients to embed that understanding in their initiatives. This is not work that comes easily, nor in isolation. With that, everyone works to the fullest of their ability and pitches in to assist others swiftly and thoughtfully. We hope that anyone that joins our team finds their time with us to be challenging, exciting, and hugely rewarding.  

  

**Anticipated Salary Range & Benefits**  

For this particular role, the range is $75,000 - $95,000 a year for full time (depending on experience and skill level). Space Doctors provides an excellent benefits package to our team with generous PTO.  

  

*If you are interested in working with you but would be a better fit in a different role, register your interest at* contact@space-doctors.com.
About Human8


We're Human8, the human-driven consultancy, that connects brands with people and culture to drive positive change.  

  

Human8 is the coming-together of 10 game-changing agencies from around the world: InSites Consulting, Direction First, Columinate, eÿeka, Join the Dots, ABN Impact, Answer Global, Space Doctors, Gongos, and Happy Thinking People.  

  

We unite a creative, smart and ambitious group of +900 people across 23 locations under one vision: making brands more human by better understanding people and culture, empowering brands to take action, and enhancing the lives of the people they serve.
  
**Application Deadline**


March 29, 2024


**Department**


Client Delivery


**Employment Type**


Permanent - Full Time


**Location**


Global (Remote)


**Workplace type**


Fully remote


**Compensation**


$75,000 - $95,000 / year


**Reporting To**


Tamara Connolly

title: Director, IT & Infrastructure
description:
**About Us:**


Nationwide Marketing Group works on behalf of thousands of Independent appliance, furniture, bedding, electronics, specialty electronics, custom installation and rent-to-own dealers, helping them grow their businesses and thrive on their own terms. With more than 5,000 Members operating some 14,000 storefronts, Nationwide Marketing Group is the largest buying, marketing and business support organization of its kind, representing billions in combined annual sales across the membership. For over 50 years, the organization has remained committed to the Independent channel, empowering Members with the scale, sophistication and efficiencies they need to compete while delivering the unmatched business intelligence, tools and resources required to win in an ever-changing business environment. To learn more, visit our website at nationwidegroup.org or Nationwide Marketing Group LinkedIn

 **Job Location: Winston Salem, NC;** **Phoenix****, AZ; Open to US Remote Candidates**

 **Job Summary:**


The Director of IT and Infrastructure owns the underlying technical footprint upon which the rest of the organization operates. This leader is responsible for supporting our staff with the hardware and software tools they need to be productive and successful, providing efficient and effective delivery of a wide variety of services. This role is responsible for the implementation and ongoing care and feeding for the evolving technological landscape, ensuring the IT strategy supports operational efficiency, innovation, and competitive advantage. By championing the integration of modern IT solutions, this role ensures the organization is well-positioned to meet current demands while being adaptable to future challenges.


In this role, the Director of IT oversees a multifaceted team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration, best practice, business understanding, and empathy for our customers (internal and external). This is an exciting opportunity to both grow and motivate a talented technical team, as well as have a substantial positive impact on the business by driving operational excellence, managing risk, and optimizing budget allocation to support both immediate needs and long-term growth. Infrastructure plays a crucial role in enabling the organization to achieve its objectives and maintain its competitive edge in the market.

**Job** **Responsibilities:**

* **Strategic Planning and Execution:** Lead the development and implementation of comprehensive IT strategies to support the organization's goals, focusing on scalability, security, and efficiency.
* **Infrastructure Management:** Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of the organization's IT infrastructure to ensure high availability, performance, and scalability.
* **Team Management and Development:** Lead and develop a high-performing team of IT professionals, DevOps engineers, and software architects. Ensure ongoing skill development and adaptability to emerging technologies.
* **Budget Management:** Develop and manage the IT budget, ensuring strategic allocation of resources to projects and operations, and achieving cost efficiency.
* **Risk Management:** Identify, evaluate, and mitigate IT risks related to infrastructure, security, and compliance. Ensure disaster recovery and business continuity plans are in place and effective.
* **Vendor and Stakeholder Management:** Establish and maintain relationships with key vendors, partners, and stakeholders. Negotiate contracts and manage service level agreements (SLAs) to support IT objectives.
* **Innovation and Improvement:** Stay abreast of emerging technology trends and innovations. Recommend and implement improvements to processes, technologies, and systems to enhance productivity and customer satisfaction.


Including (but not limited to):

* Establish policies and procedures, including the selection, implementation, governance, and support of a variety of technologies
* Ensuring business continuity through backup and recovery plans, disaster recovery plans, high availability patterns, and early warning detection via monitoring/alerting/self-healing capabilities
* IT support operations, from helpdesk to the application production environments
* Support and governance of collaboration tools, including Office 365 tenants, Google Workspace tenants
* Support and governance of security technologies, including Active Directory domains, Security training for employees, AV and device security for user-issued equipment, security and access policies, key management, networking devices and endpoint connectivity
* Driving implementation and awareness of security best practices
* Participant in budgeting, purchasing, and financial planning exercises
* Manage hardware lifecycles, asset management, inventory tracking, support, and usage
* Maintaining infrastructure at all office locations, including proactive identification and planning for upgrades, configurations, and new systems or projects
* Establish relevant policies and procedures for the application production environments, including:
* Production and staging deployment processes (in concert with the development teams)
* Coordinate with development teams to ensure data integrity and service continuity throughout the SDLC
* Compliance (e.g. PCI, SOC 2)

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT management, with at least 4+ years in a role overseeing IT infrastructure, systems administration, DevOps, or help desk practices.
* Proven experience in IT strategy and policy planning and implementation
* Experience with IT infrastructure spend and budgeting
* Strong technical background in IT infrastructure technologies, cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), software architecture principles, and DevOps methodologies.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to lead under pressure.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., ITIL, PMP, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud certifications) are advantageous.

**Job Competencies:**

* Experience with scaled SaaS solutions, e-commerce and content platforms, customer web portal applications, and analytics dashboards.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies.

**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**


Must be able to read, write, and communicate both verbally and in written form to express and exchange ideas. While performing the responsibilities of this job, the employee must be able to access all components of workstation and other office equipment. Frequent typing, writing, bending, and twisting. Must be able to lift up to 10 pounds.


General office environment with moderate noise. This position is mostly sedentary, involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. A busy environment with many unscheduled interruptions. Frequent computer use at workstation for extended periods of time. Public contact position requiring appropriate business apparel.

**Why you want to work with us:**


Nationwide Marketing Group is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. We believe that the future of our organization depends on building a diverse, representative, and inclusive team. We strongly encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Should you need any reasonable accommodations through the interview process, please let us know.

 **NMG offers employees:**

* Competitive base pay and performance bonus, dependent on role.
* Medical, Dental, Vision with $0 cost Employee Only coverage options
* Employer Paid Basic Life/AD&D
* Employer Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* MetLife supplemental insurance benefit options
* Matching 401K with 100% vesting
* Open PTO Policy, Paid Holidays, Paid Maternity/Paternity to help you balance work and personal life
* Business casual work environment
* Discounts Program on Electronics, Cells Phones, Health & Wellness, Travel, Entertainment, Home & Auto, Pet Insurance and more!

title: Director, Analytics Solutions
description:
Job Summary:
The Director, Analytics Solutions is responsible for direction, design and implementation of data solutions, including data warehouse/data marts and business intelligence solutions, that support and enable analysis within the Analytics and Finance departments.
Essential Functions:* Direct and oversee end-to-end data solutions supporting multiple areas of analytics and finance
* Lead a cross-functional group of data analysts, engineering, and data architecture resources focused on creating easy-to-use and always accurate data subject areas for key indicators of health plan performance. Example subject areas include sources of truth for member months, incurred medical expense, health-care utilization, provider unit cost, and population acuity
* Develop ongoing data validation and data quality practices to reconcile key performance indicators to systems of record to create reliable and trusted sources of truth for medical economics, market finance, and actuarial sciences functions
* Develop a data strategy and roadmap to deliver an analytics data warehouse/data mart which enables rapid analytics and business insight
* Collaborate with Information Technology and other departments to deliver data solutions
* Develop and drive an Analytics Business Intelligence strategy in collaboration with other directors
* Collaborate with Finance and IT teams to extract and model data from enterprise financial systems / sources of truth, creating final target data objects that are easily consumable for analyst resources within an Azure Databricks environment
* Employ best-practice software development/solution development processes
* Support data extract needs for external vendors and third-party contractors
* Prioritize and translate business requirements into new/enhanced data solutions or services
* Facilitate sessions with cross-functional stakeholders to understand and define business requirements, business rules, technical requirements, and data flows/integration constructs
* Hire, train, develop and appraise staff effectively, ensuring a strong, competent and talented team of high integrity professionals, as well as development and adherence to departmental budget
* Perform any other job duties as requested


Education and Experience:* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Business, Computer Science a related field or equivalent years of relevant work experience is required
* Minimum of five (5) years of programming, analysis and specification experience required
* Four (4) years management experience required
* Three (3) years of healthcare experience required


Competencies, Knowledge and Skills:* Microsoft Power BI or Tableaux proficiency required
* Microsoft Azure and Databricks knowledge preferred
* Solid understanding of best practices, data modeling/architectural patterns, and governance methodologies
* Demonstrated understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Visualization design principles and best practices
* Ability to translate business requirements into technical specifications
* Possess very broad IT and Management knowledge
* Project planning and management skills
* Ability to manage concurrent projects with aggressive due dates
* Application programming, analysis and specification knowledge
* Skilled with multiple programming languages such as SQL, R, Python, Scala, etc.
* Data warehouse development expertise
* Advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving capabilities
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills to properly evaluate and interpret cross-functional requirements
* Skilled with Microsoft Office products
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to manage time effectively
* Effective organization and prioritization skills
* Effective facilitation and interpersonal skills
* Effective management and leadership skills
* Knowledge of the healthcare and/or managed care philosophy and environment


Licensure and Certification:* None


Working Conditions:* General office environment; may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time


Compensation Range:
$130,300.00 - $228,100.00
CareSource takes into consideration a combination of a candidate’s education, training, and experience as well as the position’s scope and complexity, the discretion and latitude required for the role, and other external and internal data when establishing a salary level. We are highly invested in every employee’s total well-being and offer a substantial and comprehensive total rewards package.
Compensation Type (hourly/salary):
Salary
Organization Level Competencies* Create an Inclusive Environment
* Cultivate Partnerships
* Develop Self and Others
* Drive Execution
* Influence Others
* Pursue Personal Excellence
* Understand the Business

  

This job description is not all inclusive. CareSource reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. CareSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veteran status. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Director, Process Engineering
description:
**Job Title: Director, Process Engineering**  

**Location: US (Remote), Menlo Park CA or Miami FL preferred**  

  

**Our Mission:**


To build a viable long-lasting health care organization that assumes full responsibility for designing, developing, trial enrolment, regulatory approval and commercializing patient, physician, caregiver, payor, and societal friendly medicinal therapy intended to improve quality of life, increase potential duration of life and resolve serious medical healthcare needs. We will accomplish this by building a team of world class scientists and business administrators that apply themselves to this mission.


**Summit Activities:**

  

  

We have in-licensed ivonescimab (SMT-112), which is a novel, potential first-in-class investigational bispecific antibody combining the effects of immunotherapy via a blockade of PD-1 with the anti-angiogenesis effects associated with blocking VEGF into a single molecule taking advantage of cooperative binding between the two. We initiated multiple phase-III clinical studies in the following Lung cancer indications:


* Ivonescimab combined with chemotherapy in patients with epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR)-mutated, locally advanced, or metastatic non-squamous non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have progressed after treatment with a third-generation EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) (“HARMONi”)
* Ivonescimab combined with chemotherapy in first-line metastatic squamous NSCLC patients (“HARMONi-3”)

  

  

*Ivonescimab is an investigational therapy that is not approved by any regulatory authority. It is currently being investigated in Phase III clinical studies.*


**Overview Of Role**


We are seeking an experienced bioprocess engineering professional to join the CMC team and support ongoing process development, technical transfer, BLA/IND/IMPD authoring and agency interaction activities, in preparation for commercialization (and/or incremental clinical studies). In particular, this role will focus on leading & authoring the CMC chapters of regulatory submitted documents, ensuring all required data integrity and technical compliance standards are met. This role will also contribute strategically and technically to future lifecycle considerations e.g. productivity improvements, scale-up vs. scale-out decisions etc..


The candidate must have a proven track record in supporting the development, scale-up, registration and manufacture of biologics processes. The candidate must also excel in communication and collaboration, as this role requires many interfaces both internal and external to Summit. The successful candidate will also be comfortable with change, being flexible to deal with shifting landscapes and new challenges.


**Roles and Responsibilities**


* **BLA/IND/IMPD Authoring**
	+ Be accountable to successfully deliver CMC chapters to regulatory documents
	+ Develop and execute processes to ensure data integrity
	+ Identify and close technical/content/compliance gaps
	+ Collaboratively work across the broader CMC, regulatory and quality departments to deliver desired outcomes (including external vendors when applicable)
	+ Actively support dialogue/interaction with regulatory agencies
	+ Support PLI/PAI preparation and delivery
* **Strategic / Technical**
	+ Develop lifecycle management strategy
	+ Understand key challenges and opportunities specific to product/process/supply chain
	+ Prioritize post-approval opportunities and develop business cases for further investment/development
	+ Support general problem solving and technical/strategic contributions across the CMC department/activities where applicable
* **Regulatory Compliance**
	+ Stay up to date on relevant regulatory requirements and guidelines related to biologics process development and manufacture
	+ Ensure all activities comply with Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) and other applicable regulations.
* **Risk Management**
	+ Identify potential risks and challenges within the development and filing history of products and develop mitigation plans
	+ Proactively address issues in the moment
* **Vendor Management**
	+ Oversee relationships with external vendors (where applicable), including CRO’s, consultants and technical services
* **Communication, Collaboration and Leadership**
	+ Subject matter and personnel leadership accountabilities
	+ Foster effective communication and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, including other CMC functions, Regulatory Affairs, Quality Assurance, and CRO’s/CDMO’s.
	+ Participate in project team meetings to provide updates on subject matter status and address any issues or concerns.

**Experience, Education and Specialized Knowledge and Skills**


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant scientific discipline; advanced degree preferred
* Minimum 15 years’ experience in bioprocess engineering, supporting the process development, scale-up and manufacture of biologics processes at a pharma, biotech or contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO)
* Experience with late phase product development, control strategy, validation and authoring/reviewing associated regulatory submissions
* Broad understanding of regulatory and GMP requirements for late phase/commercial biologics products
* Strategic thinker, ability to identify and prioritize action to maximize value and minimize risk over the mid to long term
* Project management skills, tools, principles, and applications
* Experience in overseeing external vendors
* Proficiency in relevant software applications
* Comfortable interacting with all levels of the organization, customers, and suppliers
* Able to work with abstract global problems
* Nimble in a highly dynamic and agile organization
* Intuitive with well-honed interpersonal and communication skills
* Organized and demonstrates effective team and subject matter leadership
* Effective with global workgroup associates
* A promotor of inclusion and collaboration
* Able to work independently
* Able to handle multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining high-quality results
* Capable of providing and implementing innovative solutions to unique and pressing situations
* Technically proficient in industry standard technology and/or available software, processes, and industry trends to streamline and or improve efficiencies
* Knowledgeable of and compliant with SOPs, Change Controls, Deviations, Investigations and CAPAs


The pay range for this role is at the director level is $212,000 to $224,000 annually. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor. The total compensation package for this position may also include bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable variable compensation. The successful candidate will also be eligible for health benefits, 401(k) with 6% employer match from day one, ESPP with a 15% discount up to the federal limit, flexible spending account among other benefits compensation.


Summit does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact Summit’s human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to Summit.

title: Head of Product- Platform (Remote)
description:
**Description**

The Director, Product Management develops and drives product strategies to deliver business results for our Firelight and ForeSight platforms. This role will predict trends and create roadmap themes that result in competitive advantage. This position reports to the Chief Product Officer.

**About Us:**

Join a team where we encourage creativity and innovation, champion teamwork and are committed to being the best. In this environment we strive to provide our clients best-in-class solutions that transform business processes and empower sales across all insurance, retirement and investment products.

Hexure, started with a simple goal: transform the insurance and financial services industry through powerful end-to-end sales solutions. For more than 25 years, carriers and distributors have depended on our commitment to innovation, speed to market delivery and deep domain expertise. Our solutions have been implemented within industry-leading insurance carriers and distribution firms. And our track record of empowering client success speaks for itself.

Together as a team, we strive to provide our clients best-in-class solutions that transform business processes and empower sales across all insurance, retirement and investment products. We endeavor to cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better solutions for our clients.

**Why you’ll love working here:**

* Generous benefit packages - We offer our employees competitive health insurance options, including medical, dental, and vision plans, as well as long term and short-term disability insurance.
* Pre-tax savings programs including flexible spending accounts, and a 401K that is competitively matched!
* Lifestyle Spending Account. This provides an employee the flexibility to spend benefit dollars on the things that matter most to them.
* Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO). Work-life balance is a key part of our company culture here at Hexure, and we know that our employees do their best work when they can take the time they need to rest and recharge.
* Office Closures – Inclusion and Diversity are integral to enhancing our culture. In support of this, we offer 6 companywide office closures and encourage all employees to use flexible PTO to celebrate religious or cultural holidays, employee birthdays, or other state or federal holidays that bring personal meaning.
* In addition to all the standard PTO options, Hexure proudly offers a generous and progressive paid Modern Family Leave policy.
* Professional Development - Hexure supports you and your professional development with a LinkedIn learning account.
* We also have employee anniversary perks, health, and wellness programs, and much more!
* Most benefits are effective on date of hire!

**Deliverables and Performance Measures:**

* Define the product roadmap to drive revenue growth.
* Identify revenue-generating opportunities by engaging with key stakeholders.
* Executes the company strategy through roadmap and thought leadership.
* Furthers SaaS and API platform through low-/no-code and features that reduce friction for platform users.
* Represent stakeholders by maintaining and prioritizing platform backlog to maintain best-in-industry illustration and quoting experiences.
* Keep the end user's experience at the center of the team’s decision making.
* Evangelize the Insurance Technologies solutions and excite customers and internal stakeholders about platform capabilities and developments.
* Institute a culture of customer engagement and continuous improvement.

**What will make you successful:**

* 8+ years' product leadership and product roadmap ownership resulting in notable revenue growth.
* 5+ years’ experience leading products that are B2B and configurable SaaS. Experience with platforms serving multi-sided marketplaces is a strong plus.
* Possess a thorough understanding of how to interpret business and technical needs and translate them into themes, epics, and user stories.
* Demonstrated skill with metrics and data analysis to develop, supervise and make data-driven decisions based on value delivered against strategic outcomes.

**Core Competencies**

**Interpersonal Skills:** Now more than ever, the ability to build relationships with team members and clients is pivotal to the success of our organization. We are looking for candidates who can communicate effectively and help cultivate an agile environment of collaboration and inclusion.

* Provides a definite sense of direction and purpose.
* Provides people with a clear understanding of how their work fits within a wider organization.
* Delivers presentations clearly and with high impact.
* Develops a trusted 2-way communication interface between the team and stakeholders.
* Promotes a high level of cooperation between all members of the work group.
* Looks for ways for team to work with other teams and divisions.
* Achieves objectives requiring a high level of cooperation from people in other parts of the organization.
* Takes the lead in resolving conflict within a work group.
* Keeps team informed of all relevant information affecting the organization, team members and their work.

**Personal Capabilities:** We believe that the way people manage themselves and their relationships with others in the workplace is critical to the success of our organization. We are looking for candidates that effectively put their knowledge, values, and skills into practice.

* Identifies and highlights new trends, potential problems and opportunities early.
* Effectively coaches others on how to analyze information to solve problems.
* Encourages and coaches others to seek alternative ways to solve complex problems.

**Focus on Results**: As a company that values innovation, we are looking for candidates who will help drive efforts to build commitment for individual and team objectives, as well as anticipate and respond to issues and opportunities that could affect the organization.

* Builds commitment in others for their individual and team objectives.
* Communicates expectations clearly.
* Promotes a strong sense of urgency for reaching goals.
* Follows through on commitments to ensure they are successfully. completed and goals are achieved.
* Follows through on commitments to ensure goal achievement
* Proactively addresses business demands.
* Fosters a team attitude of going above and beyond minimum requirements.
* Coaches team members on how to take action in the face of ambiguity.
* Avoids procrastination that may be damaging to the team or business.
* Rewards individuals for going above and beyond expectations.

**Customer Advocacy:** Our purpose is to empower our clients to deliver customer-centric sales experiences, accelerate speed to market, improve in-good-order sales and meet regulatory requirements. This requires a focus on our customer‘s satisfaction. We are looking for candidates who can understand the needs and concerns of our clients and address them quickly and expertly.

* Develops strong external network, including customers, competitors and leaders in other organizations, to bring in relevant information to the business.
* Helps others stay focused on customer needs.
* Has the ability and confidence to adapt business goals as a result of collected customer metrics.
* Encourages team to build and maintain relationships with external and internal stakeholders globally.

**Expected hours of Work:**

This is a full-time position with regular office hours Monday through Friday. This position may work with the India office a few days a week and will require an earlier start to the day around 6:30MT. This position may require after work hours and occasional weekends, depending on work demands.

This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee incumbent in this position. Employee will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties as requested.

A review of this position has excluded the marginal functions of the position that are incidental to the performance of fundamental job duties. All duties and responsibilities are essential job functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. To perform this job successfully, the employee must possess the skills, aptitudes and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills or abilities.

This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Director, Engineering
description:
**About Us**



Since 2016, dbt Labs has been on a mission to help analysts create and disseminate organizational knowledge. dbt Labs pioneered the practice of analytics engineering, built the primary tool in the analytics engineering toolbox, and has been fortunate enough to see a fantastic community coalesce to help push the boundaries of the analytics engineering workflow. Today there are 30,000 companies using dbt every week, 100,000 dbt Community members, and over 4,100 dbt Cloud customers. You can learn more about our values here.  


dbt Labs is a mission-driven company. We seek to unlock the value of transform to power the data ecosystem. We are looking for a Director of Engineering to join us and lead teams building the transformation workflows at the heart of dbt Cloud.
  

  

In this role, you will manage and develop product engineering teams, oversee execution, and build an organization dedicated to delighting data practitioners. You will work on projects at every stage of the pipeline, improving our quality and reliability from discovery through operations. Expect to work with autonomy, advocate for best-in-class practices, and collaborate with teams across dbt Labs. This is a pivotal year for us, and you will have the opportunity to create exciting new customer experiences for all data practitioners.


**Responsibilities**


* Report directly to the CTO, and manage multiple teams of software engineers with broad responsibilities across multiple products and technologies.
* Collaborate with product management on vision and strategy for core workflows for data practitioners, aligned with customer goals and business needs.
* Ensure technical excellence across the entire organization, including architecture, tech debt management, tooling, quality, reliability, and overall velocity.
* Build strong relationships with peers in product management and customer facing teams in our go to market organization. Effectively communicate vision and progress to stakeholders around the company.
* Guide recruiting for your group through the lens of long-term vision. Partner with People leadership to track progress and evolve our program and capabilities.
* Develop your organization through technical guidance, coaching, mentoring, hiring, and rolling up your sleeves when you find gaps.
* Champion our values and our mission.


**Qualifications**


* Experience managing managers, groups of 25+ engineers, and coordinating delivery of projects across multiple teams.
* Background and deep interest technology. We need this leader to lead and bond with all the engineers on their team and also have the technical depth to gain the respect of and lead our most senior engineers.
* Demonstrated ability to work across a team of engineering managers and directors in a collaborative fashion to share resources and collectively drive quality and operational excellence.
* Desire to work with our GTM teams and product management to understand how our products are delighting and disappointing customers.
* Willingness to get into details, and the experience to know when your managers should solve problems independently.
* Desire to bring data to bear to solve problems, and use data to prove out our assumptions.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills. We prefer an open, collaborative communication style.
* You optimize for long-term value, with a pragmatic point of view on bringing near-term solutions when business goals require.
* You thrive in fast-paced and rapidly changing startup environments.


**Compensation & Benefits**


* **Salary**: $246,000-$298,000
* **Equity Stake**
* **Benefits -** dbt Labs offers:
	+ Unlimited vacation (and yes we use it!)
	+ 401k w/3% guaranteed contribution
	+ Excellent healthcare
	+ Paid Parental Leave
	+ Wellness stipend
	+ Home office stipend, and more!

### **What to expect in the hiring process** **(all video interviews via Zoom unless accommodations are needed):**


* Interview with a Talent Acquisition Partner
* Interview with the CTO
* Team Interviews (1:1s) with team members and other stakeholders
* A white boarding session with Engineering Leadership
* A values interview with the CEO


#LI-DNI


**Who we are**



At dbt Labs, we have developed strong opinions on how companies should practice analytics.



Specifically, we believe that:


* Code, not graphical user interfaces, is the best abstraction to express complex analytic logic
* Data analysts should adopt similar practices and tools to software developers
* Critical analytics infrastructure should be controlled by its users as open source software
* Analytic code itself — not just analytics tools — will increasingly be open source


It turns out that a lot of other people believe this too! Today, there are 30,000 companies using dbt every week, 100,000 dbt Community members, and 4,100 companies paying for dbt Cloud. Our customers include JetBlue, Hubspot, Vodafone New Zealand, and Dunelm. dbt is synonymous with the practice of analytics engineering, defining an entire industry. We’re backed by top investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia Capital, and Altimeter.


*dbt Labs is an equal opportunity employer. We're committed to building an inclusive team that welcomes a diversity of perspectives, people, and backgrounds regardless of race, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, disability, citizenship, veteran status, or any other protected status. We feel strongly that whether or not your experience exactly fits the job description, your passion and skills will stand out and set you apart even if your career has taken some twists and turns. If you are on the fence about whether you meet our requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway! Please reach out to us directly at recruiting@**dbtlabs.com* *if you need assistance or an accommodation**.*



Want to learn more about our focus on Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at dbt Labs? Check out our DEI page\\.


*dbt Labs reserves the right to amend or withdraw the posting at any time. For employees outside the United States, dbt Labs offers a competitive benefits package.* *Equity or comparable benefits may be offered depending on the legal or country limitations.*

title: Director of IT
description:
**About Lilac Solutions, Inc.**



Lilac Solutions is a lithium extraction technology company focused on scaling lithium production for the electric vehicle era. Lilac solves the critical technology problems which today prevent development of the world's largest lithium resources: low yields, high costs, slow start-up, poor reliability, and massive environmental impacts. Lilac's technology represents such a step-change in performance and cost that it also unlocks the development of new unconventional lithium deposits with low lithium grades and high impurities, which have historically been impossible to produce. In 2021, Lilac raised $150M in Series B financing from investors including T. Rowe Price, Lowercarbon Capital, Breakthrough Energy Ventures, Sumitomo, BMW and SK Materials. Lilac is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace.

**Job Description**



The IT Director will oversee all IT (Information Technology) functions in our company. You will oversee managing the company's IT team (IT operations/Help Desk and Solutions) as well as work on the implementation of new IT systems and policies in support of Lilac's business. As a senior member of our staff you will be a trusted advisor to the executive leadership on all matters related to IT. The ideal candidate will be experienced in creating and implementing IT policies and systems that will meet objectives while influencing and motivating those around you to adopt them. This role is preferred to be based in Oakland, CA, but is also open to candidates located in Fernley, NV, Salt Lake City, UT, or remote candidates.



The goal is to ensure IT systems and people are effective and functioning within the limits of budget, time and specifications of the company.


**Job Responsibilities**


* Manage and develop a team of [3] IT Operations and [1] IT Solutions professionals to deliver effective IT services for Lilac, including but not limited to: Help Desk, Asset Management (Hardware & Software), Information Security, Data Management, Network & infrastructure Solutions, scoping, impanation and management of SaaS projects, etc.
* Devise and establish IT policies and systems to support the implementation of strategies set by upper management
* Analyze the business requirements of all departments to determine their technology needs and deliver solutions as appropriate
* Purchase efficient and cost-effective technological equipment and software
* Inspect the use of technological equipment and software to ensure functionality and efficiency
* Identify the need for upgrades, configurations or new systems and report to upper management
* Control budget and report on expenditure
* Assist in building relationships with vendors and creating cost-efficient contracts


**Candidate Qualifications**


* 8+ years of experience working in IT operations, supervising technology teams, and overseeing large information technology projects. Proven experience as IT director or similar role is a plus
* BSc/BA in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems or related field; MSc/MA is a plus
* Excellent understanding of computer systems, cyber-security, network and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and telecommunications systems
* Experience in controlling information technology budget
* Excellent organizational and leadership skills
* Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate with teams across the entire organization
* Experience working for a high growth company rapidly scaling headcount and evolving IT needs
* Experience working in an international organization
* Commitment to fostering a positive and high-performance company culture


**Compensation**


* Salary range: $175-$225k annually (commensurate with experience)
* Stock options
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Long-term disability insurance
* 401k with pre- and post-tax investing options
* Flexible Paid Time Off Policy
* Eight weeks of Paid Parental Leave
* Onsite Gym and Daily Catered Lunch for Oakland Employees
* Monthly phone stipend
* Private secured parking with EV charging stations


**EEO Statement**



Lilac Solutions is committed to providing a professional work environment free from discrimination and harassment, including discrimination and harassment based on a protected category, and an environment free from retaliation for participating in any protected activity. Lilac Solutions is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.

title: Director of Technology
description:
**Job Description: Director of Technology**

**Company Overview:** MyeTech, your single source of truth for technology news on AI trends, gaming, hardware, software reviews, and more. Based in the U.S., our content reach expands globally, yet offers catered solutions to U.S. customers. With strong deliverables for blogging, digital marketing, and e-commerce, MyeTech has positioned itself to become a premium outlet for tech consumption.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a dynamic and experienced **Director of Technology** to lead our software development team. As the Director of Technology, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our technical vision, driving innovation, and ensuring successful project execution. Your expertise in program management, project management, and team leadership will be critical to our organization’s success.

**Responsibilities:**

**Program Management and Project Leadership:**

* Oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of software projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and timelines.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project scope, objectives, and success criteria.
* Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement by optimizing processes and methodologies.

**Software Development and Technical Guidance:**

* Provide hands-on technical guidance to the development team, including software engineers, API specialists, and automation experts.
* Lead by example, contributing to code reviews, architecture discussions, and system design.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to drive innovation within the organization.

**Team Management:**

* Manage and mentor a team of junior developers, fostering their growth and professional development.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations, set goals, and provide constructive feedback.
* Create a collaborative and inclusive environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.

**Qualifications:**

* **Full-Stack Software Development Experience:**
* Proficiency in front-end, back-end, and database development.
* Strong understanding of modern web technologies, frameworks, and APIs.
* **Program and Project Management Skills:**
* Demonstrated experience managing complex software projects from inception to delivery.
* Ability to balance competing priorities, allocate resources effectively, and meet deadlines.
* **Leadership and Coaching:**
* Proven ability to lead and inspire a technical team.
* Experience coaching and mentoring junior developers.
* **Location Requirement:**
* Candidates must be based in the United States.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working in an agile development environment.
* Familiarity with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Previous exposure to DevOps practices and automation scripting.

If you are passionate about technology, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are ready to make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us as we shape the future of our organization through innovation and excellence!

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $116,000.00 - $350,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Parental leave
* Referral program

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract
* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay
* Monthly bonus
* Performance bonus
* Quarterly bonus
* Yearly bonus

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* Do you have, at minimum, at least 4+ years of full-stack software development experience? Though this is a remote position, you must reside within the 48-continental states of the U.S. in order to be considered. Despite an estimated pay range of $116K-$350K, note that this position does not provide a base salary and is contracted on a revenue share basis, which could exceed these values. Though the potential to receive a 7-figure annual pay exists, contractors would not be provided traditional benefits such as 401K, medical, dental, etc. Are you comfortable working on a revenue share basis?

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Head of Corporate IT Operations
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:**



Nymbus (https://nymbus.com/) isn't just a leader in fintech; we're a community of innovators passionate about reimagining banking. Our award-winning modern core platform and cloud-based technology serve as the backbone for financial institutions eager to modernize and excel.



Here, you won't just be part of a tech revolution; you'll be at the helm, driving change. You'll fit right in if you're a creative thinker eager to lessen technical debt and elevate agility for banks and credit unions. Our culture thrives on collaboration, integrity, and a client-first approach.



Your journey with us won't simply advance your career; it will offer the chance to shape an industry alongside like-minded professionals. We're excited to consider you a key player in this transformative chapter. Thank you for contemplating a role with Nymbus.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**:



We are a remote first company with the exception of a few positions being onsite in our designated locations. The positions which are remote, you will need to be able to travel a few times a year. You may be required at times to visit client sites or attend meetings at designated locations with your team members.

  


**POSITION SUMMARY**



The Nymbus IT Corporate team is composed of engineers responsible for the tools supporting the infrastructure of the company. Our team culture empowers you to take ownership of your work and its outcome. This is a unique opportunity for a self-motivated individual to work with an innovative team. We are looking for candidates who can work collaboratively to resolve problems and have a high tolerance for complexity and ambiguity.



You must be able to manage an internal corporate IT department including:


* IT systems technology and control structures,
* Manage hardware inventory in US, Mexico and overseas
* Advanced knowledge of Windows and Mac operating systems,
* Experience in IT support and ticketing procedures


This is more than a hands-on technical and leadership role, where you will be expected to take charge of problems, and take the initiative to design, recommend, and deliver solutions. We run teams that have a strong desire to learn, innovate, research, and apply new technologies and methods as needed. We are looking for candidates who enjoy mentoring teammates and developing those around them.


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Provide strategic direction for the company's corporate systems
* Set and manage Enterprise IT priorities and provide regular status reporting to management and key stakeholders
* Develop cost effective, innovative solutions to technology challenges across the company
* Develop and maintain departmental system documentation and procedures
* Lead and mentor IT staff. Manage the IT helpdesk. Lead goal setting and performance review processes for the team.
* Represent IT to customers, company's leadership team, and auditors. Serve as the primary escalation point for IT needs across the company
* Serve as system administrator for a variety of corporate systems, including Identity Providers, SaaS and on-premise applications, remote desktop environments and end user workstations
* Ensure appropriate change management procedures are followed
* Manage hardware inventory including Mac, PC, and office equipment in the US, Mexico and overseas
* Lead procurement efforts for corporate systems (identifying and selecting vendors, negotiating prices and terms, contract review and coordinating required approvals)
* Manage the IT budget and find opportunities to optimize spend
* Manage key technology projects including new implementations, upgrades, conversions and decommissions
* Identify, investigate & implement new tools/products/services.
* Incident & Escalation Management – surrounding email and phone outages.
* Conduct periodic reviews of IT Support and ticketing performance
* Work directly with internal risk and compliance teams to ensure compliance with controls and banking related regulatory policies.
* Create (hire), grow, train, and manage a high-performance team

  


**SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:**


* Oversee a SaaS or PaaS IT Operations for 3+ years
* Bachelor's degree with 10+ years of relevant professional experience with progressively increasing responsibility in IT delivery
* Demonstrates thought leader-level abilities as a team leader
* Proficient in IT systems terminology
* Advance background in ERP
* Experience in data encryption
* Experience with global on-premise cloud compute operations
* Supporting annual compliance activities with knowledge of ISO-27001 SOX, PCI, SOC-2, HiTrust etc; and
* Demonstrating hands-on industry experience within one or more of the following cloud platforms: Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform

  


**SALARY & BENEFITS:**


* $155,000 - $175,000 Annual Salary
* Annual Cash Bonus and Equity Options commensurate with the role level and experience
* 100% Fully Remote
* Robust 401(k) plan with company match
* Insurance - Health, Dental and Vision (Nymbus covers 100% of the Healthcare and Basic Dental premiums)
* Time Off Nymbus (The Company) offers six types of Time Off to our employees:
+ 1. Flexible Paid Time Off (Flexible PTO) - no cap per year
+ 2. Sick Time - seven (7) paid Sick days per calendar year
+ 3. Holidays - eleven (11) paid Fixed Holidays per calendar year
+ 4. Jury Duty
+ 5. Volunteer Time - one (1) day per calendar year
+ 6. Leaves of Absence

Ready to join? We invite you to watch this video and learn who we are and how we build and innovates together!



Let's Go!

title: Director, Operational Excellence
description:
**Location:**  

Coral Springs, FL, US
  
  

**Job Family:** Information Technology
  
**Country/Region:** United States
  
  

Job Function Summary
  
  

As a key member of the Direct leadership team, the Director of Operational Excellence is tasked with spearheading lean process improvements within our Direct business. This role is crucial for establishing and maintaining process governance, identifying and implementing opportunities for improvement, and ensuring effective communication of results. Positioned at the crucial intersection of operations and contracts/compliance, this leader plays a pivotal role in shaping the efficiency and effectiveness of our business processes, and consequently the reliability of the services we provide.
  
  

Major Areas of Accountability
  
  

Team Leadership – This role involves managing, coaching, and developing leaders and staff within the Operational Excellence function. Areas under this purview include teams such as automation, software development, and process excellence. The Director will provide leadership, mentoring, and training in general but also on the use and practice of lean methodology and process improvement tools and techniques, extending this guidance throughout the organization. Responsibilities also include the hiring and staffing of direct reports.
  
  

Continuous improvement programs – The Director will lead the design and execution of comprehensive process improvement programs. These initiatives aim to enhance customer service experiences and continuously evolve operational efficiency across key processes. The role involves identifying critical process gaps, implementing continuous improvement methodologies (both existing and new), establishing prioritization and governance frameworks, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement organization-wide. Collaboration with business leaders to build requirements and ensure proposed solutions meet business needs is essential. The Director will also communicate updates to Leadership team and relevant stakeholders.
  
  

Quality Assurance program management – Responsible for building and maintaining a robust Quality Assurance program, focused on reducing customer complaints and improving service quality through stringent QA standards and processes. This includes automated testing, feedback loops, ongoing process auditing, and leadership feedback. Maintaining a strong training and coaching program, and team to execute, is essential to secure operational improvements and enhance staff capabilities.
  
  

Software management and development – Manage the selection, implementation, and optimization of operational efficiency tools in collaboration with key stakeholders. Responsibilities include vendor negotiations and custom solution development with a key focus on data security, compliance, and maintaining a minimal yet effective ecosystem to provide reliable and personalized service to our end users.
  
  

Analytics and reporting – Responsible for the delivery and maintenance of reporting on operations and performance to stakeholders across the operation and management to aid in operational execution and performance management.
  
  

Compliance and process adherence – Assure all processes and SOPs are in compliance with our HIPAA privacy standards, all state and local laws, our Accrediting agency, OSHA, Medicare/Medicaid, Third-Party and private payor guidelines. Promotes adherence to all corporate policies, practices and compliance programs. Look for ways to improve the department and streamline processes. Conforms with Coloplast Q/EHS Policy (http://www.coloplast.com/About/responsibility/Documents/QEHS%20policy.pdf)
  
  

Other duties as assigned
  
  

Essential Qualifications
  
  

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  
Minimum of 10 years’ experience in operations, lean, process management, or similar role
  
Minimum of 10 years’ experience managing a team in a fast-paced DME or healthcare environment
  
Strong process and business acumen and excellent strategic business understanding
  
Deep knowledge of and experience in process improvement and team leadership
  
Knowledge of US healthcare, incl. Medicare, Medicaid, commercial insurers, and related regulations
  
Able to effectively communicate with all levels and areas of the organization, leading multiple projects and manage deadlines; proficient in English
  
Willingness and ability to travel, including overnight – up to 30%
  
  

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  
  

Exceptional interpersonal skills with a high degree of personal integrity, compassion and savvy to foster a collaborative and partnership-based approach to achieve company initiatives, with both internal business partners, as well as, external companies.
  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills coupled with solid financial and business acumen
  
Skilled project management in terms of both leading the thought content and managing the process
  
Experience working and managing in an enterprise environment
  
Comfort Medical employees are required to conduct business to the highest ethical and professional standards; comply with applicable laws and regulations, the Advamed Code of Ethics on Interactions with Healthcare Professionals, and company policies.
  
  

Comfort Medical provides an extensive selection of name brand catheter and ostomy supplies to thousands of customers nationwide. Our attention to detail, unmatched customer service, and dedication to helping our customers live happier, healthier lives are just a few of the many reasons we are one of the fastest growing catheter and ostomy supply companies in the nation!
  
  

Comfort Medical employees are required to conduct business to the highest ethical and professional standards; comply with applicable laws and regulations, the Advamed Code of Ethics on Interactions with Healthcare Professionals, and company policies.
  
  

Comfort Medical is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) which means we employ and promote individuals based on their merits, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, status with regards to public assistance or any other protected classification.
