title: Director of Outbound Product Management
description:
**The Company**: Mend is passionate about safeguarding the applications that power our digital world. We are a fast-growing company with a vision for building next-level application security that developers and security teams both love to use. We have offices in Boston and Tel-Aviv as well as a global workforce of remote workers.


Our culture is open, inclusive, and engaging, and we work hard to foster a company where everyone feels valued. Mend is a company that lives by its values:

* We are passionate about excellence
* We see the world from the customer perspective
* We are better together

**Location:** Eastern United States (Home Office)

**Responsibilities:**

* Champion the portfolio and products to internal and external audiences, and spend a significant amount of time talking to customers, prospects, partners, industry analysts, and field personnel.
* As the voice of the customer, you will need to gain insights on the market, customer challenges and then be able to clearly articulate market and customer requirements and priorities back into the product team
* Conduct customer briefings, analyst updates, field training, partner enablement, content creation, and more
* Understand the competitive landscape to create clear insights on differentiation in support of product decisions and GTM
* Work closely with the Product Marketing team and help them to be successful in creating deep analysis of win/loss and competitive differentiation
* Ensure Mend.io has a relevant, customer-focused strategy for every product in the portfolio. That means doing things like advocating for new products and features, owning and updating roadmaps, and helping construct cross-product strategies
* Work with strategic partners on defining mutual winning products
* Be part of the product leadership reporting to the EVP of Product that drives product strategy and vision

  

Requirements:  

  

**Requirements:**

* Foundational product management skills, technical expertise, and a focus on product success.
* Experience working in B2B SaaS companies
* Minimum 3 years experience in Application Security-Must
* Significant experience with software development lifecycle
* Minimum 5 years’ experience in a Product Management or product marketing in a software development company or previous SaaS experience
* Minimum 3 years’ experience with outbound Product Management activities
* Excellent English verbal and written communication skills with a variety of audiences
* Ability to manage multiple projects and features at one time
* Good planning and time management skills

**The Benefits:** Mend lives out its employee-centric culture by providing comprehensive benefits to its employees:

* Competitive compensation
* Affordable Health Insurances (8 plans to choose from), Dental and Vision
* Flexible and Generous PTO
* 401k with company match
* Equity
* Paid Parental Leave
* Monthly Work from Home Allowance
* One Time Home Office Set-up Stipend for Remote Roles
* Monthly team social events (locally and virtually)
* Collaborative and innovative environment
* Leadership that supports and encourages professional growth and development

**Mend's EEO Statement**


Mend is an equal opportunity employer committed to encouraging and celebrating its diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome all without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender identity and expression, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, veteran status, political affiliation, or any other protected characteristics. All aspects of employment including hiring, training, advancement, and discipline will be solely based on merit and qualifications related to professional competence. Mend operates on a principle of mutual respect and acceptance, and every employee must follow Mend’s anti-harassment and anti-discrimination company policies.

**Mend’s Diversity Commitment**


At Mend, we believe bringing together diversity of experience and background creates a better place to work, a better product, and more opportunities to innovate. Mend is committed to doing its part to mend the equity gap, fostering a safe, inclusive environment to inspire and support employees to be their authentic selves and provide development opportunities for all.

  

#LI-Remote

title: Director of IT, Financial Systems
description:
As a leading mountain resort operator with over 40 resorts in sixteen states and four countries. We exist to create an *Experience of a Lifetime* for our employees, so they can, in turn, provide and *Experience of a Lifetime* for our guests. We are looking for leaders, innovators, creators, and ambitious professionals to join our talented team. If you’re ready to pursue your fullest potential, we want to get to know you!

  

Many of our Corporate function teams can now live and work in any of the states in which Vail Resorts currently operates\\* – enabling flexible remote work alongside a commitment to building and maintaining strong culture both in person and virtually. If you’re ready to pursue your fullest potential, we want to get to know you. Find your purpose with us at www.vailresortscareers.com.

  

Candidates for year-round positions are reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications will be accepted up to 90 days after the posting date, or until the position is filled (whichever is first).

 **Job Classification:** Year Round

**Job Type:** Full Time

**Location:** Remote

 **Job Summary:**


The Finance Technology Director is responsible for partnering across IT and Finance to deliver key initiatives for the organization. This talented individual will manage the overall finance technology roadmap and project portfolio, and will deliver forward-thinking creative solutions that help to drive the technology strategy. Experience with Finance application transformations (on-prem to the cloud) is preferred.


The Director’s day-to-day activities include delivery of large projects, ongoing releases, rigorous prioritization, vendor release management and planning, and alignment of internal and vendor roadmaps to our business objectives and IT resources.


This role is responsible for managing and mentoring a team of Project Managers, Solution Architects, Developers and Business Analyst professionals to deliver scalable and efficient processes and expanded capabilities to the Finance organization.


This is a leadership role with direct interactions with the CIO and CFO and their leadership teams, reporting to the VP of Line of Business Technology.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

  

 Drive:


* Develop and drive the accountability of business objectives and supporting IT initiatives.
* Provide project/program facilitation and oversight; facilitate agreement on objectives and success measures, provide overall project/program issue resolution and roadblock removal.
* Ensure timely and consistent communication to facilitate a clear understanding of ongoing projects and their prioritization within the organization
* Assist in the finalization of the Finance, Accounting, and Procurement business strategy
* Lead and organize efforts to plan and develop key events to achieve desired outcomes (e.g., management and leadership meetings). Facilitate and manage the definition of agendas, materials, review cycles, timelines, etc.
* Deliver high-impact solutions by identifying key issues, defining appropriate work structure, and driving workable recommendations that create value
* Partner closely at the Vice President and Director levels to support key areas of work that focus on highest priorities, including suggesting and managing the best time allocation and use of group meetings


Connect:


* Inspire trust and build strong, authentic, productive relationships within the Finance Technology team and with key stakeholders.
* Effectively engage and collaborate with leadership across the organization to develop, define and build on innovative ideas and business priorities.
* Engage broadly and deeply across the organization to connect information and people to drive enterprise projects, programs, and initiatives
* Use expertise and relationships to influence key stakeholders


Develop:


* Create an environment of continual improvement both inside and outside of direct team.
* Demonstrate the ability to learn and develop as a self-starter requiring little direction. We are looking for someone who shows the potential to do more and is a natural leader.


Out Front:

* Anticipate the needs of key leadership, facilitate and motivate those around you to identify solutions that improve the employee experience and advance business objectives.

Re-Imagine:

* Partner with Finance stakeholders to understand their drivers and needs, and uses that knowledge and those relationships to drive effective prioritization and roadmaps for delivery
* Bring new ideas, methods, and approaches to Vail Resorts and this role. Leverage expertise to challenge the status quo and drive decisions and actions necessary to improve our business processes and related technology.


 Passion:

* Demonstrate an unyielding passion for the employee experience, culture, mission and vision. Lead by example and inspire others to follow.

 **Job Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in business, technology, or related field
* 8+ years of relevant work experience including proven ability to successfully lead and oversee critical projects and multi-faceted efforts
* Experience managing ERP’s (ex: PeopleSoft, SAP, Workday) and other smaller applications (ex: Coupa, Concur, Planful, OnBase) is preferred
* Strong working knowledge and understanding of key concepts in Finance, Accounting, and Procure-to-Pay business areas
* Authentically connect with and lead others who do not directly report to you
* Successful partnership with Director and VP levels within Finance, Accounting, Procurement, and related technology leaders
* Business advocate with a deep understanding in technology with experience delivering complex projects

  



**Additional Requirements**


Leadership:

* Ability to lead a dynamic team – providing coaching, timely feedback, and opportunities for the team members
* Ability to drive strategy, vision, direction, and prioritization on enterprise-wide projects and programs at the Executive level.
* Can manage initiatives from concept through to completion, including the development and presentation of a business case.
* Applies systems thinking to generate new thoughts and opportunities; has ability to build on strategic and innovative thoughts/ideas.
* Informed on industry standards and practices, and a forward thinker on new innovative approaches.
* Experience in digital transformations is preferred


Project Management:

* Ability to socialize and manage a portfolio of projects supporting stated strategic objectives.
* Manage business operational impacts as well as technical components of the program or project.
* Work with internal and external teams to develop and execute a comprehensive QA approach for enterprise-wide projects and programs.
* Provide vision and leadership regarding organizational design and resourcing of large, complex and undefined enterprise-wide initiatives including all aspects of management from vision through execution.
* Ability to manage/oversee internal and contract resources across multiple projects.


Financials:

* Manage enterprise-wide programs with complex financial models including internal and external stakeholders and complex contract negotiation.
* Participate in the annual expense and capital budgeting processes for both Finance and IT
* Manage team’s OpEx budget and the capital budgets associated with different initiatives


Vendor Management:

* Adept at managing relationships with vendors and other external partners, influencing product roadmaps, resourcing, and financial management to ensure the best possible long-term outcomes.
* Experience negotiating vendor contracts.

  

The expected Total Compensation for this role is $129,900 - $166,950 + annual bonus + equity. Individual compensation decisions are based on a variety of factors.

  

The perks include a free ski pass, and a set of benefits including...

* Medical, Dental, Vision insurance, and a 401(k) retirement plan
* Hourly employees are generally eligible for accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) and Sick Time. Salaried employees are generally eligible for Flexible Time Off (FTO)
* Paid Parental Leave for eligible mothers and fathers
* Healthcare & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
* Life, AD&D, and disability insurance

 **Reach Your Peak at Vail Resorts.** At Vail Resorts, our team is made whole by the brave, passionate individuals who ambitiously push boundaries and challenge the status quo. Whether you’re looking for seasonal work or the career of a lifetime, join us today to reach your peak.

* ***Remote work is currently permitted from British Columbia and the 16 U.S. states in which we currently operate. This includes: California, Colorado, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, Nevada, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Utah, Vermont, Washington State, Wisconsin, and Wyoming. Please note that the ability to work remotely, and the particulars related to such work, are subject to change at any time; and, accordingly, the Company reserves the right to change its policies and/or require in-person/in-office work at any time in its sole discretion.***

 *Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.*

 *Requisition ID 500123*  

*Reference Date: 02/12/2024*  

*Job Code Function: Applications*

title: Director of Sustainability
description:
***As an essential business, Anomatic produces innovative and sustainable packaging for today’s biggest brands. By leveraging over five decades of manufacturing*** ***expertise and employing an extensive technologies portfolio, we design, manufacture, and finish incomparable stock and customized solutions for numerous markets.***


**Location:** Open to onsite (New Albany, Ohio), Hybrid, or Remote within the United States
**Reports to:** Chief Executive Officer
\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_
**Summary/Objective**
Reporting directly to the Chief Executive Officer, the Director of Sustainability will lead our commitment to sustainable practices, playing a pivotal role in shaping the future of our products and manufacturing processes. The Director’s primary responsibility will be to oversee and drive the company's sustainability initiatives, ensuring the organization’s business practices and products are aligned with long-term environmental goals.
**Essential Functions -** *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*
* Establish and oversee the comprehensive mission, execution, and effectiveness of sustainability programs and initiatives internally across Anomatic manufacturing plants in the US and China, as well as aligning the goals with external stakeholders
* Proposes and implements strategies to address various environmental concerns including energy use, conservation, reduction of pollution, recycling, building and facility design, and general education on sustainability.
* Define and communicate purpose to drive sustainable transformation while fostering internal cultural change.
* Assesses and analyzes company policies and processes to identify areas in and processes to which improvements can be made in accordance with the organization's commitment to sustainability.
* Oversees Anomatic Product Safety programs and reporting: REACH, FDA, Proposition 65, CONEG, RCLA, etc.
* Collaborates with appropriate departmental managers to facilitate CSR/ESG monitoring and reporting.
* Provides commercial team support for customer sustainability activities.
* Drafts and prepares reports, presentations, and proposals including external CSR and Sustainability audits & reports (Annual & Quarterly CSR/ESG/Sustainability reporting, EcoVadis, CDP, TRASCE, Intertek, etc.).
* Identifies and facilitates training as needed.

**Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s Degree (B.A./B.S.) from four-year college or university in technical field, Biological or Environmental Science/Engineering, Physical Sciences, Engineering, Material Science, or related field, preferred
* Five or more years of demonstrated leadership in developing and implementing sustainability programs in a manufacturing environment required
* Experience in consumer product sustainability program management (Cosmetics & Personal care, Food packaging, Household consumer product packaging, Consumer electronics).
* Thorough and current knowledge of sustainability practices, and applicable laws and regulations.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills with the ability to drive initiatives from conception to implementation.
* Professional certifications in sustainability, project management ISO management preferred.
* Strong materials and manufacturing knowledge.
* Knowledge of ISO accredited management systems (9001, 14001, 14064, 45001, 26000, etc.).
* Ability to travel internationally, particularly between Europe, China and the United States

**Competencies**
* Strong work ethic, initiative, and commitment to the business
* Superior organization skills, ability to prioritize, multi-task and delegate
* Positive attitude and teamwork among all internal and external customers

**Supervisory Responsibility**
This position has direct supervisory responsibilities: No
**Travel**
This position requires travel: Yes, domestic and international
**Salary Information**
This role offers a competitive salary in the range of $120,000 to $200,000 and is eligible for bonus compensation as well. Actual compensation depends on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate's experience and qualifications.

**WHO WE ARE.**
**Our VISION**
“To inspire the world of consumer packaging”.
**Our MISSION**
“We bring passion to packaging”.
**Our VALUES**
* People & Safety First
* Integrity, Respect, Trust
* Continuous Improvement Mindset
* Accountability

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.*

title: Director of Data and Analytics
description:
**About Us:**

Big Fish Capital operates as an early-stage investment fund overseeing various businesses including eCommerce, Legal Services, and Alternative Financial Services. Within our ecosystem, a key operation serves as an independent online marketplace for outdoor gear, aiming to democratize access to outdoor equipment and foster community engagement in outdoor activities. Our legal arm specializes in handling a variety of insurance-related issues nationwide, including property damage claims and homeowner insurance claims. Lastly, our financial services division stands as a premier advisory firm in the precious metal investment arena where we offer guidance on product selection, portfolio diversification, retirement account options, valuation, and other key aspects of the precious metals markets.

**Position Overview:** 

We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Director of Data and Analytics with a strong background in enterprise data and analytics. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the entire data and analytics function, with a focus on CRM systems, data architecture, business intelligence reporting, customer acquisition functions, and more. This individual will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy, optimizing data processes, and driving business growth through data-driven decision making.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a relevant role within data and analytics, with a focus on enterprise data engineering and architecture.
* Extensive experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) and business intelligence platforms (e.g., Dataroma, PowerBI).
* Proficiency in data analysis and modeling using R and Python.
* Strong organizational skills and experience using project management tools (e.g., Monday.com, Jira).
* Preferred experience in customer acquisition functions and businesses.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Travel may be required.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Performance bonus

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of Data Analytics
description:
Responsible for contributing to operations and maintenance of an enterprise Army system. Will oversee configurations for applications, software, hardware assets, documentation, and identifies, organizes, and controls software configuration changes, while working closely with the Operations Team, Software Developers, Cybersecurity Engineers, and Government Product Owners to assure that system and software changes are tracked and documented.

**Location:** Home office within 250 miles of National Capital Region

**Responsibilities**

This position requires a candidate with management, leadership, and administrative skills and experience to manage and lead a variety of project team activities geared at helping DoD organizations with resources planning and the provision of data & analytics solutions to decision systems.

* Product Ownership: Act as the primary point of contact for the product responsible for the oversight of the development, implementation and maintenance of technical analytic solutions; ensures processes are established and followed regarding configuration, code modifications, testing and implementation
* Vision and Strategy: Develop and communicate a clear product vision and strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and customer needs across product teams to establish common standards, practices, and processes for quality and efficiency
* Prioritization: Prioritize features and user stories based on business value, customer feedback, and technical feasibility, ensuring the team works on high-priority items and mitigates roadblocks to achieving sprint/release goals by leading the product-release plans and set expectations for delivery of new functionalities.
* Requirements Gathering: Elicit and document product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to provide a clear understanding for development teams. Facilitate estimation of work and capacity planning at various stages of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
* Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with stakeholders, including business leaders, customers, and development teams, in client facing activities such as strategy discussion and project management to ensure alignment with the product vision. Work with inter-functional teams to streamline processes and drive process excellence.
* Participate in client facing activities such as sales presentations, strategy discussions, creating statements of work and high-level project management
* Agile Framework: Implement and champion the principles of the Agile process methodologies, monitor sprint progress and performance, manage sprint KPIs, including related dashboards and reporting
* Release Planning: Participate in release planning, including prioritization of features, sprint planning, and coordination of cross-team dependencies. Serve at Release Manager for all assigned products. This includes coordinating with teams and stakeholders to establish release schedules, ensuring completion of each step in the product release cycle, manage release communication for all internal stakeholders, and develop and ensure completion of release checklists per assigned product.
* Metrics and Analysis: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of the product.
* Product Delivery: Work closely with development teams to ensure the delivery of high-quality products on time, and create and maintain reports while meeting deadlines.

**Qualifications**

* B.A./B.S. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Science, Analytics, or Statistical analysis or equivalent experience; MBA preferred.
* 10 years’ experience in leading initiatives focused on analytics implementation, customization and automation of data collection processes
* 10 years’ experience in leading project and product teams to achieve client business goals, ideally in a consultative environment
* Strong visual and verbal communication skills
* Experience working in an Agile development environment
* Active U.S. Secret security clearance (U.S. Citizenship required).
* Knowledge of Department of Defense (DoD) applications and support.
* Demonstrated ability to perform diverse duties while operating under strict time constraints.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $160,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you able to travel to the National Capital Region within 24 hours notice?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of IT Programming (100% Remote)
description:
**Director of Programming**

**Job Type:** Full Time

**Hours:** 9:00 AM-6:00 PM EST (After hours as needed)

**Salary:** 125-140K annually

**Benefits:** Available after 90 days for full-time employees

**About AnswerNet** 

AnswerNet is the brand name for the AnswerNet family of companies including AnswerNet, Inc., New AnswerNet Inc., Cerida Investment Corp., ECC (Energy Choice California), Synergy Solutions, TPV.com, and Ansercomm, to name a few. Together with our affiliates, AnswerNet operates more than 31 contact centers within the continental United States and Canada. We provide a vast range of services to optimize telephone answering services, appointment setting and confirmation, customer support, third-party verification, sales, lead qualification, market research, and a host of other contact management solutions. In all, AnswerNet has more than 10,000 satisfied clients and we process over 125 million interactions per year.

**Job Summary:**

Oversees the Programming and Business Intelligence functions in the Technical Services Department. The director takes the lead on all Programming systems and ensures the department aligns with the company's priorities. We are seeking a highly skilled individual with a profound understanding of telecom operations, particularly in the realm of call center technology. This role is integral to our organization, as it involves the orchestration of various facets of our call center.

**Reports to:**

Vice President of Technical Services

**Responsibilities:**

* Business Intelligence Strategy:
* Develop and implement a comprehensive business intelligence strategy that aligns with AnswerNet's overall business goals and objectives.
* Collaborate with senior management to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and data-driven insights to drive strategic decision-making across the organization.
* Oversee the design and maintenance of data warehouses and databases to ensure the availability of accurate and timely business data.
* Data Analytics and Reporting:
* Lead a team of data analysts to conduct in-depth data analysis, data mining, and statistical modeling to provide actionable insights and recommendations to various stakeholders.
* Develop interactive and user-friendly dashboards and reports to enable real-time monitoring of key performance metrics and business trends.
* Present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences, including executives and department heads.
* Software Development and Programming:
* Manage and mentor a team of programmers responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining software applications and tools that support the company's business operations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define software requirements, develop project timelines, and ensure successful implementation of software solutions.
* Oversee the integration of software applications with existing systems to enhance efficiency and data integrity.
* Grasp and Internalize Long-term Goals and Strategic Vision:

· Familiarize yourself with the organization's long-term goals, mission statement, and strategic vision.

· Internalize the overarching vision to align your actions and decisions accordingly

* Collaborate with the President and CEO:

· Engage in regular discussions with the President and CEO to gain insights into their vision for the organization.

· Seek clarification on any aspects of the vision that require further understanding.

· Actively participate in strategic planning sessions to ensure alignment with the overall mission and objectives.

* Process Improvement:
* Identify opportunities for process optimization and automation within the organization, leveraging programming and technology solutions.
* Work closely with department heads to understand their specific needs and provide innovative solutions to improve workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
* Data Security and Compliance:
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and industry best practices in data security.
* Implement robust data protection measures and establish protocols for data access and sharing within the organization.
* Team Management:
* Recruit, train, and develop a high-performing team of programmers and data analysts.
* Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment that promotes creativity, growth, and continuous learning.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide feedback to team members to enhance their professional development.

7. Telecom Solutioning Manager:

· Spearhead the end-to-end solutioning process within our telecommunication environment, from initial ideation to final implementation, ensuring that each state is meticulously executed to deliver optimal outcomes.

· Lead and inspire a team in crafting innovative solutions to address telecom challenges.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
* Strong experience in a leadership position for telephone answering service or associated technologies as a service provider.
* Expert experience with including Twilio and other upstream service providers.
* Proven experience (minimum 5 years) in leading business intelligence, data analytics, and software development teams in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Strong knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, SQL) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
* Expert level in SIP communication.
* Expertise in data modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning concepts.
* Demonstrated ability to translate complex data insights into actionable business recommendations.
* Solid understanding of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a remote work environment.

Join AnswerNet as the Director of Programming and Business Intelligence and play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making and technological advancements within our organization. Together, let's enhance customer experiences and achieve new heights of success in the customer service solutions industry.

**WAH Requirements:**

· PC/Laptop with at least Windows 10 (Apple/Mac products, Chromebooks, and tablets are not compatible)

· Hard-wired high-speed internet connection (ethernet cable)

· USB-connected Headset

· Webcam

· Quiet dedicated place to work free from distractions including pets and children.

**Location:**

Commutable to Willow Grove, PA, or can be 100% remote. Must be US based.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 7 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Python, Java, SQL, Tableau, Power BI: 5 years (Required)
* Data Analytics and Reporting: 5 years (Required)
* Data Security and Compliance: 5 years (Required)
* Leadership: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Head of Engineering - Ladder Health
description:
**About The Company**


Ladder Health is dedicated to revolutionizing early childhood intervention by creating accessible solutions to serve all children. Our mission is to ensure that every child has the opportunity to thrive and reach their full potential. Join us in shaping the future of healthcare for children and families around the world.


**About the Role**


As the inaugural Head of Engineering at Ladder Health, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our technological direction and driving our product vision forward. Working closely with the CEO, you will lead the development of our SaaS platform, define strategic objectives, and build a high-performing engineering team. We're seeking a dynamic individual with a passion for innovation and a track record of delivering impactful solutions with technology.


**Areas of Responsibility**


* Collaborate closely with the CEO to architect our SaaS platform and set strategic goals for technology development.
* Lead our compliance efforts to ensure our platform meets industry standards and regulatory requirements, including HIPAA, HITRUST, and SOC Type 2.
* Build and nurture a talented team of software and data engineers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
* Prioritize the unique needs of early childhood intervention programs and caregivers, driving iterative development and delivering high-impact solutions tailored to their requirements.
* Maintain a high standard of engineering excellence by establishing best practices, conducting code reviews, and ensuring robust documentation specific to early childhood intervention.


**Qualifications**


*Required:*


* 6+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on SaaS or health tech products.
* Proven track record of leading engineering teams and delivering successful software projects.
* Strong technical background with expertise in JavaScript, Node.js, Next.js, and React.
* Experience with modern cloud architectures, such as Google Cloud Computing (GCP) or Amazon Web Services (AWS).
* Demonstrated ability to recruit, retain, and develop top engineering talent.
* Knowledge of compliance frameworks and experience implementing security best practices.


*Nice-to-Have:*


* Experience with healthcare solutions specific to early childhood intervention.
* Familiarity with HIPAA and SOC-2 compliance requirements.
* Understanding of healthcare data privacy principles and experience implementing authentication and access control mechanisms.
* Proficiency in building quality assurance processes.
* Passion for long-term product planning and driving innovation within the organization to improve outcomes for children and families.


**Why you should work for us:**


At Ladder Health, we're on a mission to make a lasting impact on the health and well-being of children nationwide. Joining our team means being part of a dynamic and collaborative environment where your ideas and contributions are valued. If you're passionate about using technology to improve outcomes for children and families and are looking for an opportunity to make a real difference, we'd love to hear from you. Apply now and help us build a brighter future for the next generation.

title: Associate Director of Experience Design
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us.

  

The Verizon Value Organization is Verizon’s portfolio of prepaid brands: Verizon Prepaid, Visible, Total By Verizon, Straight Talk, Tracfone and more – serving millions of customers through multiple channels. Our mission in the Value Organization is to build a better-connected world through accessible, quality wireless for all.


This role is within the Value Digital / Customer Experience team where we create and improve digitally-led experiences for our customers, striving for reliable, simple, exceptional world-class journeys.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


We are seeking an Associate Director of Experience Design to join our Managing and Pay team where we are iteratively designing and developing best-in-class experiences for our customers. Join us to help set new standards in our category and make our customer's payment and account interactions a truly reliable, simple and exceptional experience.


As an Associate Director of Experience Design, you will lead cross-disciplinary teams on complex design programs to deliver great experiences related to their digital accounts, manage payments, compliance and security. The Associate Director of Experience Design creates strategies for redefining our journey while mentoring their team to achieve and exceed our customer's expectations.

* Managing a team of designers on multiple, wide-ranging, and complex design programs or products.
* Planning and facilitating team activities to identify appropriate design problems, solutions, and opportunities within project brief and partner context.
* Planning and facilitating iteration and critique to improve solution quality and support user, business, and technical requirements.
* Recommending and facilitating design activities/methods to guide teams and partners through ambiguous project periods.
* Helping the team align on a vision that informs the design approach and project priorities.
* Identifying activities and communications necessary to deliver digital product strategy ideas to various internal and external partners.
* Facilitating and inspiring creative concepts.
* Coaching team on project dynamics, collaboration, and interpersonal communication.
* Planning, coordinating, and facilitating meetings with staff and partners to gather feedback, make decisions, and determine next steps.
* Leading coordination of broader business, technical, and customer success factors.
* Overseeing the maintenance of clearly organized working files and project directories.
* Guiding exploration, refinement, and documentation to be comprehensive.
* Upholding and maintaining attention to detail for all designers.
* Upholding standards for solution quality and documentation for all designers.
* Making decisions regarding the hiring, advancement, performance, promotion, or any other change of status of team members. Assessing employee performance, holding employees accountable, taking appropriate corrective actions, and training and provide ongoing direction and feedback to team members.


This role may be considered as part of the Department of Defense SkillBridge Program.

### **Where you’ll be working…**


In this hybrid role, you’ll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You'll need to have:

* Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience.
* Six or more years of relevant work experience.
* Experience in consumer-facing design management.
* Experience in digital design & user-centric design overall.
* Willingness to travel approximately up to 25%.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* A degree in design or related field of study.
* Demonstrated leadership of design teams in framing and solving challenging problems on multiple design programs or shipped products with a large user base.
* Proven record of implementation of innovative efforts to improve experience from concept to execution.
* A portfolio of UX design work.
* Ability to digest and translate complex technical requirements into intuitive experiences.
* Portfolio examples of enterprise applications.
* Experience with design tools like Figma, Adobe XD, and Adobe Creative Cloud.
* Experience with agile methodology and tools.
* Experience with Smart Sheets and/or Google Suite.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.


Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island or Washington work location, the compensation range for this position is between $136,000.00 and $253,000.00 annually based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.

title: Director, Program Management - Product PMO
description:
**Director, Program Management (Product PMO)**  


  

**About Us**  

  

We are BetMGM. We are revolutionizing sports betting and online gaming in the United States. We are a partnership between two powerhouse organizations—MGM Resorts International and Entain Group. You know our name through our exciting portfolio of brands including BetMGM Sportsbook, Borgata online, Party Casino and Party Poker. We aim to bring our ideas into action and find ways to deliver the best quality in gaming platforms.  

  

We understand that each card in the deck plays a unique role in any given hand, just as our employees each play a unique role in accomplishing our goals as a company. We strive to create a culture of empathy where our employees feel valued, heard, and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We want to build a product and a workplace that reflect the communities we serve so we approach our work fearlessly, take responsibility when we get it wrong, and ante-up again. We play to win, and we are all-in together.  

  

We were recognized as one of Glassdoor’s “Best Places to Work”.
**About the Role**
As a key member of the Program Management team at BetMGM the Director, Program Management (Product PMO) will be responsible for the BetMGM product portfolio and roadmap planning, ongoing feature activation and continued prioritization of the portfolio in alignment with the company strategy. The Director, Program Management will act as the liaison between all BetMGM Product Areas, the Entain PMO and Product and the BetMGM PMO team to ensure successful and timely execution of the product roadmap. The Director will also be the key champion for driving operational excellence via standardization and documentation and continuous improvement of PDLC and SDLC.  

The ideal candidate will have a passion for driving and enabling change with a strong foundation of digital product management and program management experience. This key role will work with senior team members across product, product design, user research, engineering, compliance, and operations to manage the regular product roadmap planning process, facilitate the prioritization process, and collaborate with the PMO Process team to continuously advance the planning and delivery process.
The Director, Program Management should be a dynamic leader and highly impactful communicator, with an excellent ability to present to and gather feedback from senior stakeholders. They should contribute meaningfully to creating a culture of excellence and driving the practice of program management and innovation, helping BetMGM create the future of sports and entertainment.
  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage and gain alignment on roadmap planning processes and delivery across all product verticals and Entain.
* Facilitate the regular roadmap planning and prioritization process and ensure all submissions adhere to the highest quality standards.
* Drive adaption and continuous improvement of PDLC and SDLC.
* Define the strategic goals for the Product PMO team based on the needs of the business and provide direct line management to departments program and projects managers by setting performance objectives and providing guidance and coaching to ensure set objectives are met.
* Build strong relationships with all BetMGM Product leads and partner with them to understand inefficiencies in the planning process, eliminate any roadblocks and drive improvement of any roadmap related processes.
* Develop and maintain a regular project and portfolio status reporting cadence and process for BetMGM in alignment with Entain.
* Monitoring and actively managing project deviations to resolve issues and bring at risk projects back on track.
* Create and deliver senior stakeholder presentations, summarizing the BetMGM Product roadmap including strategic initiatives and key focus areas.
* Oversee and drive a robust change control process to enable risk mitigation and enable transparent communication when significant impact is expected.


**Essential Functions**
* Must be able to stand or sit and operate computers and other technological devices for extended periods of time


**Qualifications**
* Experience in Product Management and/or managing Product portfolios required.
* Substantial experience of working with PDLC, SDLS and both Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies and associated tools and techniques.
* Proven authority and responsibility for effectively and efficiently managing complex change portfolios.
* Proven strong performance in prior project management and/or delivery roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
* Proven people leadership experience, especially in building, leading and motivating teams.
* Willingness to act as mentor and coach to build on colleague’s strengths and improve on weaknesses, acting as one who listens and gives honest feedback.
* Ability to successfully work across cultures and locations, driving team cohesion and effectiveness.
* Experience developing a function or department in a fast-paced environment preferred.
* Ability to inspire via superior communication & interpersonal skills are required, experience communicating and interacting with executive teams required.
* Excellent communicator who is able to get one’s message understood clearly by adopting a range of styles and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information.
* Experience using tools such as Jira, Smartsheet, Asana, Trello, etc. to optimize team efficiency.
* Willingness for occasional travel to colleagues that are located across multiple offices.


**About Our Culture**  

  

Building BetMGM from the ground up takes effort, energy, and teamwork, but that’s what will make leading this industry all the more satisfying. We stay focused on our main goal with the help of these four company pillars:
* Believe in Your Game – Take your shot! There’s a freedom to explore ideas usually only start-ups are lucky enough to experience.
* Backed by the Best - With our expertise—merged with that of our world-class investors—we have the opportunity to take this business, and ourselves, farther than anyone has ever imagined.
* Do What’s Right - We operate with clarity and simplicity, always doing the right thing by our customers and each other, standing shoulder to shoulder every day.
* Hustle Hard - Our combined commitment and ambition is what drives us to create some of the most innovative products in the industry.

**What We Offer**
  

As a valued employee, we’re committed to giving you the resources and support you need. We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Paid Time Off, Holidays, Employee Resource Groups and more!  

  

**Gaming Compliance**  

  

Candidate must comply with and support the company’s responsible gambling policies, procedures and initiatives.  

  

This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of duties a person in this position may be asked to perform from time to time.  

  

***BetMGM LLC is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment or career development. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to learn more about you.***  

  

*If you need assistance or accommodation with your application due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitment@betmgm.com.*  

#LI-MH1

title: VP of Data and Analytics
description:
### **About Life360**



Life360's mission is to keep people close to the ones they love. We help families protect the people, pets, and things they care about with our industry-leading mobile app and category-defining Tile tracking devices. Life360 has more than 58 million monthly active users (MAU) in more than 150 countries. We are the 16th most-used iOS app in the US, running on almost 15% of iPhones. Life360 was founded in 2008, went public on the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX: 360) in 2019, acquired Tile and Jiobit device makers in 2022, and has plans to pursue a dual listing on a US exchange (i.e. NASDAQ or NYSE) in the near future. We continue to grow rapidly, with strong double digit growth delivering expected revenues of over $300 million in 2023. Our ASX listing gives employees the liquidity of a public company with the upside of a private growth stage business.



Bringing together our highly successful mobile app with innovative devices, we have the opportunity to do unprecedented good for families across free and paid plans. Key features include location sharing, lost item reimbursement, driver monitoring, 24/7 roadside assistance, and crash detection with emergency response. By continuing to innovate and deliver for our customers, we aim to become a household name and establish ourselves as the must-have mobile-based membership for families of all stages.



Our growing team of 500+ employees operates as remote-first, with the majority of the leadership team centered around the San Francisco Bay Area and people located across the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia.A remote work environment will be the primary experience for all employees.


### **Opportunity for Impact**



Life360 represents a unique opportunity for impact because our massive highly engaged customer base (58M+ MAU) provides an amazing source of insights, and your leadership will ensure that we're continuously learning and improving how we serve our customers and grow our business. You will grow and develop analytics talent and tooling across domains, including product analytics, marketing analytics, and core business metrics, while increasing our acumen in experimentation and scaling our data science capabilities. Your team will go beyond reporting on the data–they are uniquely qualified and empowered to make sense of billions of data points about how families move and interact to identify new ways to promote connection between family members, improve safety (on the road and off), and to find compelling ways to help the world understand the value of location sharing and the services we provide. You will partner with product, marketing, engineering, and finance leadership to build a data strategy and use that data and the insights we derive from it to help inform our product, marketing, and overall business strategy.


### **What You'll Do**


* **Leadership:** Nurture our growing analytics function, helping the team deepen their understanding of and impact on the business, and fostering a culture of empowerment, data democratization, accountability, innovation, and excellence. You will be instrumental in cultivating a data-centric culture, empowering decision-making across all levels with actionable, data intelligence
* **Data Strategy:** Develop and execute a comprehensive data strategy, in partnership with engineering, and aligned with business objectives, ensuring the effective capture, storage, analysis, and utilization of data assets.
* **Insights and Storytelling:** Utilize the latest analytics techniques to extract actionable insights from large and complex datasets, coupled with automation and self-service capabilities, to drive informed decision-making across all levels of the organization. Develop ways of communicating the meaning behind the data so that employees, investors, and the general public can leverage these insights.
* **Product and Marketing Experimentation:** Collaborate closely with product and marketing teams to improve our experimentation methodology and velocity; identify opportunities for optimization and enhancement based on data-driven insights into user behavior, preferences, and trends.
* **Performance Measurement:** Help to identify, measure, and automate reporting for key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish robust frameworks for measuring and monitoring the performance of products, features, and initiatives.
* **Forecasting and Modeling:** Improve predictive models and forecasting methodologies to anticipate trends, user behavior patterns, and business performance, enabling proactive decision-making.
* **Data Platform Modernization**: Spearhead the modernization of our data platform, a strategic initiative aimed at unlocking advanced insights capabilities and the rich value of our data set. Bringing a visionary approach to integrating cutting-edge technologies and methodologies that enable real-time data analytics, ensuring our organization can respond with agility to market dynamics and customer needs. You will define the roadmap for cross-functional teams to extend the existing data infrastructure, enable solutions such as predictive modeling, AI-driven insights, and real-time high-scale user facing analytics. This role not only requires experience partnering with technical leadership but also a strategic mindset to align data capabilities with business objectives, driving innovation and competitive advantage in our industry.

### **What We're Looking For**


* 12+ years of deep expertise in data science, experimentation, and growth analytics for a mobile, subscription, or consumer tech company.
* 5+ years in a senior leadership role overseeing analytics and data science functions, including managing managers, preferably in the mobile consumer tech space.
* Extensive experience leading experimentation at scale and helping both analytics teams, and the business and product teams they support, improve experimentation practices.
* Deep experience in statistical analysis, data mining, machine learning, and predictive modeling, with large data sets and distributed computing in a cloud based environment.
* Strong business acumen and demonstrated ability to translate data insights into actionable business recommendations and strategic initiatives, using visualization and storytelling to enroll others to follow through on these recommendations.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with a track record of building and developing high-performing teams, and influencing and collaborating with cross-functional leaders in engineering, product, marketing, and finance.
* Demonstrated experience translating strategic business and product questions into a successful data and analytics roadmap.
* Willingness and ability to roll up your sleeves get hands on when needed.
* Strong command of analytics and visualization tools, such as Tableau and Amplitude.
* Experience with stream processing solutions, such as Apache Flink, Pinot, Spark and cloud-based Business Intelligence, Data Science and Analytics solutions, such as Tableau, Quicksight, Kinesis, DataBricks, Snowflake is required.
* BS/MS in Statistics, Math, Computer Science, Economics, Physics, or related fields preferred.

### **Our Benefits**


* Competitive pay and benefits
* Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance plans (100% paid for employees)
* 401(k) plan with company matching program
* Mental Wellness Program & Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for mental well being
* Flexible PTO, 13 company wide days off throughout the year & paid Holiday Shutdown
* Learning & Development programs
* Equipment, tools, and reimbursement support for a productive remote environment
* Free Life360 Platinum Membership for your preferred circle
* Free Tile Products

### **Life360 Values**



Our company's mission driven culture is guided by our shared values to create a trusted work environment where you can bring your authentic self to work and make a positive difference


* Be a Good Person - We have a team of high integrity people you can trust.
* Be Direct With Respect - We communicate directly, even when it's hard.
* Members Before Metrics - We focus on building an exceptional experience for families.
* High Intensity High Impact - We do whatever it takes to get the job done.

### **Our Commitment to Diversity**



We believe that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds create a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better results. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. It fuels our innovation and connects us closer to our customers and the communities we serve. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic best selves to work.


*We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Life360. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any legally protected status.*


*We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences create a foundation for the best ideas. Come join us in building something meaningful.**Even if you don't meet 100% of the below qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying!*

  

**#LI-Remote**
