title: Director of Architecture
description:
**Director of Architecture**


**About Freestar**
------------------



Freestar engineers cutting-edge monetization solutions for websites. By combining industry-leading technology, data, and massive scale, we enable busy site owners to seamlessly maximize revenue while freeing themselves of the hassles of ad operations. Publishers then have more time to do what they do best: create content.



Freestar is seeking an experienced, hands-on technical leader to drive efficient, scalable solutions across our engineering organization. The Director of Architecture will support and oversee several areas including infrastructure and architecture. This position will have direct influence over data, cloud, and application architecture. This role is well suited for candidates with deep hands-on experience and a bias towards lean, fast paced innovation. This position is full time, fully remote, and reports into the SVP, Engineering.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Establish a technical vision for best practices across infrastructure, platform, and architecture (IPA)
* Promote self-service within engineering teams by providing consultation and tools to facilitate product team goals
* Advocate for IPA initiatives and serve as a thought leader both within and outside of the organization
* Champion Agile methodologies and modern practices across relevant areas such as: CI/CD, TDD, IaC, observability, data management & privacy, DR (HA), SecOps, and DDD
* Maintain an IPA roadmap, setting and achieving goals to improve our ability to innovate
* Provide technical guidance and coaching to teams regarding best practices and in support of technical design decisions
* Promote secure practices in every technical design decision and engineering process
* Develop and maintain a strategy for data architecture across the enterprise, in consultation with business and technical stakeholders throughout the organization
* Ensure GCP cloud infrastructure is managed in a cost-efficient manner, prioritizing service reliability and efficiency
* Assess and manage technical risks with focus on maintainability, reliability, and security
* Contribute to the technical culture of the organization by promoting and participating in the tech blog, tech talks, and by mentoring engineers
* Model innovation and experimentation, emphasizing a lean, iterative approach to solution design

**Qualifications**
------------------


* 4+ years experience in a technical leadership position working closely with remote teams
* Proven ability to drive technical initiatives forward using influence, persuasion, as well as hands-on solution development
* Ability to communicate and set expectations both within the team and with stakeholders across the business
* Curiosity to learn new technologies and eagerness to face novel challenges on a regular basis
* Familiarity with Freestar technologies or equivalents (GCP & related services as well as architectural patterns, Java, Javascript, Python, k8s)
* A degree in computer science or related field is preferred


**What you can expect in return:**


* Full-Time, Salaried Position
* Fully remote company, with collaborative asynchronous teamwork.
* The opportunity to be part of something BIG
  


Freestar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

  


**This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship**

title: Corporate Director of IT (Remote/Hawaii Based)
description:
Sightline Hospitality is seeking an Oahu based remote **Corporate Director of IT (with some travel to the mainland required).**
As Corporate Director of IT you will be responsible for the day-to-day support of all IT systems, business systems, office systems, computer networks, and telephony systems throughout the Sightline Portfolio. Additionally, you will be responsible for Information Technology issues, products, and services at the property, as well as provide user training and support of all property/site systems, network enhancements, hardware, and software support. You will also maintain an inventory of all hardware products and software licenses and reviews maintenance agreements.
**About Sightline Hospitality**
Experience-driven and full of heart, we are explorers and adventure enthusiasts. Sightline Hospitality is a growing organization looking for fresh, creative, and entrepreneurial minds to join our team —we’ve led the development of renovations and new hotel projects, developed award-winning restaurants, and welcomed the community into our spaces—for decades. We’ve welcomed guests from across the world to our visionary destinations throughout the continental US and Hawaii.
**Your Responsibilities**
* Responsible for overseeing and handling network configuration, Servers, Workstations, Networking equipment, PABX, email accounts, and also support for the underlying server/desktop infrastructure.
* Work Strategically with the Operations, Finance, Revenue Management and Sales & Marketing Teams on the technology stack for each new property that will be onboarded to the portfolio.
* Conduct Root Cause Analysis on problems.
* Oversee outsourced IT team.
* Responsible for smooth functioning and co-ordination of vendors for Guest Internet, Property Management Systems – PMS, Point of Sale – POS, IPTV, Telephony systems and other software vendors.
* Troubleshoot hardware and software problems.
* Manage leadership in the establishment of project scope, technical strategy, cost, budget, and staff support requirements with new IT initiatives.
* Prepare Policy & Procedures for the IT Department and for the user department.
* Managing Disaster Recovery Process and ensuring regular daily backup is taken.
* Anti-virus setup and day to day support.
* Plan, assign and take reports from the IT team.
* Identify and implement solutions to user challenges and concerns associated with the use of personal computer equipment.
* Ensure that policies and procedure relating to PCI compliance are updated.
* Maintains a system error / progress logbook and deals with reported problems.
* Responsible to ensure that IT Audit points are implemented as per relevant Standard operating Procedures.
* Monitor and maintain proper inventory of hardware and software license.
* Aware of IT Security Policies and ensure implementation through regular staff training.
* Keep updated with latest hotel technology and security risks on a regular basis.
* Able to perform other IT or Systems related tasks assigned by the management.


**Essential Experience/Aptitudes:**
* **Education:**
* Degree or Diploma in Information Technology field. Along with In depth knowledge of Microsoft Operating systems, Microsoft or Cisco certification.
* Applicable Microsoft certifications: MCSA, MCTS or MCITP for Windows Server, MCDST for workstations.
* Experience with these Hospitality related applications and or systems (PMS, POS, Key Card, PBX, Voice Mail).
* **Experience:**
* A minimum of five (5) years of experience in Hospitality, Operations, and IT support roles. Along with minimum of two (2) years of Supervisory / managerial experience.
* Must know the Network fundamentals, general network setup and device configuration.
* Good knowledge of server hardware, Disk storage technology, I/O devices.
* Skilled in usage of system level profiling tools and network monitoring systems to aid in application performance profiling (iostat, Nagios).
* Knowledge of network infrastructure, including CAT5/6 cabling, wireless networks, network switches, WAN/LAN, domain controller, Active Directory, firewall and VPN applications.
* Extensive knowledge on Active Directory, Management and Implementations.
* Prepare & Implement Preventative Maintenance Schedule for all IT hardware & Software.
* Background in highly available systems and image capture/management systems.


**Desired Skills/Experience:*** Must be a self-starter, alert, energetic, responsible, and flexible.
* Excellent communication and listening skills.
* Ability to work under pressure.
* Must be mature, pleasant, courteous, cooperative and an enthusiastic team player who displays good human relations skills.
* Committed to delivering high levels of customer service.
* Ability to respond courteously and efficiently to queries and problems from guests and system users.
* Excellent organizational and prioritization skills, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills.
* Must be flexible in working hours, including weekends, evenings, and holidays.


**Essential Physical Abilities:**
* Must be able to work at a computer for extended periods of time.
* Reading and writing abilities are utilized often when completing paperwork and management reports, interpreting results, giving, and receiving instructions, and training.
* Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances are used frequently.
* Must be flexible to work long and sometimes irregular hours.
* Must be able to work well under pressure.
* Occasionally required to handle and move objects weighing up to 40 lbs. over short distances.

**Benefits:**
* Bonus Plan
* 401(K) plan with match
* Medical Vision, dental, and life insurance options
* Personal Time Off Benefits and Holidays
* Employee discount for stays at hotels within Sightline Hospitality expanding portfolio.

Sightline Hospitality is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes applicants and employees of all backgrounds. M/F/D/V/SO

title: Director of Service Desk
description:
Pax8 is the leading cloud-based technology marketplace, simplifying the cloud journey for our partners by integrating technology, business intelligence and proactive service to deliver an unparalleled experience. Serving thousands of partners through the indirect sales channel, our mission is to be the world's favorite place to buy cloud products. We are a fast-growing, dynamic and high-energy startup organization, allowing you to make a meaningful impact on the business. Culture is important to us, and at Pax8, it's business, and it **IS** personal. We are passionate, creative and humorously offbeat. We work hard, keep it fun, and expect the best.

We Elev8 each other. We Advoc8 for our partners. We Innov8 continuously. We Celebr8 life.

No matter who you are, Pax8 is a place you can call home. We know there's no such thing as a *"perfect"* candidate, so we don't look for the right "*fit*" – instead, we look for the add. We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don't meet 100% of the bullet points. We believe in cultivating an environment with a diversity of perspectives, in hopes that we can all thrive in an inclusive environment.



We are only as great as our people. And we have great people all over the world. No matter where you live and work, you're a part of the Pax8 team. This means embracing hybrid- and remote-work whenever possible.

**Position Summary:**

The Director of Service Desk is focused on elevating our partners' experience by managing and developing the teams that support the Pax8 platform directly. Building teams and leaders of high performing, diverse individuals that put the partner experience first is a core competency of the director role. The Director of Service Desk looks to the future, focusing on the support strategic vision and Pax8 partner experience. They are responsible for all things related to their teams' service, efficiency, growth and experience, and understand current capacities while forecasting future growth and needs.


**Essential Responsibilities (includes, but is not limited to):**

* Service Management and Quality Control
	+ Cultivate and Preserve a productive culture around purpose, efficiency, and meeting utility
	+ Monitor and React to the Service Desk team's performance, taking appropriate measures to ensure world-class service
	+ Investigate and Respond to feedback around team workflows, service design, and process
	+ Create, Monitor, and Standardize metrics for team performance, service quality, and interactions across Pax8 teams
	+ Define department standards and implement tools & process to drive accountability to these standards
	+ Hire and mentor managers and team leads
	+ Collaborate with leadership to surface team and individual needs to improve efficiency
* Planning and Forecasting
	+ Monitor and React to resource and personnel needs
	+ Collaborate and Assist with employee selection and hiring
	+ Develop and Report models for team forecasting, employee churn, and growth to align with Pax8 strategic growth
* Team & Employee Development
	+ Track and Take Action on employee goals, interests, and strengths, and correlate these to advancement and learning opportunities
	+ Drive accountability and healthy team performance, taking necessary action to manage both individuals and teams
	+ Train and Mentor leadership talent; develop management skills and act as a mentor for leadership growth
	+ Schedule and Execute 1 on 1's with direct reports; develop goals, provide direction, track progress, and remove obstacles.
	+ Curate and Maintain a healthy employee and workplace experience
	+ Create promotional paths, team improvement plans, and learning & certification objectives, along with the tools to track eligibility & progress
	+ Develop and Deploy training to ensure teams are prepared with knowledge and a healthy support structure
	+ Oversee and React to employee onboarding needs and collaborate with training resources when necessary

**Ideal Skills, Experience, and Competencies:**

* 10 years experience in a customer facing support role, ideally supporting a SaaS application in the IT services application space
* 5 years of experience in a customer support leadership role
* Exceptional leadership and team management skills
* Strong customer service skills, with a passion for delivering exceptional service and support
* Excellent problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
* Solid understanding of customer support processes and best practices
* Proficient in using customer support software and tools
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with customers and team members at all levels of the organization
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze data and use it to drive decision making
* Proven track record in driving improvements in customer support operations and performance


**Required Education & Certifications:**

* B.S./B.A. degree in related field or equivalent work experience is preferred
* At least five (5) years of relevant experience in customer service leadership is preferred

#### **Compensation:**


* Qualified candidates can expect a salary beginning at $120,000/yr or more depending on experience


#LI-Remote #LI-JF1 #BI-Remote

* Note: Compensation is benchmarked on local Denver Metro area market rates. Qualified candidates in other locations can expect a salary package that may be adjusted based off applicable cost of wages in their respective location.


At Pax8 we believe that your Total Rewards should include a benefits package that shows how much we value our greatest assets. All **FTE** Pax8 people enjoy the following benefits:
* Non-Commissioned Bonus Plans or Variable Commission
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employer Paid Short & Long Term Disability, Life and AD&D Insurance
* Flexible, Open Vacation
* Paid Sick Time Off
* Extended Leave for Life events
* RTD Eco Pass (For local Colorado Employees)
* Career Development Programs
* Stock Option Eligibility
* Employee-led Resource Groups

 Pax8 is an EEOC Employer.

title: Director, Product Management
description:
**Our Mission**

As the world’s number 1 job site\\*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(\\*comScore Total Visits, September 2023)

**Responsibilities**

* Create and drive the vision for Indeed Flex’s Worker Retention including Browse experience, Matching & Offering, Status Program, and Machine Learning products.
* Manage and grow a team of product managers.
* Build a roadmap and define execution strategies with the team by utilizing data, user research, and business priorities. Work closely with stakeholders, including the Fulfillment & Worker Retention service group and Indeed Flex’s Senior Leadership Team.
* Define metrics to measure the success of the features your team builds. Possess a drive for velocity, be highly adaptable, and demonstrate an ability to take a big idea and distill it into a clear and consistent plan that’s backed by data.
* Build relationships and partnerships with people and teams across the company, align on strategy, vision, and execution.

**Skills/Competencies**

* Experience in a fast-paced/startup environment
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field
* 7+ years of Product Management experience or its equivalent
* 3+ years of 2-sided Marketplace experience building machine learning or ranking / matching products
* 2+ years managing a team and are deeply committed to coaching, mentoring, and supporting future leaders. You’re not afraid to be hands on and act as a player-coach when needed.
* Proven track record of cross-functional partnering to execute on strategy.
* Experience presenting to executive audiences.

**Salary Range Transparency**

* United States - Remote - $178,000 - 258,000 USD per year
* Austin Metro Area - $178,000 - 258,000 USD per year
* New York City Metro Area - $208,000 - 302,000
* Seattle Metro Area - $222,000 - 322,000
* San Francisco Metro Area - $242,000 - 350,000

**Salary Range Disclaimer**

The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position in the given work location. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range(s) listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), a Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.

**Benefits - Health, Work/Life Harmony, & Wellbeing**

We care about what you care about. We have a multitude of benefits to support Indeedians, as well as their pets, kids, and partners. Select your country and learn more about our employee benefits, program, & perks at https://benefits.indeed.jobs!

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Indeed is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact Talent Attraction Accommodations at 1-855-567-7767, or by email at accommodations@indeed.com. If you are requesting accommodation for an interview, please reach out at least one week in advance of your interview.

**Fair Chance Hiring**

We value diverse experiences, including those who have had prior contact with the criminal legal system. We are committed to providing individuals with criminal records, including formerly incarcerated individuals, a fair chance at employment.

**Indeed’s Employee Recruiting Privacy Policy**

Like other employers Indeed uses our own technologies to help us find and attract top talent from around the world. In addition to our site’s user and privacy policy found at https://www.indeed.com/legal, we also want to make you aware of our recruitment specific privacy policy found at https://www.indeed.com/legal/indeed-jobs.

Compensation package:

Schedule:

Work Location: Remote

title: Executive Director Practice Technology
description:
Overview:

Today, SCA Health has grown to 11,000 teammates who care for 1 million patients each year and support physician specialists holistically in many aspects of patient care. Together, our teammates create value in specialty care by aligning physicians, health plans and health systems around a common goal: delivering on the quadruple aim of high-quality outcomes and a better experience for patients and providers, all at a lower total cost of care.  

As part of Optum, we participate in an integrated care delivery system that enables us to support our partners as they navigate a complex healthcare environment, Only SCA Health has a dynamic group of physician-driven, specialty care businesses that allows us to customize solutions, no matter the need or challenge:* We connect patients to physicians in new and differentiated ways as part of Optum and with our new Specialty Management Solutions business.
* We have pioneered a physician-led, multi-site model of practice solutions that restores physician agency by aligning incentives to support growth and transition to value-based care.
* We lead the industry in value-based payment solutions through our Global 1 bundled payment convener, that provides easy predictable billing to patients.
* We help physicians address everything beyond surgical procedures, including anesthesia and ancillary service lines.

  

The new SCA Health represents who we are today and where we are going—and the growing career opportunities for YOU.
Accountabilities / Responsibilities:

OSP partners with specialty physician groups, through MSOs to support their migration into value-based healthcare as part of the OptumCare team. OSP partners to provide practice management and clinical performance support, referral and payer alignment, data analytics, and strategic capital while the practices themselves provide physician leadership, market knowledge and clinical excellence to create market-leading specialty care delivery systems. OSP is responsible for delivering high-value specialty care networks that overlay and integrate with SCA Health, OptumCare Care Delivery Organizations (CDOs), and other OptumCare partners.***Role Description:***  

Reporting to the VP of Practice Services, this role is intended to be a technology business operations leader. They will be responsible for building the information technology offering for the national MSO and building technology enabled solutions for local and regional OSP platforms. They will be a key leader within the national MSO; having a huge and lasting impact on setting the direction and building IT solutions for specialty practices.  

A successful candidate will have to be adept at designing and implementing technology-enabled business solutions for the business; working as a leader and luminary. The candidate should have a deep understanding of the physician practice landscape and the unique issues practices face. Candidate must be able to collaborate with lines of business (finance, operations, managed care, revenue cycle, clinical), to identify pain points and offer technology solutions for business problems. Then take these learnings to work with the broader SCAH Information Technology team to help identify solutions and paths (build, buy, source internally). This person will be the key liaison between SCAH IT team and the national MSO acting as a true business partner to IT representing the practice needs and unique challenges. This role has an opportunity to have significant exposure to internal stakeholders, multiple functional lanes, market operating group leadership, Optum, and high-profile external regional platforms. ***Responsibility Description:***  

This role will have both short term (immediate) responsibilities as well as longer term goals (1-2 years) as a successful candidate builds the functional area.  

In addition to responsibilities as assigned, immediate responsibilities a successful candidate will engage with, include:* ***Enterprise Data Warehouse*** – This “EDW” is a foundational initiative to enable the growth and successful delivery of solutions by the national MSO. Candidate will work with the data architecture and other IT team members functioning as a subject matter expert (“SME”) to help guide the team in understanding the structure of EMR/PMS and other systems (Phone, Patient Engagement systems) and guide them in successfully transforming the data into the EDW.
* ***Integration Support*** – Candidate will work with local platform/partnerships to guide and advisement on: 1) transitioning to SCA Health solutions and/or 2) EMR/PMS selection and implementation.
* ***Workflow Optimization –*** candidate will work with departments/lanes to help identify if and how technology can be utilized workflow issues across the functional areas (Revenue cycle, practice workflow, etc)

 ***Building the multi-specialty technology offering –*** the 1-2 year vision of this role is to build the services and offering. A successful candidate will focus on:* ***Visioning and ideation*** – Resulting in a defined value proposition offering a unique and cutting-edge value proposition; effectively communicating this differentiated service offering to physician stakeholders
* Building the solution through collaborating with internal and external stakeholders. This position will be responsible for working with existing SCAH IT resources to pull together a comprehensive offering from internal, existing capabilities and either build or externally sourced capabilities. Some examples include:
	+ ***Technology Application Strategy*** – Identify 2-3 standard solutions that can be deployed and readily supported. These would include a PMS/EMR solution, mobile charge capture, patient engagement, etc
	+ ***Desktop Support*** – If the decision is made to keep this locally owned, work with existing help desk solution owners to develop an offering that is tailored to the practice space and architecture. If we insource this support, work with SCAH IT to inform decision on offering.
	+ ***EMR Optimization and Training*** – Work with existing training team to develop a training and optimization cosilting program in support of our Architecture and practice space
* ***Listening to the voice of the customer*** – Our most important stakeholders are our physician partners. Continuous improvement and implementation of (appropriate) feedback
* ***Supporting growth*** – Depending on the solution path (build or buy) and level of support determined to be appropriate; This role will potentially build out key support functions for clinical applications such as training, project management, and desktop support.

 ***Key Activities***:  

* Act as an advisor to other departments supporting OSP teammates to help them draw insights for existing analytical tools, as well as create requirements around new potential tools
* Work with and gain working relationships with Information Technology teammates
* Find ways to leverage existing enterprise data and information in company’s products and services
* Prioritize, plan, and track project progress for the department.
* Participate and lead management meetings in subject area
* Consult with and present to partnerships finding
* Utilize data analytics to uncover critical business insights and findings


Qualifications:  

* An undergraduate or graduate degree in business or technology related field
* A minimum of ten years of relevant healthcare experience
* Experience with large multisite medical groups is required
* Demonstrated experience with physician practice system selection, implementation, and on-going support
* Demonstrated understanding of key physician practice workflows (like Patient scheduling, Check-in/Check-out, Revenue cycle)
* Ability to collaborate with other departments and organizations (managed care, development, operations, MSO partnerships, physician partners etc.)
* Working knowledge of the latest technology solutions and trends in the specialty practice space
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to communicate
* Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with physicians
* Motivation to achieve individual and team goals, must be able to work independently and in a team environment.
* Ability to function as high-level executive and in the weeds in a start-up-like environment
* Travel requirements: As needed to support the company and partnerships (estimated <25%)


Min: USD $175,000.00/Yr. Max: USD $225,000.00/Yr.

title: Director of Product
description:
**Share Good**  
Share Good is a software platform that makes it easy for neighbors, nonprofits and businesses to come together and strengthen their local community through good. Our community platform empowers and increases social engagement in local communities, removes barriers to taking action by creating easy opportunities to engage and shines a spotlight on the nonprofits within a local community. Share Good communities are currently spread across seven regions including **SHARE Charlotte** (NC), **SHARE Omaha** (NE), **SHARE Cape Fear** (NC), **SHARE Lynchburg** (VA), **SHARE Detroit** (MI), **SHARE Middlesex** (NJ) and **SHARE Iowa** as we are continuing to grow our partner footprint across the nation.

The mission of Share Good and all member communities is to democratize philanthropy.

**Why?** Because we – our communities, our families and our greater country – are better when we help each other. **How?** We believe there is a spark when nonprofits voice their needs and the public rises to meet them. The public neighbor chooses how to support causes and alleviate crises based on their individual capacity, interest and passions. **What?** This is accomplished primarily through our uniting tool of the Share Good platform.

We believe giving back should be rewarding, so you’ll want to do it again, and we also believe that work should be rewarding and fun, so that you’ll have the greatest impact. We are excited to hear from talented people who want to work with other talented individuals in sharing good – and have fun along the way.

**Role Description**  
Share Good is hiring a Director of Product to develop our product end-to-end and lead our development team. As Director of Product, you will be directly responsible for delivering world-class software to our users in a timely manner, maturing our development systems, and growing and cultivating a team of skilled designers and developers. You will oversee and craft product features and beautiful user interfaces that meet the needs of our customers. This role will refine and improve upon Share Good’s design and development language and report on metrics to measure success and improve deliverables. We have already built a great foundation; powering thousands of donations, volunteer hours, cause engagement, and needed products to thousands of organizations; and your creative work will take this impact further. You will have the opportunity to deliver immense value to our Share Good communities, their nonprofit customers and neighbors. This role will report to the Chief Operating Officer.

**We want to hear from people who:**

* Are excited to lead and develop the product of a fast-growing nonprofit creating software that generates good for causes across the nation
* Are incredibly talented at turning ideas into beautifully developed, designed and functional software
* Are execution-focused and have a bias toward shipping
* Understand the importance of excellent and consistent design
* Are innovative and like to think a step ahead to strategically develop product value-adds and creative API solutions that are competitive
* Are highly organized and can plan and execute on a development roadmap
* Are natural leaders who can bring a playbook for scaling development and design systems
* Are excellent communicators and enjoy sharing their knowledge and reasoning with others

**Responsibilities**

* Lead, develop and recruit product talent
* Lead the development of new and the maintenance of existing features in Share Good’s core products: Donate, Volunteer, Attend Events, GiveShop®, Account and Data Dashboard product verticals through concept discovery, ideation, development and visual design
* Mature our development system and iteratively ensure improvements are shipped to our users
* Increase our speed of roadmap execution while upholding high standards and best practices for product development, testing and bug-free code
* Develop product requirements outlines to deliver to product developers, break down features into sprints that you run with product and engineering, and ensure the implementation of new features matches the development specs
* Play a key role in launching features and in providing feedback to developers, educating internal teams and developing launch plans in collaboration with the COO
* Gather feedback from testing and users to iterate on the development of existing features
* Collaborate with business development, marketing, success and support when product development needs arise
* Create product marketing assets for our website and prospective stakeholders

*Position description for informational purposes and is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities. Additional duties that are consistent with the responsibility level of this position may be assigned.* 

**Requirements**

* 8+ years experience developing and designing software products
* Strong hands-on development expertise in Drupal, PHP, Git including GitHub and cloud hosting solutions such as Platform.sh or Amazon Web Services
* Experience with IDEs including PhpStorm or VSCode
* Strong experience with UX and UI patterns and how to apply them in software design
* 3+ years of leadership experience with direct reports including interviewing, hiring and leading a team of designers and developers
* Experience with the setup and monitoring of product analytics software to make product decisions based on behavior *(using tools such as Posthog, Amplitude, FullStory, etc.)*
* Experience with visual and interaction design
* Experience building design systems that scale across desktop and mobile
* Experience working with engineers to implement designs that meet high standards
* Experience working for a product-led growth or nonprofit software company is beneficial
* Experience with Drupal Commerce, React and Storybook are a plus

*This is a remote position. The ideal candidate will be willing to travel when necessary for co-working sessions/team member retreats, client gatherings and presentations, and/or conferences.Salary range: $105,000 to $115,000. The salary is commensurate with experience and includes paid time off and paid holidays as well as health, ancillary and retirement benefits.* ***To apply please send your resume to: resumes@sharegoodusa.org by Thursday, February 15, 2024.***

**Benefits**

**Work Culture:** We strive for a people-first work culture where wellbeing and work-life balance are both individualized and normalized. Work hours are flexible depending on your role and the organization's needs.

**Remote Work:** Work from anywhere in the United States. As a decentralized national organization we trust our employees with virtual workspaces and prioritize adequate time for team cross-collaboration, time on task and customer service.

**Health Insurance:** We offer Medical, Dental and Vision insurance for employees.

**Benefits:** We offer long term and short term disability, life insurance and critical illness benefits.

**Retirement Plan:** We offer access to 401k retirement planning account and vesting for all employees, in addition to financial coaching and advising from our benefits provider.

**Vacation, Holiday & Wellness:** New, full-time employees accrue 20 days of paid vacation time per year within their first 2 years of employment and additional paid vacation time per year is granted with tenure of 2+ years *(2-5 years = +5 days; 5+ years = +10 days)*. Approximately 13 paid holidays per year. In addition to PTO, staff appreciation days are provided throughout the year, including time off between the Christmas and New Years holidays and 3 days *(1 flex day per month)* during the summer months. These days are provided for staff family time and wellness.

**Parental Leave:** We offer up to 12 weeks of parental leave, with a minimum of 2 weeks and maximum of 6 weeks paid leave based on tenure for both primary and secondary caregivers.

**Home Office Stipend:** Upgrade your home office with organization-sponsored expenses including high-quality laptops, monitors and modern technology.

**Professional Development:** We offer learning and development opportunities.

**Love What You Do:** We are a mission-driven nonprofit organization serving the charitable sector. We aim to be champions of the individuals who make up our sector, thought partners to nonprofit organizations and resilient changemakers within our ecosystem. Feel good about the work you're doing and the organization you work for.

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**  Share Good provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants according to their experience, talent and qualifications for the job without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, sex (including pregnancy, gender stereotyping and marital status), sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military/veteran status or any other category protected by federal, state or local law in every location in which the company operates. Share Good believes that diversity and an inclusive company culture are key drivers of creativity, innovation and performance. Furthermore, a diverse workforce and the maintenance of an atmosphere that welcomes versatile perspectives will enhance our ability to fulfill our vision of democratizing philanthropy.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $105,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 8 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* How many years experience do you have with hands-on Drupal and PHP software development? Hands-on software development execution is a technical, day-to-day requirement of the role.

Work Location: Remote

title: Director of IT, Enterprise Solutions
description:
Job Summary::

We are looking for an experienced **IT Director** to oversee the IT operations within Diné Development Corporation (DDC). This role will be responsible for overseeing employees, collaborating with other departments to understand technical requirements, and developing solutions that are aligned with DDCs objectives. The IT Director must have stellar technical aptitude, as well as superior project and people management skills. This highly visible position will maintain streamlined, secure, and updated technical operations within DDC.
Job Duties and Responsibilities: :
**Strategic Leadership:**

+ Develop and execute a comprehensive IT strategy aligning with business objectives.
+ Provide strategic direction for the design, development, and deployment of enterprise solutions.

**ServiceNow Expertise:**

+ Leverage expertise in ServiceNow to streamline and optimize IT service management processes.
+ Oversee the customization, configuration, and integration of ServiceNow to meet organizational requirements.

**API Integration:**

+ Lead API integration initiatives to ensure seamless connectivity between various systems.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement robust API solutions.

**System Integration and Migration:**

+ Demonstrate knowledge and experience in the integration and migration of systems for enhanced efficiency and performance.
+ Develop strategies for seamless transition and consolidation of IT systems.

**Vendor Management:**

+ Manage relationships with technology vendors, ensuring the effective procurement and utilization of enterprise solutions.
+ Evaluate and select vendors that align with the organization's technology roadmap.

**System Experience:**

+ Possess experience with Jamis, Humanic, HRIS systems, and Zendesk.
+ Act as a subject matter expert for these systems, providing guidance on optimization, integration, and migration.

**Team Leadership:**

+ Lead and mentor a team of IT professionals, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
+ Provide guidance on professional development and skills enhancement.

**Project Management:**

+ Manage project initiatives to be delivered on time, on budget and within the staffing plan.
+ Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables.

**Security and Compliance:**

+ Implement and maintain robust security measures for enterprise solutions.
+ Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.


Job Requirements (Education/Skills/Experience)::
**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience (8+ years) in a leadership role within IT, with a focus on enterprise solutions.
* ITIL Foundations Certification
* Active Secret Security Clearance or ability to obtain one
* Knowledge and experience working in government contracting
* Extensive experience with ServiceNow and API integration is a must.
* Knowledge and experience in the integration and migration of systems.
* Familiarity with Jamis, Humanic, HRIS systems, and Zendesk is a plus.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to manage and lead a high-performing IT team.

**Competencies:*** **Leadership:** As head of an IT department, you will be responsible for setting the tone and direction for the team. You must be able to motivate and encourage your team members to do their best work, and handle conflict and difficult situations.
* **Time Management:** Proficiency in prioritizing tasks, meet deadlines, and avoid multi-tasking.
* **Communication Skills:** The ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical staff and stakeholders and be able to listen and understand the needs of the team.
* **Change Management:** Demonstrated ability to plan, implement and monitor changes within and to an organization.
* **Accountability and Commitment:** Willingness to take ownership of tasks and ensure follow-through on all commitments.
* **Strategic Thinking:** Think long term, strategically and see the big picture in order to make decisions that will benefit the company as a whole.
* **Business Acumen:** A sound understanding of business principles, including budgeting and financial analysis.
* **Integrity and Values:** Consistently acting with integrity and upholding the core values of the organization.
* **Problem Solving:** Ability to problem solve and make decisions quickly and effectively.

*This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the* *requirements of 41 CFR 60–1.4(a), 60–300.5(a) and* *60–741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination* *against qualified individuals based on their status as* *protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and* *prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on* *their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender* *identity, national origin, or for inquiring about, discussing,* *or disclosing information about compensation. Moreover,* *these regulations require that covered prime contractors* *and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and* *advance in employment individuals without regard to race,* *color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,* *national origin, disability or veteran status.*

We provide a full spectrum of IT solutions that support clients in the defense, healthcare, national security, law enforcement, and intelligence communities. With a central focus on innovation, we translate modern technologies, industry best practices, and proven methodologies into client-driven solutions. Our teams of technologists are organized around digital solutions in the areas of systems/software engineering, data management, cloud adoption, and cybersecurity. As thought leaders and strategic partners, we provide a deliberate mix of people, processes, and technology to advance mission goals. Our IT companies have been consistently recognized for driving mission success through process efficiencies, reduced costs, and exploited technologies

title: Director of Partner Success
description:
Abridge was founded in 2018 with the mission of powering deeper understanding in healthcare. Our AI-powered platform was purpose-built for medical conversations, improving clinical documentation efficiencies while enabling clinicians to focus on what matters most—their patients.


Our enterprise-grade technology transforms patient-clinician conversations into structured clinical notes in real-time, with deep EMR integrations. Powered by Linked Evidence and our purpose-built, auditable AI, we are the only company that maps AI-generated summaries to ground truth, helping providers quickly trust and verify the output. As pioneers in generative AI for healthcare, we are setting the industry standards for the responsible deployment of AI across health systems.


We are a growing team of practicing MDs, AI scientists, PhDs, creatives, technologists, and engineers working together to empower people and make care make more sense.

**The Role**
------------


As a Director of Partner Success at Abridge, you will play a vital role in ensuring the satisfaction, adoption, and expansion of our solutions within our customers. You will be a core member of the commercial team and work closely with clinicians, administrators, and key stakeholders to understand their needs, provide ongoing support and guidance, and drive the successful utilization and expansion of our products and services. You will report to Abridge’s Chief Commercial Officer.

**What You'll Do**
------------------


Build and maintain strong relationships with clinicians and healthcare professionals across enterprise customers.

* Act as a trusted advisor to clinicians, offering guidance and best practices to enhance their productivity, efficiency, and patient outcomes.
* Understand user workflows, pain points, and objectives to align our solutions with their needs.
* Provide product training and onboarding support to clinicians, ensuring a smooth transition and optimal utilization of our solutions.
* Proactively identify and address any issues or concerns raised by clinicians, collaborating with internal teams to provide timely resolutions.
* Monitor and track clinician satisfaction and adoption rates, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement and driving engagement initiatives.
* Collaborate with the sales team to identify expansion opportunities with existing customers, outlining goals, milestones, and action plans.
* Conduct regular business reviews with key stakeholders to assess product performance, user feedback, and identify opportunities for additional value-add solutions.
* Present new features, upgrades, and solutions to clients, highlighting their potential benefits and ROI.
* Track customer expansion metrics and contribute to revenue growth targets.
* Support all clinician users and serve as the voice of the customer internally, sharing insights, feedback, and success stories to drive product and service improvements.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and product, to deliver a seamless customer experience.
* Contribute to the development of customer success resources, such as knowledge bases, training materials, and customer success stories.

**What You'll Bring**
---------------------

* 5+ years proven experience as a Director of Customer/Partner Success or Customer Success/Partner Manager
* Strong understanding of the healthcare ecosystem, including the dynamics and challenges faced by large health enterprises and clinicians.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build trust and establish rapport with clinicians and stakeholders at all levels.
* Technical aptitude and ability to quickly understand and effectively communicate complex software solutions.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with a proactive and results-oriented mindset.
* Ability to multitask and manage multiple client relationships simultaneously.
* Familiarity with CRM software and customer success tools is a plus.
* Strong organizational and project management capabilities.


We value people who want to learn new things, and we know that great team members might not perfectly match a job description. If you’re interested in the role but aren’t sure whether or not you’re a good fit, we’d still like to hear from you.

**Why Work at Abridge?**
------------------------

* Be a part of a trailblazing, mission driven organization that uses audio as the wedge to improve the healthcare delivery experience
* Unlimited PTO, plus 12 national holidays
* Comprehensive and generous benefits package:
* 16 weeks paid parental leave, for all employees
* Flexible working hours — we care more about what you accomplish than what specific hours you’re working
* Remote work environment
* Equity for all new employees
* Generous equipment budget for your home office setup ($1600)
* Opportunity to work and grow with talented individuals, and have ownership and impact at a high growth startup.
* Plus much more!

**Life at Abridge**
-------------------


At Abridge, we’re driven by our mission to bring understanding and follow-through to every medical conversation. Our culture is founded on doing things the “inverse” way in a legacy system—focusing on patients, instead of the system; focusing on outcomes, instead of billing; and focusing on the end-user experience, instead of a hospital administrator's mandate.


Abridgers are engineers, scientists, designers, and health policy experts from a diverse set of backgrounds—an experiment in alchemy that helps us transform an industry dominated by EHRs and enterprise into a consumer-driven experience, one recording at a time. We believe in strong ideas, loosely held, and place a high premium on a growth mindset. We push each other to grow and expose each other to the latest in our respective fields. Whether it’s holding a PhD-level deep dive into understanding fairness and underlying bias in machine learning models, debating the merits of a Scandinavian design philosophy in our UI/UX, or writing responses for Medicare rules to influence U.S. health policy, we prioritize sharing our findings across the team and helping each other be successful.

**Diversity & Inclusion**
-------------------------


Abridge is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion is at the core of what we do. We actively welcome applicants from all backgrounds (including but not limited to race, gender, educational background, and sexual orientation).

**Staying Safe - Protect Yourself From Recruitment Fraud**
----------------------------------------------------------


We are aware of individuals and entities fraudulently representing themselves as Abridge recruiters and/or hiring managers. Abridge will never ask for financial information or payment, or for personal information such as bank account number or social security number during the job application or interview process. Any emails from the Abridge recruiting team will come from an @abridge.com email address. You can learn more about how to protect yourself from these types of fraud by referring to this article. Please exercise caution and cease communications if something feels suspicious about your interactions.


Compensation Range: $150K - $160K

title: Head of Core IT Engineering
description:
Biotechnology is rewriting life as we know it, from the medicines we take, to the crops we grow, the materials we wear, and the household goods that we rely on every day. But moving at the new speed of science requires better technology.  

  

Benchling's mission is to unlock the power of biotechnology. The world's most innovative biotech companies use Benchling's R&D Cloud to power the development of breakthrough products and accelerate time to milestone and market.  

  

Come help us bring modern software to modern science.

**ROLE OVERVIEW**
-----------------



Benchling is looking for an experienced IT Engineering Leader to join our IT organization. Reporting to the Head of Information Technology, you will lead and grow our Engineering function as we scale globally. You will lead and support our Identity, Client Platform, Networking, Infrastructure, and Collaboration functions and drive the effectiveness and efficiency of our execution, delivery, and change management processes. This is both a strategic and hands-on role, requiring you to work across the organization to improve the way we operate.



In your role within the Information Technology team, you will be instrumental in standardizing our technology processes to enhance team effectiveness and efficiency. Your responsibilities include developing our Core IT roadmap, leading the test, execution and optimization of our tools, and managing the change required for our growth and scalability. Working closely with IT leadership, you will define crucial initiatives and establish the necessary reporting and analytics to track user adoption and impact. Your efforts will be key in fostering a culture that values collaboration, innovation, and technical expertise, thereby ensuring exceptional experiences for both customers and employees.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**
--------------------


* Provide leadership and direction to the engineering team, offering guidance, mentorship, and performance management to foster a culture of technical excellence and innovation.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and interoperability of cloud applications with other systems, enhancing organizational efficiency and user experience.
* Manage the budget, resources, and vendor relationships for various cloud applications within our E2E Enterprise map, focusing on cost-effective utilization and strategic vendor management.
* Develop data driven KPIs, monitor the performance and usage of cloud applications, proactively identifying and resolving technical issues, and ensuring high availability and optimal user experience.
* Lead continuous improvement initiatives in engineering processes and tools to increase efficiency, quality, and agility in software development.
* Foster a collaborative and innovative work environment, encouraging the engineering team to experiment with new technologies and methodologies for business growth.
* Engage with a diverse and creative team, senior leaders, and architects, transforming process-heavy operations into automated governance solutions.
* Implement and manage systems operations with a focus on improving risk control and operational efficiency, utilizing your experience in global enterprise product operations and strong communication and logical skills.
* Develop and execute the strategy for Google Workspace applications, ensuring alignment with business objectives and IT architecture. This includes focusing on the integration and optimization of key Google Workspace tools such as Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides, to enhance collaboration and productivity across the organization.
* Responsible for managing and maintaining the enterprise network infrastructure, including oversight of SD-WAN, Meraki, and Velocloud. Ensure network reliability and performance, keeping up with the latest advancements and maintaining relevant certifications to uphold high standards in network management and security.
* Design and implement secure, scalable solutions leveraging cloud enterprise tools like Okta for identity and access management. Establish a comprehensive governance framework that ensures adherence to security, privacy, and regulatory standards, protecting the secure access and management of corporate resources.
* Lead the deployment and management of client platform endpoints across the enterprise, encompassing Windows, Mac OS and Linux environments. Ensure scalable and secure configuration of these platforms, optimizing performance and compatibility while maintaining compliance with organizational IT standards and cybersecurity protocols.
* Partner with stakeholders in implementation and optimization of Atlassian products, including Jira Software, Confluence, and Jira Service Management, to enhance project management, documentation, and IT service processes across the organization. Ensure these platforms are seamlessly integrated, fostering collaboration and efficiency while aligning with the company's operational and strategic goals.

**QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------


* BA/BS degree in Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent degree/experience in related field
* 7-10 years in IT Engineering or Technical Operations with proven management experience, preferably at a fast-paced high-growth company
* Expert in deploying and managing Windows environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication across a broad audience; demonstrates an ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
* Self starter with ability to sweat the details while developing a strategy and roadmap that will deliver high quality technical solutions and processes.
* Strong systems analysis and problem-solving skills with ability to prioritize and execute in a high-pressure environment, including making sound decisions in emergency situations.
* Advanced proficiency and/or experience managing an IT Engineering team owning a modern stack of systems and applications like Okta, Google Workspace, AWS, Jamf, Intune, Meraki, Slack, Zoom, Github, Snowflake, Jira Software, Jira Data Center
* Curiosity about life sciences!

**SALARY RANGE**
----------------



Benchling takes a market-based approach to pay. The candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, interview performance, and work location. For this role the base salary range is $190,825 - $258,175.



To help you determine which zone applies to your location, please see this resource. If you have questions regarding a specific location's zone designation, please contact a recruiter for additional information.



Total Compensation includes the following:


* Competitive salary and equity
* Broad range of medical, dental, and vision plans for employees and their dependents
* Fertility healthcare and family-forming benefits
* Four months of fully paid parental leave
* 401(k) + Employer Match
* Commuter benefits for in-office employees and a generous home office set up stipend for remote employees
* Mental health benefits, including therapy and coaching, for employees and their dependents
* Monthly Wellness stipend
* Learning and development stipend
* Generous PTO
* Company-wide Summer & Winter holiday shutdown
* Sabbaticals for 5-year and 10-year anniversaries

#### We believe diversity enriches our team so we hire people with a wide range of identities, backgrounds, and experiences.

We are an equal opportunity employer. That means we don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: V.P. of Product
description:
**Company Overview & History**


flexEngage is the leading provider of personalized transactional communications for retailers, enabling brands like Under Armour, Michael Kors, GNC, Five Below, Skechers, among others, to transform standard transactional touchpoints (digital receipts, order and ship notifications, packing slips, etc.) into dynamic engagement channels that drive loyalty and revenue.


The client creates enriched post-purchase communications that build customer loyalty and drive sales, while allowing retailers to monitor spending habits and shopping trends. flexEngage’s patented software allows retailers to add personalized content, videos, targeted offers and more to their omni-channel post-purchase communications.


Originally called flexReceipts, the company was founded in 2014 by Tomas Diaz and Jay Patel with the mission of eradicating paper receipts and helping retailers launch digital receipts. They re-branded to flexEngage in 2018 after expanding to any and all transactional communications.


flexEngage is a graduate of the prestigious business accelerator Y Combinator and is well funded by strong VC firms, including Bullpen Capital, Y Combinator, Synchrony Financial, and Point Judith Capital. The company closed a $6 million Series A round at the end of 2019, bringing them to $11 million in total funding, led by Bullpen Capital with, additional participants including Florida Funders, PJC, Synchrony Financial, Y Combinator, Struck Capital, AltaIR, Angel Round Table, and Eric Schneider.


**Role & Responsibilities**


The VP Product will join flexEngage’s executive team and lead the company through its next critical point in scale. Reporting to CEO and Co-Founder Tomas Diaz, the VP Product will drive short- and long-term product vision and strategy, day-to-day execution and be an integral component of the product development process. She/He will be the owner of the product vision to define and drive the product strategy and roadmap, anticipate opportunities in a quickly evolving market, and help to further propel flexEngage in building next generation marketing software.


It is critical that the VP Product at flexEngage be a hands-on team player who can operate effectively as a member of the company’s senior management team. Important to this hire is a self-starting individual with superior interpersonal and communication skill that can forge effective working relationships, internally and externally.


**Responsibilities**


* Define product roadmap so that stakeholders are engaged and key product decisions are well thought-out and communicated
* Work closely with the entire executive team to define, refine and improve the product vision and value proposition
* Oversee and/or write the requirements for all new product features and enhancements to all systems and products
* Develop effective and informative feedback loops through various departments within the organization
* Drive agile, iterative and user-centric product development processes
* Be the voice of the end user; collect improvement requests and champion them into release cycles
* Leverage data and innovate features and functionality based on an assessment of what the next generation marketing technology landscape will look like
* Implement tools to organize and optimize workflows


**Experience**


* Ideal candidate comes with in-depth knowledge of marketing software
* 7-10+ years of experience creating software products
* Track record of building and shipping elegantly simple user interfaces/experiences with measurable success
* Hands-on development skills with the ability to roll up sleeves and work alongside the engineering team
* Experience building out a product team (recruiting; hiring; growth and retention of team)


**Person**


* Excellent communication skills, both written and oral with the ability to negotiate with peers and management in a compelling and confident manner
* Highly organized individual with an execution/delivery-driven mindset
* Startup experience strongly preferred; entrepreneurial spirit a must
* Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to manage, mentor and motivate a team. Emotional Intelligence is critical to this role
* Strong analytics and logical skills
* Problem-solving and organizational skills
* Strong presentation skills
* Strong track record in thriving in a highly energetic fast-moving environment
* An extremely smart and dynamic individual and a balanced ego

title: Director of Information Security
description:
**Director of Information Security**

**About IHI**


The Institute for Healthcare Improvement (IHI) is an independent not-for-profit organization based in Boston, Massachusetts, USA. For over 30 years, IHI has used improvement science to advance and sustain better outcomes in health and health systems across the world. IHI brings awareness of safety and quality to millions, catalyzes learning and the systematic improvement of care, develops solutions to previously intractable challenges, and mobilizes health systems, communities, regions, and nations to reduce harm and deaths. IHI collaborates with a growing community to spark bold, inventive ways to improve the health of individuals and populations. IHI generates optimism, harvests fresh ideas, and supports anyone, anywhere who wants to profoundly change health and health care for the better. Learn more at ihi.org.

**Position Summary:**


The Information Security Director will be responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all information assets within the organization. You will lead the development and implementation of the organization's information security strategy, policies, and procedures.


In this role, you will also be responsible for ensuring compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards. You will be responsible for identifying and mitigating information security risks, managing security incidents, and providing security awareness training to employees. The role requires a high level of technical expertise in information security, risk management, compliance, and governance.


This role will require a visionary leader who understands the global information security & risk impacts, and has a sound understanding of cybersecurity technology tools, methods and processes. This role requires a leader who works with business stakeholders, assesses needs, builds awareness and develops informed strategy and direction for information security.

**Position Responsibilities:**


Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

**Awareness and Governance:**

* Develop and manage a targeted information security awareness training program for all employees, contractors and approved system users, and establish metrics to measure the effectiveness of this security training program for the different audiences.
* Lead cross-functional Information Security Steering Committee, infusing information security governance procedures that foster resiliency, raise awareness, govern policy and review cybersecurity related activities.
* Provide clear risk mitigating directives for projects with components in IT, including the mandatory application of controls.
* Foster a "Security Awareness Champions" program to spread the word and infuse security awareness behaviors, cybersecurity risks and policies.
* Perform annual risk assessment and business impact analysis.
* Assist in performing audits using industry standard security methods to help strengthen internal security controls, procedures and policies.
* Investigate security incidents, develop remediation plans, and work with appropriate stakeholders to implement resolutions.

**Security Operations:**

* Manage and provide additional security evaluations for existing or new vendors, partners, and systems. Leverage security tools and data sets to provide visibility into vendor security posture and risk.
* Work with IT and technology stakeholders to evolve new business continuity and disaster recovery plans.
* Support data protection and privacy initiatives in compliance with the data protection standards of both US and foreign. Align with internal compliance teams on policy updates in global data privacy standards.
* Work with MSSP to monitor and manage all IT security tools and platforms including Security management platforms, Anti-Malware/Ransomware, log management systems, and information security training systems.
* Work with IT department, MSP, legal and compliance teams to keep security polices updated, communicated and enforced.
* Review existing security architecture, identify design gaps, and recommend security enhancements.
* Stays abreast of emerging security technologies and integrates them into security architecture as needed.
* Ensures alignment between security architecture frameworks, IT standards and overall business strategy.
* Achieves security architecture compliance on industry-specific requirements as well as state and federal regulations.

**Leadership:**

* Lead, grow and manage the Information Security Program at IHI, with the responsibility to ensure that information assets and associated technology are all adequately protected.
* Partner with all business leaders while working closely with service desk, Infrastructure and Enterprise/Business Applications teams.
* Create a risk-based process for the assessment and mitigation of any information security risk in the IHI's ecosystem consisting of faculty, vendors, consumers and any other third parties.
* Responsible for identifying, evaluating, and reporting on legal and regulatory, IT and cybersecurity risk while supporting and enabling business goals.

**Position Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Strong Interpersonal skills and ability to translate complex issues into simple concepts
* Ability to be key contributor in IT projects and new system implementation activities
* Experience leading cross-functional teams
* Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to proactively introduce solutions
* Ability to manage many complex and challenging tasks and prioritize criticality
* Strong documentation skills
* Collaborative team player with strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication and presentation skills
* Highly motivated, driven, and willing to try new concepts
* Strong work ethic with ability to maintain and safeguard confidential information
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with multiple competing priorities
* Ability to learn and use new systems and technology
* Continuous improvement mindset
* Strong ability to plan, organize and think strategically
* Commitment to IHI Values
* Commitment to equity, anti-racism, and the improvement of societal systems

**Position Qualifications:**


Required

* Bachelor's degree and 7 plus years of experience in leading Information Security initiatives, incident management and security operations


OR

* 10 plus years of experience in leading Information Security initiatives, incident management and security operations


Preferred

* Bachelor's degree in cyber security, information risk management, or a relevant IT field
* 5+ years of experience with regulatory compliance and information security management frameworks.
* Experience implementing, managing, and driving all Information Security, training, policies, and review activities in accordance with applicable cybersecurity standards and privacy regulations.
* Experience leading cross-functional teams.
* Strong Interpersonal skills and ability to translate complex issues into simple concepts.
* Adequate knowledge of server, network, application and perimeter security, vulnerability and patch management, endpoint security, incident response, security audit, compliance and industry certifications (e.g. SOC2, ISO27000)
* Advanced experience managing cloud security tools such as CASB, UEM, Security Scorecards, Anti-Malware tools, IDR, MDR and Security Awareness training tools.
* Experience with NIST Cybersecurity framework.
* Knowledge of the Information Security market and information risk vendor landscape.
* Ability to manage many complex and challenging tasks and prioritize criticality.
* Strong documentation skills.
* Ability to be key contributor in IT projects and new system implementation activities.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to proactively introduce solutions.
* Strong understanding of cloud security, datacenter security, application security, endpoint security and security audit practices and industry certifications.

  

At IHI, we are inspired to do our best work and be our best selves by leaning into our values and uniting in our vision to create a future in which everyone has the best care and health possible. We ensure that people feel valued and supported in meaningful ways, as demonstrated in our total rewards package that features competitive compensation, medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability plans, FSA plans, matching 401k contributions, discounted MBTA passes, tuition reimbursement, a personal development allowance to support what matters to you, a professional development allowance to support continued learning, respect for personal commitments and flexibility to manage them, generous time off including vacation time, a paid week off between Christmas and New Year's Day, wellness and wellbeing time, and other special programs to support employee wellbeing.


IHI is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex or gender, marital status, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, military service, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, crime victim status, political belief, and any other protected class under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to complete our application, please let us know. Veterans are encouraged to apply.

title: Director of Analytics
description:
**ABOUT TURNPOINT**

TurnPoint Services is a national leading service provider of plumbing, electrical and HVAC with 50+ local brands across the United States. Our Mission as a newly formed Business Intelligence function is to transform data into insights that make it easier for our brands to take care of their customers. Our commitment is to bridge the gap between data and decisions, making trends not only understandable but actionable, empowering non-financial managers to lead with confidence.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The Director of Analytics will be a part of a newly formed Business Intelligence function at TurnPoint and will report directly to the SVP of OpX. This role This role is perfect for someone with an analytical mindset, is comfortable rolling their sleeves up and has a desire to make an impact in an organization.

Join us as a Director of Analytics, an instrumental role within our new BI department. Reporting to the SVP of OpX and partnering with our Lead Data Scientist, we seek an analytical mind, with a hands-on approach to problem solving and ability to think strategically. This role will be involved in the creation and development of core metrics, reports and dashboards as well as the execution and development of the longer-term roadmap.

This role will spearhead the BI function's evolution, diving deep into challenges while always keeping an eye on the bigger picture.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Power BI Platform Development: Lead the setup, maintenance, and enhancement of the Power BI platform ensuring robustness and scalability.
* Dashboard & Reporting: Design, develop, and deploy impactful dashboards, reports, and visuals that drive actionable insights across various business functions.
* Analytics Partnership: Collaborate closely with the Data Science team to facilitate and streamline the delivery of advanced analytics through Power BI.
* Strategic Development: Partner with the SVP of OPX to set a vision for the BI function, considering future growth, emerging trends, and the broader business strategy.
* Team Building: As the function grows, play a key role in hiring, training, and mentoring BI professionals to foster a high-performing team.
* Vendor Management: Evaluate, select, and manage relationships with external vendors and consultants ensuring the delivery of quality products and services within stipulated budgets.
* Best Practices: Ensure best practices in data visualization, data integrity, and dashboard design are consistently applied.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with senior leadership and cross-functional teams to identify reporting needs and ensure BI solutions meet business objectives.

**Technical Capabilities:**

* Power BI Expertise: Proficient in designing, developing, and deploying reports and dashboards in Power BI Desktop, as well as managing datasets and data models in the Power BI Service.
* SQL Skills: Strong ability to write, debug, and optimize SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
* Data Modeling: Familiarity with star and snowflake schema designs, as well as understanding of fct and dimension tables.
* DAX: Advanced knowledge of Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) for creating custom calculations and aggregations within Power BI models.
* Data Integration: Experience integrating Power BI with various data sources such as SQL Server, Azure, Excel, and other cloud-based or on-premises databases.
* Power Query: Skilled in using Power Query for data transformation and manipulation within Power BI.
* APIs and Web Services: Ability to integrate Power BI with various APIs and web services to pull or push data in real-time scenarios.
* Data Visualization Best Practices: Proficient in applying principles of data visualization to effectively communicate data insights and stories.
* Cloud Platforms: Understanding of cloud platforms, especially AWS and DataBricks, and their capabilities in relation to data storage, processing, and analytics.
* Performance Optimization: Ability to optimize Power BI reports for performance by fine-tuning queries, reducing data model sizes, and implementing efficient DAX measures.
* Security: Knowledge of data security protocols, including row-level security in Power BI and encryption methods.
* Automation & Scheduling: Experience with automating data refreshes and report generation using tools like Power Automate or the Power BI Gateway.
* Scripting & Programming: Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python for more complex data manipulation or integration needs is a plus

**Additional Compensation and Benefits:**

* Affordable Medical, Dental and Vision plans
* 401K with company match
* Short- and Long-Term Disability plans
* Accident & Critical Illness Insurance available
* 20K Life Insurance Policy free
* Additional life insurance available
* 6 Paid Holidays each year
* Paid Time Off
