title: Director of Research & Development, Assay Development, Molecular Genetics (USA Based - Remote)
description:
**Company Description** **Overview**:


Our client, a publicly traded Molecular Genomics Laboratory, is seeking a highly motivated Manager of Assay Development, Molecular Genetics, Women's Health. You will lead the group responsible for developing and validating cutting edge early cancer detection diagnostic NGS assays in a regulated environment. The incumbent will work with other teams in technology development as well as collaborate cross-functionally with members of bioinformatics, quality, regulatory affairs, operations, and clinical development. Success in this role requires the ability to think strategically and provide guidance on experimental design, as well as an ability and willingness to engage with the details of experimental execution. The ideal candidate will combine strong leadership capability with strong communication skills, experience working under design control, and a deep technical understanding of NGS assays.

 **Job Description** **Job Responsibilities****:**

* Lead a team of scientists and research associates in work that targets late stage development, verification and validation activities. These activities include:
* Working closely with team leads in assay development, engineering, bioinformatics, operations, and software development to develop and validate NGS assays
* Working with the Labs assay validation team, as well as Regulatory and Quality partners, to establish and execute plans for assay verification and validation
* Applying knowledge of working under design control to guide the design of verification and validation activities
* Supporting capacity expansion and staffing increase to match company growth
* Be highly committed to deliver results in a fast-paced and rapidly growing organization
* Able to manage multiple projects and work streams across the Labs development team, including assessment of workload and resourcing requirements to deliver the teams objectives
* Be committed to train, mentor, and develop scientific staff
* Ensure learnings and best practices are shared across the organization
* Be proficient in clinical laboratory compliance and testing

  

**Qualifications** **Requirements**:

**Knowledge, Skills, and Experience**

* Experience leading small teams; strong leadership capabilities and the ability to lead multiple projects through a complex development program are required
* Experience in development of nucleic acid technologies with a strong preference related to sequencing-based genomic assays
* Experience working under design control with advanced knowledge of IVD product development and understanding of GCP/GCLP, CLIA/CAP, ISO13485/15189 guidelines
* Experience with data analysis of large data sets, preferably in-depth analysis of NGS data using analysis packages such as R, Python, or JMP
* **Additional requirements**
* Successful in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary, dynamic, and result-oriented work environment
* Consummate team player: demonstrated ability to contribute in an environment where numerous inputs are required to accomplish complex goals
* Curiosity and drive
* Experience writing protocols, reports, pre-submissions, IDE or PMA submission related documentation for molecular diagnostic applications
* Experience growing a team to meet company growth objectives preferred
* Handles tight timelines and stress in a constructive manner
* High attention to detail, with the ability to create clear and concise technical documentation
* Demonstrated ability to organize and communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner to cross-functional audiences.

**Education, Certification/Licensure, and/or Experience**

* BSc is minimum requirement with **8 years’ experience in assay development**
* NYS CLIA Tech license **desired** (not required)

  

**Additional Information**  

Employment includes a very strong base salary, and an exceptional benefits package to include, PTO, Holidays, Vacation, Health Benefits package, Vision, Dental, Disability, etc., plus a very generous Stock package.

title: Director of Engineering, New Products/International Payments
description:
**Who We Are**
==============



At Justworks, you'll enjoy a welcoming and casual environment, great benefits, wellness program offerings, company retreats, and the ability to interact with and learn from leaders in the startup community. We work hard and care about our most prized asset - our people.



We're helping businesses get off the ground by enabling them to focus on running their business. We solve HR issues. We're data-driven and never stop iterating. If you'd like to work in a supportive, entrepreneurial environment, are interested in building something meaningful and having fun while doing it, we'd love to hear from you.



We're united by shared goals and shared motivations at Justworks. These are best summed up in our company values, which are reflected in our product and in our team.



Our Values



If this sounds like you, you'll fit right in.

**Who You Are**
===============



Justworks is seeking a **Director of Engineering for our New Products/International team that will focus on International Payments and Payroll** while leading our dynamic and innovative engineering team. This individual will play a critical role in building, scaling, and maintaining the technology infrastructure that powers our international payroll and payments systems. As the **Director of Engineering**, you will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure the highest standards of quality and compliance are upheld while driving continuous improvement and innovation.



Getting payments and payroll right, especially on a global scale, is integral to the livelihoods of small businesses and their employees. It's not just about processing numbers; it's about ensuring that employees are paid accurately and on time, that taxes and compliance are handled seamlessly, and that businesses can focus on their core operations without worrying about payroll-related issues. The Director of Engineering, International Payments and Payroll, plays a critical role in enabling this by developing and maintaining systems that operate flawlessly, while also being ready for future growth. This role demands a leader who can **build a team and help architect solutions** that provide real-time, error-free money movement and payroll processing on a global scale which is paramount in fulfilling our commitment to small businesses and their employees, both today and in the future.



We expect the size of this group will grow significantly over time and this is a mission critical role.


**Your Success Profile**
========================


**What You Will Work On**
-------------------------



Your mission is to bring forward-thinking strategies and execute them to the most critical areas of the Justworks's future.


* **Leadership:** Provide strong leadership, mentorship, and guidance to the engineering team responsible for international payments and payroll systems. Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous delivery and improvement.
* **Technical Strategy:** Define and drive the technical strategy and roadmap for international payments and payroll systems, ensuring alignment with business objectives and scalability for future growth. Help define and communicate technical standards and best practices.
* **Execution:** Oversee the development and maintenance of mission-critical software components, systems, and services related to international payroll and payments, ensuring robustness, security, and reliability.
+ Enhance our testing, monitoring and continuous deployment infrastructure.

* **International Payment Systems Leadership:** Provide strategic direction and leadership for the development and maintenance of international payment systems, ensuring accurate and timely disbursements for employees and tax authorities across different countries.
* **Compliance:** Ensure that the payroll and payments systems are in compliance with local and global regulations, working closely with compliance and legal teams to address regulatory changes promptly.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with the business, product managers, designers, and other engineering teams to define product requirements, set priorities, and deliver high-quality features and enhancements.
+ Partner closely with stakeholders and partners to improve efficiency of how we deliver product.
+ Work with business operation leaders to establish data engineering strategies to make us a strong data driven organization.

* **Team Development:** Build and develop a world-class engineering team by hiring top talent, setting clear expectations, and providing ongoing coaching and feedback.
* **Innovation:** Identify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and innovation in international payroll and payment processing, streamlining operations and enhancing customer experience.
* **Data Security:** Maintain the highest standards of data security and privacy to safeguard sensitive payroll and payment information.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

**How You Will Do Your Work**
-----------------------------



As a Director of Engineering, *how* results are achieved is paramount for your success and ultimately result in our success as an organization. In this role, your foundational knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes are anchored in the following:


* **Good judgment** - the exercise of critical thinking, analyzing and assessing problems and implications, identifying patterns, making connections of underlying issues, understanding risks and developing mitigation strategies, and taking ownership of the outcome.
* **Resourcefulness** - taking a can-do approach, even in the face of obstacles and constraints by assessing what's in front of you and effectively and efficiently optimizing what you have, whether it's working on something new or thinking about how to do something better.
* **Teamwork and communication** - putting our collective best together through documentation, collaboration, relationship-building, listening, empathy, recruiting, and evangelism.
* **Influence and leadership** - fostering a community of knowledge-sharing, collaboration, mentorship, and forward-thinking.
* **Skills and knowledge** - the capacity to actively learn and apply specific domain knowledge, know-how, and best practices to continually enhance and improve.


In addition, all Justworkers focus on aligning their behaviors to our core values known as COGIS. Read more about our values here.


**Qualifications**
------------------


* Proven leadership experience in developing and managing high-performing engineering teams, with a **minimum of 8 years in a software engineering leadership role.**
* Extensive experience in developing and maintaining **high compliance** or **high auditability modern SaaS software**.
* Experience developing and maintaining **payroll and/or payment processing systems**, ideally within an global context, is most **preferred.**
* Demonstrated expertise in **software architecture**, design, and development.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative, cross-functional, globally dispersed environment.
* You are comfortable working with business and product partners in an agile environment.
* You are experienced in scaling a technology organization and **growing teams.**
* You have a deep empathy for customers, especially small business, and for your coworkers.
* You are not afraid of making changes but you do it thoughtfully.
* You have a gut feeling and vision but you also rely on data to back it up.
* You strive to learn new things and raise your own bar.


The base wage range for this position based in our New York City Office is targeted at $250,000.00 to $270,000.00 per year.



#LI-Hybrid



#LI-LB2


Actual compensation is based on multiple factors that are unique to each candidate, including and not limited to skill set, level of relevant experience, and specific work location. Salary ranges for positions based in other locations may differ based on the cost of labor in that location.



For more information about Justworks' Total Reward Philosophy, including all of the perks and benefits we are proud to offer our team members, please visit Total Rewards @ Justworks.


**Diversity At Justworks**
==========================



Justworks is committed to maintaining a workplace where diversity of identity, culture, and life experience is the norm and is celebrated authentically and respected consistently. Diversity in our work, our people, and our product drives creativity and innovation, entrepreneurial leadership and integrity, competitiveness, and collaboration throughout our business and in the market. We depend on our differences to make our team stronger, our workplace more dynamic, and our product accessible to all of our customers.



We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or familial status, disability, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.



Our DEIB Report and Our DEI Commitment

title: Director of Implementation
description:
**NimbleRx** is a technology company that enables people to live their best lives by improving access to reliable, affordable healthcare. Our mission is to bring pharmacies into the future by building a convenient and easy-to-use service that supports pharmacists and empowers patients. We are a fast-growing, technology-first startup doing over $1 billion in GMV annually, and our team stays rooted in a patient-first mentality; we aim to bring all of our patients convenient access to reasonably-priced medications without ever needing to step foot in a pharmacy.  

Nimble is looking for a motivated, self-starting and experienced sales professional from the tech / healthcare space to lead and manage our post-sales Implementation Team. In this role, you will be managing the operations / implementation team, all focused on the implementation, integration, and onboarding of our pharmacy partners. A person that will succeed in this role is someone who is able to learn and adapt quickly, able to dig into the weeds to understand how to best position our product, and drive extreme attention to detail and data in order to meet and exceed operations and account management goals.
### **You will:**

+ Manage Nimble’s Operations Implementation team, a team focused on onboarding new pharmacy partners from signed contract through successful integrations and implementation workflows and go live
+ Coach to effective implementation techniques including: productive intakes, efficient onboarding, timely implementations, integrations set up, troubleshooting, and understanding technology functions
+ Use actionable data to drive process improvements from onboarding to implementation workflows and go live
+ Execute against a scalable strategy for driving high volume implementations
+ Develop, maintain, and consistently improve a system of best practices for the team that drives account implementation and retention, improved performance and account growth
+ Interact and communicate regularly with internal and external stakeholders to help drive new product rollouts / new pharmacy-related initiatives
+ Create, track, and monitor KPIs to ensure effectiveness and performance of the team

### **What you bring:**

+ 5-8+ years of Implementation Management experience, leading and scaling implementation teams in a remote/hybrid environment
+ Bachelor’s degree
+ Experience working cross-functionally and managing a team through a high volume of monthly implementations
+ Positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
+ Comfortable working in the gray with experience documenting standard operating procedures
+ Curiosity to dig several layers deep into metrics, have an innate desire to understand key drivers and whether they are the correct or best metrics to measure/manage a business or process
+ Organized self starter who pays close attention to details

### **What's in it for you:**

+ Compassionate and driven colleagues in a fun environment where success is celebrated
+ Rare opportunity to change an industry and lives of millions
+ We are reinventing healthcare / pharmacy - your (grand)parents and your (grand)children will understand and appreciate what you do
+ Medical / Dental / Vision / 401K package that fits your needs
+ Generous Vacation Policy - work hard and take time when you need it
+ 11 Paid Holidays

At Nimble, we are dedicated to putting patients first and improving pharmacies across America. Join us on this exciting journey!  

Diversity, inclusion and belonging at Nimble: Nimble is building a diverse and inclusive work environment where we learn from each other. We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of diverse backgrounds, abilities and perspectives.

title: Vice President of Product
description:
**About Arrive Recommerce**

Arrive is a venture-backed Series A stage technology company that powers Returns to Recommerce™ for brand and retailer partners, enabling companies to direct non-new product including returns and excess inventory into a fully-branded secondary resale channel. Arrive has built Recommence Management Technology, Recommerce Storefront Technology and Analytical Tools to help partners launch a profitable and sustainable business model. Additionally, Arrive partners with like-minded companies in adjacent verticals such as returns management, logistics and ecommerce enablement to increase margin and value for our partners. Notable partners include brands like YETI, Burton Snowboards and more across the fashion, apparel, footwear, active outdoor, home and lifestyle spaces. Arrive was named the 4th Most Innovative Retail Company by Fast Company in 2022.


**Position Description**

As the Vice President of Product for Arrive, you will be at the forefront of driving the vision and execution of our product strategy. You will lead the product development process, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and drive the innovation that powers our recommerce solutions. This role requires a deep understanding of technology, a proven track record in product management, and the ability to shape the future of our product offerings.


**What you'll do:**

* **Product Vision and Strategy:** As a member of the Arrive executive team, you will develop and communicate the product vision and strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals.
* **Product Development:** Lead the end-to-end product development process, from conceptualization to product launch. Drive the creation of innovative recommerce products and features that meet the needs of our brand and retailer partners.
* **Cross-functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with various internal teams to gather feedback on product requirements and guide market positioning, ensuring the product aligns with business objectives.
* **Product Analytics:** Own and manage product analytics, including monitoring the product pipeline and revenue goals. Use data-driven insights to make informed product decisions.
* **External Representation:** Represent Arrive as a product leader in the recommerce industry. Serve as an active voice for Arrive both with partners and publicly.
* **Team Leadership:** Build and manage a high-performing product team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

  

**Who you are:**

* **Proven Experience:** You have 10+ years of experience in product management or equivalent roles, with at least 2 years of experience leading a product organization.
* **Strategic Thinker:** You possess a strong strategic mindset and can effectively build and communicate a product vision **.**
* **E-commerce & Operational Expertise:** You have a deep knowledge of e-commerce and fulfillment & 3PL operations and can leverage this expertise to drive product innovation.
* **Analytical Skills:** You are proficient in data analysis, using analytics to inform product decisions.
* **Startup Mindset:** You thrive in fast-paced, early-stage environments, and are flexible in adapting to changing circumstances.
* **Travel:** You are comfortable with occasional travel as needed including one week a quarter for a company on-site.

**Why Arrive**

* **Key Role:** You will play a critical role in shaping the future of a fast-growing company in the recommerce industry.
* **Collaborative Culture:** Join a collaborative, energetic team with a friendly, supportive, mission-driven culture.
* **Benefits:** Arrive offers unlimited PTO, robust healthcare plans (Medical, Dental, Vision), maternity & parental leave, and opportunities for professional growth including coaching.

**Hours & Location**

This is a full-time position that may be remote. Arrive is based in Los Angeles.


**Apply**

Submit your application at https://thearriveplatform.com/careers

title: VP of Technology
description:
Job Description
At Athena, we power possibility through transformative delegation. True leaders reflect on what they want in life and map the path to get there. Athena is the path. We offer rigorously-tested delegation coaching technology and an exceptional Philippines-based XP to keep our driven clients moving forward. The result is 10x more leverage, more time, more impact in work and life.



Our clients are ambitious, high-impact CEOs, founders, and execs. They have started 100+ companies, raised billions in venture capital, taken companies public, worked in the White House, invested in Facebook/Uber/ Airbnb, run professional sports teams, were Governor of US states, and competed in Ironman races and the World Series of Poker.



With a waitlist growing by the day, Athena has already showcased compelling demand. The Vice President of Technology will lead and drive our company's technological strategy and innovation. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, exceptional leadership skills, and a proven track record of successfully managing and scaling technology teams. As the VP of Technology, you will collaborate closely with the executive team to align technology initiatives with business objectives, ensuring the delivery of innovative solutions that meet our customers' needs.



Specific Responsibilities


* Technology Strategy and Planning:
+ Develop and execute a comprehensive technology strategy aligned with the company's overall goals and objectives.
+ Evaluate and identify technology trends and solutions that can drive efficiency, productivity, and competitive advantage.
+ Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize technology roadmaps and initiatives.


* Technology Operations:
+ Oversee the design, development, and implementation of scalable, reliable, and secure technology solutions.
+ Ensure the effective management of IT infrastructure, systems, and applications, including cloud-based platforms.
+ Monitor and optimize technology performance, availability, and security, proactively addressing any issues or vulnerabilities.


* Cross-functional Collaboration:
+ Collaborate closely with key stakeholders, including product management, engineering, and business units, to ensure alignment and successful execution of technology initiatives.
+ Act as a trusted advisor and technology evangelist, providing insights and recommendations on emerging technologies and industry best practices.


* Budgeting and Resource Management:
+ Develop and manage the technology department's budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and cost-effective technology investments.
+ Evaluate and select external vendors and partners, establishing and managing relationships to support technology needs.


* Team Leadership and Management:
+ Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing technology team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
+ Provide guidance, coaching, and support to team members, ensuring professional growth and development.
+ Establish clear goals, objectives, and performance metrics for the technology team.



About You


* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. MBA or equivalent is a plus.
* Proven experience as a technology leader, with at least 10 years in a senior management role, preferably as a VP or Director of Technology.
* Deep understanding of modern technology stacks, architectures, and best practices, with expertise in a variety of tech stacks in the market.
* Track record of successfully delivering complex technology projects on time and within budget.
* Strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence and inspire teams and stakeholders.
* Strategic mindset, with the ability to align technology initiatives with business objectives.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on driving innovation and continuous improvement.
* Experience in startup and scale-up environments is a plus.

title: Director of Engineering
description:
In the cloud, every second counts. On the leading edge of security, Sysdig stops attacks in real time by instantly detecting changes in cloud security risk with runtime insights and open source Falco. We are passionate open source enthusiasts at heart and technical problem-solvers who are continually innovating and delivering powerful solutions to secure cloud-native applications.



We value diverse opinions and open dialogue to spur ideas. We believe in working closely together to achieve our goals, and since our launch, we have been flexible with when and where we work. We're an international company that understands how to cultivate a strong culture across remote teams.



And we're a great place to work too – we've been named a "Best Place to Work" by Inc.,the San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal, and we won six workplace awards from Comparably this year. We have been recognized by Deloitte as one of the 500 fastest-growing organizations for the last four years.



We are looking for driven team members who want to join us on our mission to lead cloud security globally. Does this sound like the right place for you?


**What you will do**


* Lead a geographically distributed team of skilled software engineers and engineering managers and enable them to deliver new products in the Sysdig Agent
* Have the technical capability to understand high-performance Kernel and systems code (mostly in C/C++) and dive in when necessary.
* Manage the growth of the team by hiring top-notch candidates.
* Work with different parts of the company including Customer Success, Product, and Engineering to drive the Agent roadmap.


**What you will bring with you**


* People manager with 10 + years of experience building, growing, leading, and inspiring engineering teams.
* Operated in a SaaS environment and have hands on experience with driving CI/CD oriented development and rapid iterations
* Deep knowledge of systems software and cloud security concepts such as - cloud-workload protections, configuration posture, vulnerability management in containerized environments
* Strong depth in cloud native technologies - Kubernetes, containers, serverless
* Experienced with driving alignment and cross organization collaboration; great deal of acumen
* Product and user-oriented thinking - the role requires working closely with product management to create great user experiences


**What we look for**


* Inspirational engineering leader passionate about solving problems in the cloud.
* Continuous learner curious about customer journey and customer experience.
* A collaborative mindset: someone who prioritizes the team and fosters a culture of high performance without ego.
* Self-starter with experience in defining tasks, seeking feedback, and evolving work where applicable
* Servant leader invested in people and the team's growth.


**Why work at Sysdig?**


* We're a well-funded startup that already has a large enterprise customer base
* We have a pragmatic, transparent culture, from the CEO down
* We have an organizational focus on delivering value to customers
* Our open source tools (https://sysdig.com/opensource/) are widely used and loved by technologists & developers


**When you join Sysdig, you can expect:**


* Competitive compensation, including equity opportunities.
* An international culture with employees in more than 40 countries.
* Flexible work arrangements.
* Mental well-being support for you and your family, a wellness alliance, and company-wide recharge days.
* Career growth and development opportunities.


The U.S. annual base salary range for this full-time position is between $220,000 and $275,000 USD per year. Actual offers may be higher or lower than this range based on a variety of factors, including (but not limited to) the candidate's work location, job-related skills, experience and education.



We would love for you to join us! Please reach out even if your experience doesn't perfectly match the job description. We can always explore other options after starting the conversation. Your background and passion will set you apart, especially if your career is unconventional.



Sysdig values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQIA+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. Sysdig is an equal-opportunity employer. Sysdig does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status.



#LI-JG1



#LI-Hybrid

title: Director of Engineering
description:
LevaData’s integrated, AI-powered supply management software platform transforms direct material sourcing, mitigates risks, and accelerates new product development. We power the smartest supply chains in the world by constantly analyzing business objectives against real-time market activity and community intelligence. We are trusted to deliver improved margins, control risks, generate new product velocity, and achieve multi-tier supplier engagement with purpose-built tools for quick collaboration and decisive actions. LevaData creates a competitive advantage with transformational and predictive insights. Customers include large and complex enterprise companies, as well as small- and medium-sized OEMs seeking to achieve best-in-class supply management practices.  

We are seeking a Director of Engineering to join the LevaData team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the development process, identifying areas of optimization, and scaling the LevaData platform. The candidate should have extensive experience in full-stack development, infrastructure as code (IaC), and AWS Cloud services.
### **Responsibilities**

* Lead the engineering team in designing, developing, and maintaining the LevaData platform
* Audit and identify areas for potential optimization (security, resources/tools used, and general code framework optimization)
* Manage the team's work across US (Central) and India (IST) time zones
* Utilize AWS Cloud services, AWS Quicksight, and Airflow for product development and management
* Troubleshoot technical issues and delegate tasks to the engineering team to resolve problems
* Provide mentorship and guidance to the team and support their professional development
* Communicate technical issues to executive management in a clear and understandable way
* Drive prioritization and execution of work that supports the product roadmap
* Implement infrastructure as code to streamline development and deployment processes

### **Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* 10+ years of experience in full-stack development
* Experience with AWS Cloud services and management
* Strong knowledge of AWS Quicksight
* Experience with Apache Airflow
* Ability to manage teams across different time zones and delegate tasks effectively
* Strong troubleshooting skills
* Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) practices
* Ability to translate complex development issues to logical understanding for executive management
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

**Why LevaData**  

100% work remote
Highly competitive salary and stock options
Unlimited PTO
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits programs
401(k) matching

title: Director of Service Delivery
description:
Job Title: Director of Service Delivery  
Company Name: Alpha  
Location: Eden Prairie, MN or Remote

Alpha is on the hunt for a dynamic and awe-inspiring Director of Service Delivery to join our extraordinary team. If you're ready to unleash your leadership prowess and take service delivery to unprecedented heights, this is your chance to be part of a team that is passionate about delivering excellence in service delivery.  
Alpha is a nationally recognized provider of technology solutions that makes exceptional and captivating experiences possible. We enable our clients to achieve their technology vision and deliver powerful experiences for their audiences. With over 50 years of industry experience, Alpha is the premier provider of audio visual, IPTV, and broadcast technology solutions for television stations, corporations, governments, academic institutions, and collegiate and professional sports organizations.  
If you are a driven leader with a track record of success in service delivery operations and are ready to make a significant impact, we invite you to apply for the position of Director of Service Delivery at Alpha. Let's shape the future of service delivery together!  
**Summary:**  
Alpha’s Director of Service Delivery is responsible for overseeing the successful planning, implementation, and execution of service delivery operations within the organization. This role requires strong leadership skills, strategic thinking, and a customer-centric approach to ensure exceptional service delivery and customer satisfaction. The Director of Service Delivery will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to streamline processes, drive operational efficiency, and optimize service performance.

\\*  
Responsibilities\\*

* Develop and implement strategies to enhance service delivery operations, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
* Lead and manage a team of service delivery managers and specialists, providing guidance, coaching, and fostering a culture of excellence.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess service performance, identify areas for improvement, and drive continuous enhancement.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Sales, PMO, and Engineering, to ensure seamless integration of service delivery processes and effective communication.
* Oversee the development and implementation of a Managed Services operation and ensure attainment of targets and goals.
* Identify and address service-related issues, risks, and escalations, working closely with internal stakeholders and clients to resolve them in a timely and effective manner.
* Conduct regular assessments of service delivery processes, identifying ortunities for optimization, standardization, and automation.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in service delivery, recommending and implementing innovative solutions.
* Foster a customer-centric culture throughout the organization, promoting a high level of customer satisfaction and loyalty.
* Prepare and present reports on service delivery performance, highlighting achievements, challenges, and areas requiring attention to senior management.

\\*  
Qualifications:\\*

* Proven experience in service delivery management, preferably in a leadership role.
* Strong knowledge of service delivery methodologies, best practices, and performance metrics.
* Exceptional leadership and people management skills, with a track record of building and motivating high-performing teams.
* Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on process optimization and continuous improvement.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines and delivering results.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in using data-driven insights to make informed decisions.
* Experience in working with cross-functional teams and managing client relationships.
* Familiarity with the media systems integration business, preferably in a Service Delivery capacity.

This job description outlines the primary duties and qualifications for the role of Director of Service Delivery. However, it may be subject to modification and adjustment based on the specific needs and requirements of the organization.

\\*  
Education/Experience\\*

* Bachelor's degree in business administration, management, or a related field is preferred.

**Certificates and Licenses:**

* Valid driver’s license required.
* Ability to be licensed for gaming purposes.

\\*  
Physical Demands:\\*

* Remaining in a stationary position, often sitting for prolonged periods.
* Ability to enter text or data into a computer or other machine by means of a traditional keyboard or 10-Key.
* Clarity of vision at approximately 20 inches or less (that is, working with small objects or reading small print), including use of computers.
* Ability to express or exchange ideas by means of the spoken word to impart oral information to clients or the public and to convey detailed spoken instructions to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.
* The ability to hear, understand, and distinguish speech both in person, by telephone or other technology.

\\*  
Sponsorship:\\*  
This position is not eligible for sponsorship.

\\*  
Benefits We Offer:\\*  
As Alpha strives to be a premiere provider of audio and video solutions for our clients, we also strive to be a premiere employer for our employees. We provide a full array of benefits including Medical, Dental, and Vision. We offer employer-paid Life, AD&D, Short- & Long-Term Disability. We also offer a variety of financial products to our employees including Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) for medical and dependent child/elder care, Health Savings Accounts (HSA) as well as 401k and 401k Roths. All our new full-time employees are **eligible the first day of employment**.

In addition, we offer a competitive annual time off package including holidays, vacation days, personal/sick leave days, birthday holiday, volunteer time off, and paid bereavement leave.

\\*  
Equal Opportunity:\\*  
At Alpha, we are committed to being an equal opportunity employer to all, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability (mental and physical), exercising the right to family care and medical leave, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, race, religious creed, sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), and sexual orientation.

title: Head of Engineering
description:
Vodworks began life in 2011, originally focussed in the media world, our software development team has grown significantly and now plays in additional areas such as Blockchain, Metaverse, Fintech, and many other interesting markets.  

Our journey has been impressive, starting from humble beginnings in London to a 150+ strong Global team of developers, architects, marketing, and sales.  

We build applications and platforms for some of the world's leading and cutting-edge organizations as well as assist start-ups and SMEs in their technology journey.

**About the Role:**


As the Head of Engineering, you will be responsible for leading the engineering team, driving product development, and ensuring that our solutions are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Sales, and Operations, to ensure that our solutions meet customer needs and market demands.


**Responsibilities:**


* Lead the engineering team, including hiring, coaching, mentoring, and performance management.
* Develop and implement engineering strategies and plans to meet company goals.
* Drive product development, from ideation to launch, in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
* Ensure that our solutions are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
* Manage the engineering budget and resource allocation.
* Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in the industry.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience.
* 11+ of experience in software engineering, with 4+ in a leadership role.
* Strong technical skills and knowledge of software development methodologies, tools, and technologies.
* Demonstrated success in leading high-performing engineering teams and delivering products to market.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
* Experience with the following technologies: JavaScript, AngularJS, ReactJS, NodeJS, Python, Java, MySQL, MongoDB, AWS, GCP, etc..

  

If you are passionate about technology, innovation, and delivering world-class solutions, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Director of Finance
description:
Amex GBT is a place where colleagues find inspiration in travel as a force for good and – through their work – can make an impact on our industry. We’re here to help our colleagues achieve success and offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where your voice is valued.  

Ready to explore a career path? Start your journey.
Role Overview:
Director - GBS Finance would be a senior position within Amex GBT Finance team, reporting into Vice President - GBS Finance.
This role would primarily be responsible for supporting GBS Finance operations, working with Senior Leaders across organization and partnering with cross-functional teams to deliver on Enterprise level projects. Additionally, this role includes front leading GBS Transformation projects that would demonstrate both Digital and LSS methodologies to deliver comprehensively on E2E GBS process maturity levels.
Person in this role should be able to conduct a Strategic review of existing ‘Ways of working’ and creating vision of ‘Where we want to be’ basis the Best-in-Class industry benchmark within Finance domain.
This would be an Individual contributor role, however might involve leading teams at a later stage.
What You’ll do on a Typical Day :-* Driving various Enterprise and GBS projects and initiatives within Finance
* Synergies across processes being handled from multiple Global Delivery Hubs to achieve outstanding industry benchmark
* Driving Best in class efficiency metrics and KPI framework with clear definition of Success (What, Where, How and When)
* Driving innovative solutions - Technology, Processes, Practices. Coordinated decision making with inputs from functions like Controllership, Client management, Data Analytics COE etc.
* Simplification and Stabilization of Systems and Processes


What We’re looking for :-* 15+ years of experience in handling Finance operations, people leader with proven track record to work cross-functionally
* Comfortable in dealing ambiguity, with ability to operate in an agile and dynamic environment
* Had lead knowledge management practices across GBS global delivery centres
* Excellent communication, collaboration and influencing skills, along with ability to interact effectively across all levels of the organization including the most senior leaders
* Strong financial foresight and analytical skills with an ability to work both in the detail and at strategic level
* Transformation approach with shown experience of driving high impact initiatives
* Knowledge of travel industry and working with Outsourcing providers would be an added advantage

  

Location
India - Virtual Location  

The #TeamGBT Experience
Work and life: Find your happy medium at Amex GBT.* Flexible benefits are tailored to each country and start the day you do. These include health and welfare insurance plans, retirement programs, parental leave, adoption assistance, and more.
* Travel perks: get a choice of deals each week from major travel providers on everything from flights to hotels to cruises and car rentals.
* Develop the skills you want when the time is right for you, with global tuition assistance, access to over 20,000 courses on our learning platform, leadership courses, and new job openings available to internal candidates first.
* We strive to champion Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in every aspect of our business at GBT. You can connect with colleagues through our global Inclusion Groups, centered around common identities or initiatives, to discuss challenges, obstacles, achievements, and drive company awareness and action.
* Wellbeing resources to support mental and emotional health for you and your immediate family.
* And much more!


All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to age, gender identity (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, veteran status, citizenship or marital status. It is our policy to maintain an equal-opportunity environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias for our candidates, colleagues, clients and suppliers.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Please, let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the hiring process. For more details, please consult GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement.
What if I don’t meet every requirement? If you’re passionate about our mission and believe you’d be a phenomenal addition to our team, don’t worry about “checking every box;" please apply anyway. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

title: Hire Assistant
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **About EY GDS**  

Global Delivery Services (GDS) is a dynamic and truly global delivery network. Across our six locations, we work with teams from all EY service lines, geographies and sectors, and play a vital role in the delivery of the EY growth strategy.

 **We operate from six countries and sixteen cities:**

* Argentina (Buenos Aires)
* China (Dalian)
* India (Bangalore, Chennai, Gurgaon, Hyderabad, Kochi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Noida, Trivandrum)
* Philippines (Manila)
* Poland (Warsaw and Wroclaw)
* UK (Manchester, Liverpool)

 **Careers in EY Global Delivery Services**  

Join a team of over 50,000 people, working across borders, to provide innovative and strategic business solutions to EY member firms around the world.

 **Join one of our dynamic teams**  

From accountants to coders, we offer a wide variety of fulfilling career opportunities that span all business disciplines

  

Our Consulting practice provides differentiated focus on the key business themes to help our clients solve better questions around technology. Our vision is to be recognized as a leading provider of differentiated technology consulting services, harnessing new disruptive technology, alliances and attracting talented people to solve our clients' issues. It's an exciting time to join us and grow your career as a technology professional. A technology career is about far more than leading-edge innovations. It’s about the application of these technologies in the real world to make a real, meaningful impact. We are looking for highly motivated, articulate individuals who have the skills to the technology lifecycle and are passionate about designing innovative solutions to solve complex business problems.

 **Your career in Consulting can span across these technology areas/ services lines:**

**Digital Technologies:** We are a globally integrated digital architecture and engineering team. Our mission is to deliver tailored, custom-built end to end solutions to our customers that are Digital, Cloud Native and Open Source. Our skills include Experience design, UI development, Design Thinking, Architecture & Design, Full stack development (.Net/ Java/ SharePoint/ Power Platform), Emerging Technologies like Block Chain, IoT, AR\\VR, Drones, Cloud and DevSecOps. We use industrialized techniques, built on top of agile methods utilizing our global teams to deliver end to end solutions at best unit cost proposition.

 **Testing Services:** We are the yardstick of quality software product. We break something to make the product stronger and successful. We provide entire gamut of testing services including Busines / User acceptance testing. Hence this is a team with all round skills such as functional, technical and process.

 **Data & Analytics:** Data and Analytics is amongst the largest and most versatile practices within EY. Our sector and domain expertise combined with technical skills in data, cloud, advanced analytics and artificial intelligence differentiates us in the industry. Our talented team possesses cross-sector and cross-domain expertise and a wide array of skills in Information Management (IM), Business Intelligence (BI), Advance Analytics (AA) and Artificial Intelligence (AI)

 **Oracle:** We provide one-stop solution for end-to-end project implementation enabled by Oracle and IBM Products. We use proven methodologies, tools and accelerators to jumpstart and support large Risk and Finance Transformation. We develop solutions using various languages such as SQL or PL/ SQL, Java, Java Script, Python, IBM Maximo and other Oracle Utilities. We also provide consulting services for streamlining the current reporting process using various Enterprise Performance Management tools.

 **SAP:** By building on SAP’s S/4HANA digital core and cloud services, EY and SAP are working to help organizations leverage industry-leading technologies to improve operational performance. This collaboration helps drive digital transformation for our clients across areas including finance, human resources, supply chain and procurement. Our goal is to support clients as they initiate or undergo major transformation. Our capabilities span end-to-end solution implementation services from strategy and architecture to production deployment. EY supports clients in three main areas, Technology implementation support, Enterprise and Industry application implementation, Governance Risk Compliance (GRC) Technology.

 **Banking and Capital Market Services:** Banking and Capital Market Services companies are transforming their complex tax and finance functions with technologies such as AI and ML. With the right blend of core competencies, tax and finance personnel will shift to data, process and technology skills to service global clients on their Core Banking Platforms and support their business / digital transformation like Deposit system replacements, lending / leasing modernization, Cloud–native architecture (Containerization) etc.

 **Wealth and Asset Management:** We help our clients thrive in a transformative age by providing innovative services to global and domestic asset management clients to increase efficiency, effectiveness and manage the overall impact on bottom line profitability by leveraging the technology, data and digital teams. We do many operational efficiency programs and Technology Enabled Transformation to re-platform their front and Back offices with emerging technologies like AI, ML, Blockchain etc.

 **Insurance Transformation:** The current changing Macroeconomic trends continue to challenge Insurers globally. However, with disruptive technologies – including IoT, autonomous vehicles, Blockchain etc, we help companies through these challenges and create innovative strategies to transform their business through technology enabled transformation programs. We provide end to end services to Global P&C (General), Life and Health Insurers, Reinsurers and Insurance brokers.

**Cyber Security:** The ever-increasing risk and complexity surrounding cybersecurity and privacy has put cybersecurity at the top of the agenda for senior management, the Board of Directors, and regulators. We help our clients to understand and quantify their cyber risk, prioritize investments, and embed security, privacy and resilience into every digitally-enabled initiative – from day one.

 **Technology Risk:** A practice that is a unique, industry-focused business unit that provides a broad range of integrated services where you’ll contribute technically to IT Risk and Assurance client engagements and internal projects. An important part of your role will be to actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships. You’ll also identify potential business opportunities for EY within existing engagements and escalate these as appropriate. Similarly, you’ll anticipate and identify risks within engagements and share any issues with senior members of the team.

 **Behavioral Competencies:**

* Adaptive to team and fosters collaborative approach
* Innovative approach to the project, when required
* Shows passion and curiosity, desire to learn and can think digital
* Agile mindset and ability to multi-task
* Must have an eye for detail

 **Skills needed:**

* Should have understanding and/or experience of software development best practices and software development life cycle
* Understanding of one/more programming languages such as Java/ .Net/ Python, data analytics or databases such as SQL/ Oracle/ Teradata etc.
* Internship in a relevant technology domain will be an added advantage

 **Qualification:**

* BE - B. Tech / (IT/ Computer Science/ Circuit branches)
* Should have secured 60% and above
* No active Backlogs

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  

  

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  

  

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Education Director
description:
India Autism Center is searching for an Education Director. The Education Director would be in charge of one of the three verticals of India Autism Center, i.e., the Training Academy. In addition, the Education Director will lead in establishing and overseeing all operating systems to support the planning, management, and delivery of the Academy's vision.

  

The vision of the IAC's Training Academy is to create an experienced, trained, and specialized task force. Moreover, the training academy aims to turn students into employable professionals nationally and internationally to serve the needs and demands of mental health.

  

The training academy is vital to serving the needs of India Autism Center's comprehensive campus at Sirakol. The Education Director is responsible for plugging in resources (preferably) from the Training Academy to fill responsible roles of the Clinical organizational chart at Samavesh, the comprehensive residential campus at Sirakol.

 **Roles & Responsibilities:**

 **Developing the Academy:** The Education Director is responsible for

* Creating the philosophies that the Academy will stand by
* Developing organizational policies, principles, and procedures required for its effective administration
* Ensuring that the policies are effectively practiced by putting systems that allow for it
* Authenticating the Academy's formal status by bringing in credible affiliation from national and international boards of education

**Networking:**

* Build professional relationships - Bring in partnerships from reputed institutions around the globe.
* End-to-end communication - Develop a communication strategy to be engaged with our collaborations.

**Conceptually Creating the Curricula:** The Education Director will be responsible for

* Monitor progress of new and existing teaching methods.
* Integrating curricula that is relevant to the job market of social sciences today.
* Supervising the faculty requirement for rolling out the curricula decided upon.

**Executing the Curricula:**

* Vetting and Onboarding - prospective teachers and other staff
* Bringing Short Term and Long term partnerships/affiliations - for courses, workshops, diplomas, degrees, etc.
* Admissions - strategizing branding and marketing that will lead to excellent turnout for the programs offered at the training academy.
* Digital reach of our programs - building a good online presence through educational platforms like Youtube, offering online courses etc

 **Ensuring Placements:**

* The education director must also partner with employers to ensure that the percentage of students who graduate from our Academy are placed in jobs of their choice.

 **Requirements:**

**Professional Knowledge and Experience:**

* Advanced university degree from an accredited educational institution in education, organizational development, and management, social sciences, or related field;
* At least ten years of work experience in international education program management, coordination, or advisory role at an accredited university, governmental or international organization, of which at least (preferably) five years must be at the international level, outside one's home country.
* Excellent command of spoken and written English.

 **Competencies:**

* Experience in planning, monitoring, implementing, and coordinating courses from the ground up in the field of education.
* The ability to think strategically and develop and manage the Training Academy.
* The ability to establish networks in a multicultural environment and drive cross-sectional partnerships where necessary.
* Sensitive to neurodiversity and respect for diversity.
* Build teams and drive them to bring about the vision of the Academy by motivating them and setting clear expectations and goals.
* Strong interpersonal skills.

 **Desirable Competencies:**

* Speak and read Hindi or Bengali
* Work experience in a range of global settings
* Political awareness

 **Additional Information**


The Education Director will be willing to relocate to Kolkata and be in good health to travel around when necessary.

  

Joining Date: ASAP

 **To Apply**

**Email:**

  

Resume and Cover Letter


2 Letters of Recommendations


Jaishankar Natarajan


Chief Executive Officer


India Autism Center


jai@indiaautismcenter.org

 **To know more about India Autism Center:**

  

Go here - indiaautismcenter.org

title: Associate Director
description:
393677BR
**Associate Director, Data Management**
=======================================


India
**About the role**


Location: Hyderabad  

  

This role is responsible for ensuring that enterprise data management guidelines, processes, capabilities, and controls are effectively implemented through the strategic programs scope of activity to drive the value of data into the programs. This person acts to drive a ‘data lifecycle’ perspective through coordinating multi-functional and cross data domain decision making aligned with Enterprise standards
  

  

Your responsibilities include but not are limited
  

  

* Main responsibility of data management, process management and adoption of EDM data practices in the business domains, data programs
* Responsible for clear definition of data lifecycle processes and facilitate implementation of the data lifecycle through appropriate guidelines, playbooks creation
* Responsible for education, training, guidance and adoption of data lifecycle processes, frameworks and controls across strategic programs in alignment with the enterprise and domain data strategies
* Critical liaison between enterprise data team and the strategic programs in ensuring that the enterprise data management principles are embedded and adopted across domains Work with the teams in collection, analysis and reporting the metrics for data governance, strategy etc. in all areas of data management across domains
* Exercises clear and informed decision-making using processes transparent to customers for data related topics, keeping in touch with every partner regularly. Facilitating meetings for the senior customers & teams (preparing, moderation and post processing). Holding retrospectives to refine approach.
* Responsible for integration and alignment with enterprise business process excellence workstream to facilitate data management in driving business outcomes
* Partners with data lead(s) in strategic programs to drive the implementation of mature data management processes and capabilities aligned to Enterprise-level efforts. Key areas of focus include data modeling, master and reference data management, data cataloging, data quality management, and data publishing.
* Acts as data governance and data management domain expert for the strategic program and ensures implementation data controls, manages exceptions and critical issues. Support the program management, literacy and change management agenda of the EDM organization

  

**Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:**


*We are committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.*
**Role Requirements**


* 15+ years of relevant experience in Data Management & Data Strategy, with at least 2 years in Pharma/Healthcare.
* In-depth experience of data governance /information management practices, systems and processes including data governance, data modelling, master data management, meta-data management, data quality management
* Ability to build strong and trusted relationships with senior level business and technical partners. Strong Data modelling experience is desired. Experience with ERP implementations in a large, multi-national environment
* Strong business process savvy, with focus on business processes enabled in ERP platforms
* Workflow capability that operationalises the data supply chain and data usage across the data ecosystem and the manner in which users/applications interact with system
* Data Quality and profiling capability to help identify and govern condition of a set of values of qualitative or quantitative variables.
* Understand data Ownership capability for applying quality control field to assessing, managing, using, improving, monitoring, maintaining, and protecting organizational information.
* Cross-industry experience highly preferred. 4+ years of international experience working with Global teams

  

Why consider Novartis?  

  

Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us!
  

Learn more here:
  

  

https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture  

  

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:
  

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams' representative of the patients and communities we serve.
